loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old and married to a 50 year old man named Armando V.. The couple was blessed with three children - two boys and one girl. The couple lives with their children in a semi-rural area of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela. Their children are very responsible, obedient and helpful. The two boys are their helpers in their furniture shop during weekends, while their daughter helps with the household chores. 

Even though they have a furniture business, their income is not enough to sustain all their daily needs, and that’s why Evelyn start a small piggery in their backyard to provide additional income. But Evelyn needs more funds for the feed supply of her pigs, and that’s why she is asking for some financial assistance from ASKI. She is asking for a loan of PHP12,000.00 to buy more feed supply for her pigs. She wants to make her pigs healthy, so that if she sells them, she will be able to earn more income. With her income, she will be able to help her husband in providing for their family's needs, especially the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: To buy more feed supply.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
A furniture business is the source of income for Jane A. and her husband. Jane is 47 years old and married to Ruben A.. They live happily and peacefully in the village of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela. The couple is always dreaming of having a good and comfortable life. According to them, “poverty is not the reason for not achieving their dreams, poverty is only a challenge for them to move forward and follow their dreams.”

The couple strives hard and sacrifices a lot to make their business sustainable and more productive. But their income is not enough to maintain their business and to provide for all their needs. Thus, Jane asked for financial assistance from ASKI to improve and expand their business. She is requesting a loan of PHP20,000.00 to buy more wood and other materials to make more furniture, be able to sell more to their customers, and thus increase their income. The loan will be a big help to their business expansion and make it more profitable. They believe that through their patience, they can achieve their dreams in life.

loans.use: To buy more wood and other materials for their furniture business.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida B. is married to Manuel B. who works as a farmer. They are blessed with five children. The couple lives with their children in the village of Dummon, Quezon, Isabela. Their only source of income is their small "sari-sari" store (a typical store in the village). The couple is wishing to send their children to school and to pursue their education.

Leonida needs additional capital for her store in order to increase her income, and for this reason, she is requesting a loan amounting to Php 12,000 for the expansion of her business. She wants to buy more products for her store in order to earn more profit. In that way, they will be able to attain all their goals in life.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Ulziisaihan

texts.en:
Ulziisaihan B. lives with her husband and three sons in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two older sons go to a local high school and the youngest son stays home with his father.

Ulziisaihan has a small retail business selling fruits and fruit products. She had experience in fruit and fruits products while growing up with her family in Arhanghay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. She currently rents a small stall and sells fruits and fruit products that she purchases from "Bars" wholesale market in Ulaanbaatar. Her business is the main source of her family’s income.

She hopes to raise her children well and make sure that they receive a good education without financial strain. She requests a loan to purchase more fruits and fruit products from the wholesale market to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and fruits products

loans.name: Damdinragchaa

texts.en:
Damdinragchaa D. lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family moved from Arhanghay province to Ulaanbaatar, like many other migrating families who are in search of a better life. His two sons are both university students in Ulaanbaatar.

Dambinragchaa makes various horse saddles for herders who use horses for transportation. Dambinragchaa is a skilled saddle maker with dozens of years of experience under his belt. After the move to the capital city, he started making various saddles and rented a stall in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, to sell his saddles. His income from the saddle-making business is the main source of income for his family.

He hopes to be able to support his two sons' university education and pay their tuitions on time until they graduate. Damdinragchaa is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials for his saddle-making business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his saddle-making business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married to a tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) driver named Dante F.. They are blessed with four children who are all currently studying in their village. The couple lives with their children in a simple way of life in the rural village of Dumon Quezon, Isabela. Lydia and her family are helping each other for the progress of their livelihood. She and her husband are both hard-working and very patient to be able to have a better future.

Lydia and her husband have a business of tricycle transport in their village. And they don’t have enough funds for maintaining their business, that’s why she is requesting to take out a loan from ASKI amounting to PHP15,000 for the maintenance of their tricycle transport business.

According to Lydia, they were not able to cover all their family’s necessities, and for this reason, some of the loan will be used to start a small vending business to have additional income. She is hoping that through the help of the lenders, they will be able to earn more profit.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
San Roque, Burgos, Isabela is where Lilia B. lives. She is already 26 years old and married to Wilfred B., 25 years old. They are blessed with one child named Peter Justine, 4 years old. She lives happily and peacefully with her family and parents since they are still living with them because they don’t have their own house yet.

Lilia enjoys managing her direct selling business of NATASHA, MSE and AVON cosmetic products. According to her, she will work hard in order to achieve all her goals in life such as living a progressive life, building their simple dream house and sending her son to school. Her desire to increase her capital in direct selling made her decide to request a loan amounting to PHP 5,000. The loan will be used to purchase more products to be able to acquire many customers. Lilia wants to make her business more productive in order to earn more profit thus making all her dreams possible.

loans.use: buy more products to sell

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando I. is a man full of courage in life. At the age of 40, and being the head of the family, he serves as breadwinner for his family. They live simply and happily in Barangay Santiago of Reina Mercedez, Isabela. He is married to Fely, his wife, and they always help each other to improve both their farming and general store in their village. They have been blessed with only one son named Fernando I., Jr. They hope that through their income from farming and through their store, they will be able to provide the basic necessities of daily living, especially the schooling of their son. They hope that their son will make good in his studies in order to become a successful person in the future.

Fernando dreams of expanding his business so that he will be able to continue sending his son to school and have him finish college someday. In hopes of achieving this dream, he mentioned that he will continue to work hard to make his business productive. He wanted to access the benefits of joining the program of ASKI and expects to enjoy his membership.

At present, Fernando is asking to borrow PHP 7,000 as additional capital for the improvement of his general store. He wants to buy additional products in order to increase his profit. The loan will be a big help to make his business more progressive, thus making his dreams possible to achieve.

loans.use: buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. lives in a rural area of Dummon Quezon, Isabela. She describes their place as mountainous and they have rough road conditions. She has three children; two have already graduated from college and the youngest, unfortunately wasn't able to finish high school. 

Maria A. maintains a typical village store in their simple village and she is hoping to take out a loan from ASKI amounting to PHP 15,000 to have an additional working capital for her store. She hopes to improve her store by purchasing more products and to add stock to be able to minimize time and fare consumption going to and from the market of Roxas, Isabela. With the lenders financial support, she will be able to prosper despite their poor living situation and to earn more profit from her business.

loans.use: buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia N. is a resident of Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 36 and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter and his work is their main source of income but is not enough for them. She joined Paglaum MPC  to acquire start-up capital in the amount of Php 12,000 for her fish-selling business. As per records, she has been a trusted borrower of PAGLAUM.

loans.use: Purchase fresh fish every day for retail purposes

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Managing a small piggery in their backyard is the source of income of Marilyn. Aside from that, her husband is engaged also in running a small store that adds to their earnings. Marilyn is married to Roger S. and they are blessed with four children. The couple lives together with their children in the village of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela.

Marilyn and her husband are working hand in hand just to give their best to provide the needs of their children. Marilyn wants to have good living conditions and a successful business. She also wishes to send her children to school and be able to finish college courses someday.

With all this in mind, Marilyn is asking for financial assistance from the lenders to be able to improve her business and to earn more profit. She wishes to access a loan amounting to Php 15,000 to be able to buy additional piglets to raise and more feed to increase the weight of the pigs to make them sell at a higher price. She also wants to improve the pig pens for her pigs to provide them with more comfort. The loan will be a big help to make all her dreams come true and to give them more profit.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion L. is a 36-year-old woman from Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 kids. Her husband is a fisherman. Having started her sari-sari (variety) store from a meager capital, she coped well with the challenges of her business. The small business is doing so well that she has confidently decided to expand.

She has joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to avail herself of loans. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to additionally capitalize her business. She is determined to maintain a good credit standing whatever may happen, so she can always turn to the cooperative in the future. She envisions acquiring an additional market stall. She dreams also of renovating their little house and of starting saving now for the education of their children

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta B., a 32-year-old resident of Lawis Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, is married to a fisherman. Because it was hard for them to survive if only her husband was working, Crisanta started a sari-sari (mini-grocery) store with a small amount of capital. Their primary customers are their neighbors, and the resulting income finances the daily needs of the family.  

Through the assistance of Paglaum Cooperative, Crisanta was able to previously avail herself of a loan, meeting the repayment schedule religiously. She is now requesting another loan of PHP 50,000 to finance the purchase of additional stocks for her sari-sari store and is looking forward to someday expanding it into a Mini-mart.

loans.use: To purchase stocks for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita N. is 54 years old and lives at Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has 6 children. She has been faced with many challenges. Her husband is a fisherman.

Mercedita is a business-minded person. The business runs smoothly and has become her primary source of income. 

She heard of Paglaum MPC and decided to join. She has taken several loans already and has expanded her business successfully. Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 7,000  ($150 US) to purchase additional ready to wear clothes to sell. In the future, Mercedita wants to operate a big store.

loans.use: To purchase RTW (ready to wear) clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima G. lives peacefully in the village of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela. She is blessed with only one child, named Orlando. Her child is very loving and obedient to her. Maxima works hard and always does her best in order to provide a good life for her child. She always prays that she will be able to send her child to so that he will  be able to finish a college course someday.

Maxima manages a small Sari-sari store in their village which serves as her source of income to provide the basic needs for their daily living. She needs additional capital for the expansion of her store in order to increase her income. In this regard, she wishes to apply for a loan amounting to PHP 5, 000 ($125 US) to be able to purchase more products to sell in her store. More inventory will allow her to increase her profit, thus she will be able to save funds for the schooling of her child.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell in Sari-sari store.

loans.name: Blandina

texts.en:
Blandina is from the village of Minanga Norte in Iguig, Cagayan. She is married to Ruben, 39 years old, who serves as Barangay Captain in their village. They are blessed with four children: Mark Dave, 14 years old, Mark Anthony, 13 years old, Jonas, 4 years old and Ruben, 5 years old. They are all attending their classes in a public high school and elementary school in their town. 

Blandina and her husband are working together in maintaining their Van transport business. Their van is used to travel to and from their village to Tuguegarao City and to Solana, Cagayan. Blandina is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 3,000 ($75 US) only to be used for the general maintenance of their Van transport business. The loan will be of great help in order to improve the running condition of their van to satisfy their passengers. She hopes that through the earnings from their business, they will be able to send their children to school and someday they will finish their college courses.

loans.use: general maintenance of van transport business.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is an energetic general store owner in Barangay Alibago of Enrile, Cagayan. Felisa is married to Joel, who operates the bakery shop located in their house. The couple works hard to secure the future of their children, who are currently studying. They have always wanted their children to be able to finish their college education so that they may have a better future.

Felisa sells different grocery items that meet her customers’ demands and other basic commodities for families. Her small business serves as her source of income which really is a great help to her family. For almost 9 years in the business, Felisa has learned a lot about how to manage her income and how to spend money wisely. She also believes that patience and hard work are the best attitudes to have in order to become a successful businessperson. 

Once a week she purchases, in the city of Tuguegarao, the products for her store . Currently, her business is doing well but Felisa still wants to improve it and to make it grow.  She wants to borrow  PHP25,000 ($525 US) so that she can buy additional grocery items for her store. With what she earns daily from her business, she has been able to provide some of the basic needs for her family, especially her children. This loan will really help her business to expand, thus, earning more profit.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando supports his family through maintaining his meat vending business that is located in the wet market of Cauayan City. He is 37 years old and married to Carlene. His wife is used to accompanying him in their meat vending stall in the market. They have been blessed with only one child, Ruth Anne T.. She is 11 years old and currently in the elementary level of education. Their family currently resides in Barangay San Fermin of Cauayan City. 

Fernando keeps on striving hard to provide for the family’s needs and especially to send their child to school. He simply remembers that when he started their meat vending business, he opened it with very little capital and through their patience and hard work, it has continued growing. Fernando wants to borrow PHP 15,000 ($325 US) to further improve his business and to earn more profit. He also shares that his family must learn to economize in order to become more productive in their business.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for his meat vending business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is 52 years old and makes a living running a small store. She is married to Ernesto A., who is 61 years old. They live happily in Junction, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya near their three children, Ricky, 38 years old, Rey, 35 years old and Ernesto A. Jr., 30 years old.  All are married. The couple works hard to pay their bills and extend support to their grandchildren, who are already in school. 

Erlinda used to do her selling from a cart, but now sells in a market because that is much more profitable. She sells vegetables, fruits and ready-made snacks. Erlinda is applying for a loan so that she can expand her business by buying more items to sell. She has a strong faith, and is determined to improve her standard of living by making good use of this loan. She puts her approach to life this way: “Success is never ending, and failure is never final.”

loans.use: buy more products to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros T. is 47 years old and blessed with three children. Her family lives in the peaceful village of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela. Milagros is very loving and responsible mother who puts her all into making her children happy. She dreams of sending all of them to school so that they can one day go to and finish college. According to her, the greatest gift that she can give them is education. She works hard to provide this and other necessities.

Milagros runs a small-hog raising business in her backyard that serves as her family's source of income. But money is tight at the moment, which is why she is applying for a loan to buy more piglets to raise, and enough feed to make sure they are content and healthy. She hopes this will allow her to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia H. lives with her family in the peaceful village of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela. Ofelia runs a small business raising pigs in her backyard -- her only source of income. Most of the people in her village also raise pigs in order to provide for their needs. Ofelia works hard to stay ontop of her business and meet the needs of her family. But she doesn’t have enough capital to make her business larger, or run better and more efficiently.

She has applied for a loan to buy additional piglets, along with feed and vitamins to ensure that they are healthy and fetch a good price. Her goals are to improve her family's living conditions and send her children to college so they can have a bright future. Ofelia believes that through her sacrifices and strong faith to God, she can attain all of her goals in life.

loans.use: buy more piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia H. lives with her family in a peaceful village of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela. Ofelia has a small business of piggery in their backyard that serves as her only source of income. Most of the people in their village are engage in hog raising business as their source of income in order to provide their needs in their daily living. Ofelia works hard to maintain her business and to sustain the daily needs of her family. But she doesn’t have enough capital in order to improve her piggery into a progressive one.

Then, she learned about ASKI, she is now asking to avail a loan amounting to Php6, 000.00. The loan proceeds will be use to buy additional piglets to be raised and also some feeds supply and vitamins to make her pigs healthy, thus it may increase its price if she sells to the buyer. She wants to make her piggery profitable and make it productive. Because she wants to improve their living condition into a more better one. She also dreams to provide good education for her children to have them a brighter future. Ofelia always believes that through her sacrifices and strong faith to God, she can attain all her goals in life.

loans.use: buy more piglets and feeds

loans.name: Pepito

texts.en:
Pepito B. is a driver who also makes a living buying and selling wood. Her wife Rosemarie lives overseas, earning a living that helps the family survive. They have two children in elementary school.

Mr. B. and his wife want nothing more than to send their children to college, and have applied for this loan to expand his business. The money will help them keep their children in school, and allow him to make necessary repairs to his vehicle.

loans.use: to expand his business and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is married to Jessie T. who works as a tricycle driver in their village. The couple is blessed with five healthy children. Petronila lives with her husband and children in the village of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela. Her husband’s income in the tricycle transport business is their primary source of income. Aside from that, Petronila sells different kinds of vegetables in their village to be able to help her husband in earning more income. Together, their income is not enough to sustain the daily needs of their family, especially the educational needs of their children. Thus, she wants to have a hog raising business in order to have additional income to survive well. 

Petronila wants to ask ASKI to provide them enough funds to maintain and expand their business. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 ($250 US) to be used for the general repair of their tricycle. This will help to have the tricycle in good running condition to satisfy their passengers. The excess amount will be used to purchase additional vegetables for her to sell. Also, some of the loan will be utilized to buy some piglets and feed supply for her hog raising business. The loan will be of great help in making their business become more productive and it will help them to earn more profit. Petronila believes that through her sacrifices and faith in God, she will attain her desires in life.

loans.use: To repair the tricycle, to purchase vegetables to sell, to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 60 years old, married and has been blessed with six children who are all married and live separately from them. Her husband, Pedro, is already 64 years old and works as a local farmer in their village. Farming is the major source of their income.

Estrella is engaged in selling clothes, which adds to their income. She roams house to house in their village and in nearby villages to sell different clothes for men and women. Often, she goes to the distant place of Baggao, Cagayan where she is able to sell the most. From their business, Estrella is able to earn around PHP 2,000 (~$40) daily. She is thankful that she is able to maintain her business and through this, she is able to support the education of her grandchildren, who live with them. Estrella is active in developing her business and she is requesting to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 17,000 ($375 US). The loan will serve as additional capital to expand her business. She believes that by entrusting everything to God is the best step to succeed in every life’s endeavor.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for clothing sales

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial tiene 27 años de edad, está casado hace 2 años y tiene un hijo.

          Se dedica a la activación, venta y reparación de aparatos celulares de diversos tipos. Cuenta con un local alquilado que funciona hace 5 años en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad. También recibe el apoyo económico de su madre quien es docente jubilada. En su negocio vende también repuestos y accesorios para celulares que son muy solicitados por su numerosa clientela. Además realiza servicios de mini cargas (servicio de recarga de saldos a celulares).
        Es un joven muy responsable y sacrificado que ha logrado salir adelante en base a esfuerzos y trabajo constante.
       En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para la compra de más aparatos celulares de manera a poder aumentar el stock de sus mercaderías.
texts.en:
Marcial is 27 years old, has been married for two years, and has a son. He has a business activating, selling, and repairing various kinds of cellular phones. For five years, he has had a rented stall in a well-located area of the city. He also has financial support from his mother, who is a retired teacher. Marcial also sells spare parts and accessories in his shop, which are in very high demand from customers. In addition, he recharges the balances of cell phones.

Marcial is a very responsible and self-sacrificing young man who has gotten ahead through his own efforts and hard work. He is requesting a loan to purchase more cell phones so that he can increase his stock on hand.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cellular phones

loans.name: Ludio

texts.es:
Ludio tiene 34 años de edad y vive en pareja con Agustina de 28 años de edad. Hace 4 años que comparten el mismo hogar y tienen un hijo de 5 años de edad.

Ludio es técnico en refrigeración, aprendió la profesión de un hermano que también se dedica a lo mismo, hasta que logró independizarse y montar su propio taller.

Ludio repara todo tipo de electrodomésticos como: heladeras, acondicionadores de aire, congeladoras, etc. Hoy día su taller propio funciona en su domicilio y su compañera, que es ama de casa, le acompaña día a día colaborando con los trabajos del hogar.

Comenta que tiene buena clientela bien formada y gracias a las ganancias obtenidas pudo hacerse de casa propia  y a la vez comprar todos los muebles y electrodomésticos necesarios para amoblarla.

En esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para construcción debido a que está ampliando su vivienda y necesita de dinero para invertirlo en dicha construcción.  Ludio quiere ampliar su propio taller en su casa.
texts.en:
Ludio is 34 years old and lives with his partner Agustina, who is 28. They have lived together for four years and have a 5-year-old son.

Ludio is a refrigeration technician. He learned this skill from his brother, who is in the same business. Ludio worked with his brother until he was able to start his own shop.

Ludio repairs all types of home appliances, such as freezers, air conditioners, and refrigerators. Today, he has a shop in his own home, and his partner, who is a homemaker, helps him out with household chores every day.

Ludio has a solid client base and thanks to his earnings has been able to purchase his own home and furnish it with all the necessary furniture and appliances.

He would like to build an addition to his house, and so he is requesting a loan to invest in its construction. Ludio wants to increase the size of his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make an addition to his home shop

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Preparing and cooking different kind of meals for breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacks is the daily routine for Wilson C., a male entrepreneur in San Roque, Burgos, Isabela. He also sells fish and meat in a vending stall near their house. Wilson is 36 years old, married to Margie, 35 years old, and they have been blessed with children who are studying in the elementary and high schools. 

Their current family situation is simple and so far, according to Wilson, there are no problems encountered in terms of health. He promises to work hard and to tighten their belts so that his family will achieve their goals in life. He hopes to develop their business so that they will be able to support the education of their children until college. In this regard, Wilson is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 ($225 US). The loan will be used to improve the vending business in their village. The loan will be of great help to be able to buy additional products to sell in his store. Also, he wants to purchase more ingredients in order to cook more kinds of meals. This will enable him to earn more profit and be able to provide, for his family, most of their needs.

loans.use: buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana and her husband are engaged in fishing to earn for the daily living of their family. Victoriana is 46 years old and she resides, with her family, in Barangay Minanga Norte somewhere in Iguig, Cagayan. She has two children: Irene, 25 years old, works as a saleslady in Tuguegarao City and Ailene, 19 years old, is presently a second-year college student. Victoriana and her husband sacrifice a lot so they can continue sending their youngest child to school so that someday she will be able to finish college. 

Ailene, their youngest, is a working student in order to support her studies and to lessen her parents’ sacrifices. Victoriana sells the fish, caught by her husband, in their village. She roams around their village or goes to the market of Iguig to sell the fish. Her husband is a fisherman and she assists him in providing for the family’s basic needs. Victoriana is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 ($250US) to buy fish nets to make her husband's fishing easier. The loan will be of great help to increase their income. That amount will really help them to improve their daily finances.

loans.use: To buy more fish nets to be used in fishing.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria D. resides peacefully in San Roque, Burgos, Isabela and she has been blessed with seven children. Supporting her seven children with their studies and ambitions in life is not an easy task, says Victoria. This is why she patiently works hard and sacrifices a lot in order to provide her children with the necessities. She is glad that some of her children are already finished their college courses. Victoria still strives hard to further provide her other children with a brighter future by continuing to send them to school.

The income from their tricycle transport business is not enough to support her family’s basic needs. Victoria hopes that she will able to increase her capital to improve her business. Recently, Victoria learned about ASKI. Upon learning their objectives in the community, she joined ASKI’s lending program. She is asking to borrow PHP 10,000 ($225 US). She will use the money to expand their current business into a general store business. The loan will also be used to make general repairs for their tricycle transport business to make its performance in good condition, thus acquiring many customers. They will be able to earn more and start their general store business. Eventually they will have an additional source of income.

loans.use: general repair of tricycle for transport business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresita R. is already 46 years old and she is from Barangay Santiago Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She is married to Basilio R., 59 years old, who is a humble farmer in their village. They are blessed with three children: Jeffrey (a security guard), Sheryl Myla (a fourth year college student), and Archie (a second year college student). Teresita works hard because her children need more financial assistance to be able to finish their college studies. 

Teresita and her husband manage a transportation business as their source of income. Teresita believes that through their business, they can save their earnings and provide for their basic needs and other commodities. She is very much willing to improve their transport business, which will help uplift their living situation. But they don’t have enough capital to invest towards its improvement. Thus, she wants to borrow a loan, amounting to PHP7, 000.00, which will be used towards the maintenance (general repair) of their motorcycle in order to keep it in good condition.  This will enable them to acquire many customers and thus increase their income. She also wishes that she will able to have a retail business someday to further support her family's daily needs.

loans.use: motorcycle repair

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a loving housewife of Angel G.. They raise their family in the rural area of Barangay Nangalisan, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. They have been blessed with two children, who are presently studying. Their children are Angelo Simon, 17 years old and a college sophomore, and Allan, 14 years old and a sophomore in high school. Teresita is hoping that her two children will someday finish college. 

She manages their small sari-sari store (village store) at home. She is selling different goods and commodities for her neighbors. She wants to borrow additional business capital, amounting to PHP 13,000, from lenders for her to develop her store and earn more profit. Her desire to increase her daily income has motivated her to ask for a loan.  This will enable her to sustain her children's education. She wants to improve her store by converting it into a mini grocery store so that she will satisfy her customer’s needs. 

Teresita is doing her best in order to meet her ambitions in life and she also believes that by patience and hard work, she can able to achieve all her desires in life.

loans.use: to improve her store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 35 years old and happily married to Edmundo, 41 years old, who is an ordinary carpenter in their village. The couple has been blessed with three children; two are still under their care and one is already married and now lives separately. The couple and their two children live in Barangay Minanga Sur Iguig, Cagayan.

Teresita has a small hog raising business that serves as her source of income. She sells the pigs in a slaughter house in Solana, Cagayan, which is the pig buying station in their area. To maintain her business Teresita needs more capital. She is hoping to borrow a loan of around PHP7,000 to purchase more feed for her hogs to make them grow healthy. The loan will be a big help to earn more income for Teresita so she can provide for all her family's needs.

Teresita also assists her husband in planting rice, peanuts, and watermelon twice a year. She really works hard for the welfare of her family. She hopes to maintain her business and make it more progressive in order to provide her family a good living condition.

loans.use: To buy more feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Sotera

texts.en:
"In everything you do, you must always put God first," says Sotera J.. She and her family live in the distant and poor village of San Vicente, Quirino, Isabela. Her husband Salvador is a common farmer in their village and they have been blessed with two children who are presently in school. Marvin, 16 years old, is a high school student and Marjun, 11 years old, is an elementary student. Sotera is happy because her two children are very obedient and responsible. She hopes that they may grow responsible and healthy all the time.

Sotera is engaged in the hog raising business which serves as her source of income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7000 that she will use to purchase hybrid piglets and pig feed, and to make her business more productive. She sells her full grown hogs for PHP 3000 per hog. Her business is profitable and that is why she always sacrifices a lot to earn more income. One of her dreams is to improve their way of living and always have a healthy life. She knows that she will become successful in any business if she works hard and believes in God's wisdom.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel P. is already 39 years old. He lives in the village of Minanga Sur in Iguig, Cagayan with his loving wife and three children: Sherwin, 18 years old, a high school graduate, next is Jojo, 13 years old, a first year high school student, and Sheila, 7 years old, who attends a public grade school in their village.

Samuel earns his income from his hog raising business. He uses his business to support his family with sufficient necessities. Samuel wants to have a progressive and healthy family lifestyle so he would like to borrow a loan of PHP 5000. He will use the loan to buy additional piglets and feed supplies for his livestock.

Samuel also hopes to have other sources of income aside from his hog raising business to further meet his family's needs. He dreams of increasing his income so he can provide his children a good education so they will have a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Revelyn

texts.en:
Revelyn Z. manages a small general store in her village where she sells merchandise at retail prices. She is 46-years old and married to a good man, named Franco Z., who is 52-years old and works as a simple farmer in their village. They were gifted with only one child, named Aileen Z., who is 23-years old and has graduated as a teacher. Their family resides peacefully in San Roque, Burgos, Isabela. Revelyn and her husband work hard to make their business profitable. Their child used to help them in the store.

Revelyn wants to borrow 22,000 PHP from the lenders for business development. Revelyn also wants to add an extra source of income such as selling fish, meat and vegetables in their store. Revelyn and her family are patiently sacrificing to sustain their business which provides well for their farming and family needs.

loans.use: To expand a general store

loans.name: Rosefina

texts.en:
Rosefina is a franchise dealer of Avon cosmetics, Natasha and Tupperware products in their village. She earns 25% commission on every 100 pesos of products sold. She lives in Barangay Minanga Sur of Iguig Cagayan. Rosefina is 49-years old and married to Edgar B. who works as a simple carpenter in their village. They are blessed with two children. The elder is Rocky, 25-years old and already married, while the younger is Rachelle, 19-years old and presently a college student in Tuguegarao City. Rosefina is thankful that her son sometimes still extends them financial support even though he has his own family to look after.

Rosefina is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP that will be used to expand her direct selling business. The money will be used to purchase more products to sell in order to earn more profit. She is hoping to increase her business income in order provide her daughter with a good education and allow her to finish her college courses. Rosefina dreams of having her own business stall in town to sell different Avon, Natasha, MSE, and Tupperware products

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo strives to earn income through his tricycle transport business while his wife, Adelaida, maintains a hog raising business (like most housewives in their village do). He is 48-years old and blessed with six children: Eva – 28, college graduate; Freddie – 26, college graduate; Anamarie - 24 years old and also a college graduate; Adelyne – 19, first year college; Mario - 14 years old, sophomore in high school and John Paul - 3-years old. Pablo and his wife hope that they will be able to support their younger children, who have ambitions to finish college someday.

Pablo doesn’t have enough capital to improve his tricycle. Thus, he wants to borrow 5,000 PHP to be used for motorcycle maintenance. He wants to improve his motorcycle's running condition, to make sure that his passengers are always safe. With this strategy, Pablo believes that he will be able to increase his daily income from his transportation service, and provide his children with allowances, and his wife with money to maintain her hog raising business. Pablo is getting older but, as long as he is strong enough, he will continue to do his best to satisfy his family's daily needs.

loans.use: For motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en:
Marvie does household chores while managing a handicraft business doing cross stitch. She has good designs in cross stitch and great skill, making her ambitious to earn more income. She is 40-years old, married, and born in the province of Cagayan, in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Philippines. She has one son, named Bryan, who is 22-years old and will be graduating from nursing. Her husband is a soldier, which is why Marvie worries about his security all the time.

She is asking for a loan of 14,000 PHP. Marvie is hoping that, with this money, her business will be more productive and successful. She dreams of becoming a successful entrepreneur someday. Marvie always prays that God will guide her to be more patient in her work and in attaining all the goals in her life.

loans.use: Additional capital for a cross stich business

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene currently makes a living by operating a general store. She helps her husband with their daily expenditures. She also normally buys chicken meat from a wholesale supplier at a low price and retails it to earn additional income. She is 42-years old and resides in Barangay Alibago Enrile, Cagayan. She is married and has two children who are both attending primary school.

Marlene is very happy that her business is profitable for her family and she wants to improve it. She is asking for additional working capital of 17,000 PHP for her business. She would like to buy additional commodities for her store. She believes that if she has a larger inventory, her business will progress. Her dream is to someday have a permanent stall for her business and a comfortable house. She also hopes that her children will finish their studies. She has patience and knows, through her deep faith in God, that He will help her attain her goals in life.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 29 years old and married to Oscar C., 32. Her husband works as a local butcher in their village and sometimes he works as laborer on some houses in nearby villages. However, her husband’s work is not regular, that’s why Marissa needs to work hard to maintain her general-store business in order to assist him in their livelihood. At the moment, the couple has four children: Lady Krystal, 10; Gluveth Kerbin, 7; Ariane, 5; and Cypheron Vera, 1. They reside peacefully in Alibago Enrile, Cagayan.

According to Marissa, her current family situation is happy despite the financial crisis they are suffering now. In order to solve the financial problems they are encountering, she strives hard to earn more income to have a better future for her children. Marissa also wants to have additional capital to be able to earn more profit. For this, she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP8, 000.00 to be able to purchase more meat products for her store. She hopes to purchase more stock in order to increase her daily income to satisfy the daily needs of her family and customers.

loans.use: Buy more meat products to sell

loans.name: Leomar

texts.en:
Leomar operates a tricycle transport in his village, which serves as his source of income. He is now 29 years old, married to Maricel, and lives in the village of Alibago Enrile, Cagayan. They are blessed with two children: Mary Heart, 7 years old, already in first grade, and Maria Kathleen, 4 years old, who will enter Kindergarten in June 2009. 

His wife is busy with her small-hog raising business and this adds to their income. Leomar works hard as a tricycle driver in order to provide his family with good living conditions. But his income is not enough to provide all their basic needs and maintain the general repair of his tricycle. Therefore, he wishes a loan of Php 5,000.00. The loan he requests will be used for general maintenance on the tricycle that he uses for public transportation. Leomar and his wife work hand in hand in order to save their income for their children’s future. His dreams of having a comfortable living for his family motivate him to double his time in generating a daily income that will satisfy their needs and eventually will be a big help towards reaching his goals in life.

loans.use: To make general repairs on his motorcycle

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is already 34 years old and married to Santiago G., 39 years old, who works as a tricycle operator in their village. They have been blessed with three children: Charmila Mae, 17 years old, a college student, Laisa, 13 years old, presently in her second year of high school and Angelika, 3 years old.  They all attend a public and university school near their place. They reside in Barangay Minanga Norte Iguig, Cagayan.
Lanie manages a hog-raising business in their backyard in order to help her husband earn extra income. She works hard to make it grow to be able to earn more profit. Lanie is also a rice retailer in their village. This is another source of income for their daily household expenses. Lanie and her husband wanted to allot savings for the schooling of their children. She is applying for a loan of PHP12,000.00 to be used to maintain their motorcycle and to have additional capital to expand her hog raising business. The loan will be of great help to keep their motorcycle in good condition in order to have more passengers.

loans.use: For motorcycle maintenance and additional capital for their hog-raising business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana R. is about 62 years old. She is a widow and she has five children. All her children are married and she lives alone in her house with her grandchild. Juliana lives peacefully in Minanga Norte Iguig, Cagayan. She manages a tailoring shop in their village and it serves as her sole source of income to provide for their daily needs. Her husband used to help her in the business when he was still alive. Unluckily, because of his acute illness, he died. Since then, Juliana has had to work alone.

Everyday she operates her tailoring business. She accepts repairing, cutting and sewing of different clothes. She is very patient in working to be able to earn more income to sustain their financial needs and their needed commodities in daily living. She is asking for a loan of PHP14,000.00 to expand her tailoring business and acquire more customers in the village. The opening of classes for students is fast approaching and she hopes that many students will ask her to sew their school uniforms. This will increase her income. She also wants to buy a brand new sewing machine, which is greatly needed in her sewing business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn, 25 years old, is a native Cagayana who lives in Barangay Minanga Sur of Iguig, Cagayan. She is already married and has two children. They are Fatima, three years old, and Ma. Milagros Ven who is two years old. Jenelyn was not able to finish college because of her family’s financial difficulties. Jenelyn has a small general store in their village that serves as the source of income for their family. Her husband assists her in her business and always gives a helping hand. They work hard and sacrifice a lot in order to become successful in their business. Jenelyn wants her store to grow. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of Php13,000.00. The loan proceeds will be used to buy additional items for her general store so she can acquire many more customers. Then she will be able to earn more profit,  which will be a big help in providing their basic needs in life. Also, with her earnings, she can allot some of her savings for her children's education. She is grateful for the opportunity given to her by lenders for it gives her hope that she can fulfill all her dreams and goals in life.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a resident of Barangay Minanga Norte Iquig, province of Cagayan. She is 48 years old and has eight children. Four of her children are married, one is still single and helps them earn a living while the three youngest are still studying in public school in their village.
Evelyn has a hog-raising business that serves as her source of income. She has a small piggery in her backyard. She wants to develop her piggery to make it bigger and more progressive. She believes that through her piggery business, she will be able to give her children a good education and someday will able to finish college courses.

She also responsibly supports her family by providing their basic necessities for daily living. All her children are very cooperative and responsible. They always assist her in her piggery. Evelyn earns a good profit from her hog-raising business. That’s why she wants to maintain it and make it grow more. She is requesting a loan of PHP10,000.00 to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock. The loan will be of great help in increasing her income. She also hopes that upon selling her pigs, she will be able to allot some of her income for the repair of their house. She always wanted to have a comfortable living and a better life, which is why she is very patient in working all through her life.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Widma

texts.es: Widma a sus 40 años quiere salir adelante, vive en la casa que le dejaron sus padres, ella es muy trabajadora y tiene muchas ganas de superarse. Widma es una vendedora de productos de belleza muy solicitada en su barrio, siempre está muy informada de los nuevos productos que han salido al mercado y no pierde la oportunidad para dar uno que otro consejito de belleza  a sus habituales clientes, puesto que disfruta de vender sus productos y más aun cuando acaba su mercadería. Ella lleva 5 años en este negocio y espera posteriormente poder abrir un salón de belleza, donde pueda vender sus cosméticos, ya que actualmente le es muy difícil ir por todos los lugares donde deja sus productos de belleza y cobrarles uno por uno. Es el quinto préstamo de Widma en MFP, se siente en la capacidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que confía en su negocio y en su banco comunal, al cual se siente muy contenta de pertenecer. Este préstamo le ayudara a Widma a incrementar su capital de trabajo, planea invertir todo el crédito en la compra de más productos cosméticos.
texts.en:
Widma is 40 years old and wants to get ahead. She lives in a house that was left to her by her parents, is very hard-working, and has a great desire to improve herself. Widma sells beauty products and is very sought-after in her neighborhood. She is always well-informed about the latest products on the market and she never loses an opportunity to give beauty tips to her regular customers. Widma really enjoys selling her products and is even happier when she sells out.

Widma has had this business for five years. She hopes to one day open a beauty salon where she can sell her cosmetics, since it is very difficult to have to go all around selling her products and charging for them individually.

This is Widma's fifth loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she has enough confidence in her business and her community bank that she is sure she will be able to repay it on time. She is very happy to be a member of her community bank. This loan will help Widma increase her working capital, which she plans to invest in the purchase of more cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock of merchandise

loans.name: Vitalina

texts.es: Vitalia es una mujer que siempre a trabajado mucho por sobresalir en la vida, vive en la casa de sus familiares junto a sus 3 hijos Pieri 10, Emilia 8 y Lorena de 5 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Vitalia pasa sus días en las calles tocando puertas y dejando sus productos a domicilio, ella trabaja con productos de belleza y es una vendedora muy persuasiva, pues siempre termina su día con muchas ventas. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientas y aconsejarlas sobre cuales son los productos en promoción, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar por las calles tocando puertas, ya que le es muy cansado, aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para alcanzar sus sueños de tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos con mayor comodidad. Este es el primer préstamo de Vitalia con MFP, está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria con el resto de sus socias. Con los quinientos nuevos soles de préstamo, Vitalia planea comprar más productos de belleza, para  brindarles a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Vitalia is a woman who is always working hard to get ahead in life. She lives in her relatives' home with her three children, Pieri, age 10, Emilia, 8, and Lorena, 5. Her children are the reason behind all of her hard work. Vitalia spends her days knocking on doors and selling beauty products. She is a very persuasive salesperson, and always has made many sales by the end of the day. She has done this work for three years, and what she likes most about it is talking to her customers and advising them about products on sale. What she likes least is having to to walk the streets knocking on doors, as this is very tiring. But, she knows that it is a necessary step towards achieving her dream of having her own store where she can sell her products more comfortably.

This is Vitalia's first loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is committed to repaying it on time, as she would like to be eligible for more loans in the future. She is known as a very happy and loyal member of her community bank. Vitalia plans to purchase more beauty products with the 1,500 Peruvian nuevos soles from this loan. This will help her provide her customers with a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, a sus 37 años todavía tiene muchas fuerzas para seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia, vive en la casa que le cedieron sus padres. Zonia tiene uno de las tiendas más llenas de su barrio, ella lleva a su humilde localidad los abarrotes más necesarios y útiles para sus moradores, administra su tienda hace más de 8 años, es muy feliz vendiendo sus productos y satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes, lo más difícil de su trabajo es permanecer todo el día en su negocio sin poder salir, ya que atiende todo el día y siempre está cuando sus compradores la solicitan. Para el futuro de su negocio, desea ampliar su tienda y tener muchos más productos que vender, puesto que su barrio está creciendo y la mercadería con la cuenta, ya no le alcanza. Es el quinto préstamo de Zonia con MFP, sus anteriores créditos los pagó puntualmente y sin problemas, es la socia más activa y solidaria de su banco comunal, por lo cual es muy querida. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que ha solicitado, comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su bodega.
texts.en:
Zonia is a woman who has always worked hard to get ahead. At 37 years old, she still has great desire to continue working and helping her family. She lives in a house that was left to her by her parents. Zonia has one of the most well-stocked stores in her neighborhood. Her humble shop offers the groceries and household supplies most requested by the local population. She has had her shop for eight years and is very happy to sell products that meet the demands of her customers. The most difficult thing about her work is staying in her shop all day without being able to leave, as her store is open all day and she must be available to serve her customers whenever they call. In the future, Zonia would like to expand her business to provide more products, as her neighborhood is growing and her current supply of merchandise is not enough.

This is Zonia's fifth loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and all of her previous loan were repaid punctually and without problems. She is the most active member of her community bank, where she is much loved. She will use the 800 Peruvian nuevos soles from this loan to purchase more merchandise to better stock her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana es una joven de 20 años muy trabajadora y decidida, vive en la casa de su esposo Jorge de 53 años junto a su querido y único hijo Jorge Enrique de tan solo 1 añito y lo que más desea es darle a su familia una buena vida. El día de Yovana comienza muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a su carretilla de jugos sale para ubicarse en su puesto de siempre y empezar con la venta diaria de su delicioso jugo de quinua (Jugo hecho a base de quinua y manzana licuada), la sabrosa bebida caliente que prepara es muy bien recibida por sus clientes, los cuales nunca pierden la oportunidad de repetir la ración. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender su producto y terminar todo lo preparado, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que levantarse a las 4 y 30 de la mañana para preparar el jugo, aun así sabe que todos sus esfuerzos serán recompensados y espera mas adelante comprar más carretillas para ampliar su negocio. Yovana desea pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, siendo este su primer préstamo con MFP, ella no tiene dudas en poder lograrlo, sabe que tiene el apoyo de su banco comunal. Con los seiscientos nuevos planea comprar otra carretilla de jugo de quinua, para alquilarla y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Yovana is a hard-working and determined 20 yeard old. She lives with her 53 year old husband Jorge and her only child Jorge Enrique, who is only a year old. What she wants most is to give her family a good life. Yovana's day begins very early in the morning, when she leaves with her cart full of juices for her usual post and begins her daily sales of delicious quinua (juice made from a base of the quinoa grain and apple juice). The tasty hot drink is very well received by her customers, who never miss an opportunity to come back for seconds. What she likes most about her job is selling all of the juice that she has prepared. She has been doing this job for two years, and what she likes the least is having to get up at 4:30 in the morning to make the juice, even though she knows that all of her work will be rewarded. In the future, she hopes to buy more carts to expand her business. Yovana wants to repay her loan on time since this is her first loan with MFP. She doesn't have any doubts about being able to do this. She knows that she has the support of her communal bank. With this $200 loan, she plans to buy another quinoa juice cart so that she can rent it and improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase another cart for juice sales

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana siempre quiso salir adelante en la vida y tener un mejor futuro, vive en la casa de sus familiares y ahora lo que más desea es que su negocio progrese. Yovana sabe que en estos tiempos conseguir trabajo es muy complicado, por eso a decidido incursionar en una actividad distinta, ella prepara loncheras para niños de nivel inicial, actualmente trabaja con 4 Centros Educativos Iniciales y espera poder expandir el número de instituciones con las que trabaja. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es interactuar con los niños y ver que disfrutan de la comida que les preparó, lo más difícil para ella es llevar los recreos hasta los colegios, puesto que es bastante la cantidad que prepara, lleva recién un año en este negocio y tiene muchos deseos de que su negocio crezca y pueda así mejorar su ingresos económicos. Este es el segundo préstamo de Yovana en MFP y al igual como hizo con el primero espera pagarlo a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy alegre siempre hace reír a las demás socias. Con los mil nuevos solicitados comprará más envases para llevar a más niños la comida que prepara.
texts.en:
Yovana always has wanted to go forward in life and have a better future. She lives in a house with her close friends and now what she wants most is her own progressive business. Yovana knows that in these times to get work is very complicated, and, because of this, she has decided to do a particular activity. She makes snacks for elementary-aged children. Today she works in 4 education centers and she hopes to expand the number of institutions with which she works. What she likes most about her work is to interact with the children and see them enjoy the food she makes for them. The most difficult thing for her to carry her things to the school because there is a substantial amount that she makes. She's been in this business for the last year and wishes to see it grow along with her profits. This is Yovana's second loan with MFP and she hopes to pay it on time. In her community bank she is very cheerful and always smiling to the other members. With the requested money she will buy more cases to carry food to the children.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy containers to carry the food that she makes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase clothing material for tailoring and also for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more sorghum flour, millet flour, and maize flour.

loans.name: Kele Amia Grace Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Grace A. is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She has three boys and one girl and also cares for four orphans. All the children are in school.

Grace has been selling beans for over seven years. She will use this loan to purchase beans in bulk. She is active and her dream is to construct a house and educate her kids.

loans.use: To purchase beans in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase 30 bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Swalia C Leila Ayikoru Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Leila A. is 32 years old and married with three children. She has one boy and two girls who are all going to school. She has seven dependents.

She has been selling cassava flour for over nine years. She will use this loan to purchase bags of cassava flour for sale. Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava flour for sale.

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.ru: Абдучабборова Саиднисо , женщина 54 лет, замужем имеет пятерых детей. Муж уже три года как умер из-за болезни печени.  Она занимается продажей муки. Её точка реализации расположена на рынке Худжанда. Муку Саиднисо продаёт как оптом мешками , так и в розницу. Товар ей привозят её сыновья, а Саиднисо занимается только продажей товара.Она хочет получив кредит увеличить свой оборотный капитал. На снимке сама Саиднисо на месте своей деятельности
texts.en:
Saidniso A. is 54 years old, a widow and has five children. Her husband passed away from liver disease three years ago. She is involved in flour sales. Her store is located at the Khujand market. Saidniso sells the flour both wholesale by bags and retail. Her sons deliver the flour, and Saidniso sells it. She wants to obtain a loan in order to increase her working capital. The photograph shows Saidniso at her place of business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava flour for stock and sale.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар-женщина 40 лет,замужем,имеет 3-х детей.Более 2-х лет она торгует на вещевом рынке Спитаменского района.Нилуфар продаёт парфюмерию,косметику и другие бытовые моющие средства.Каждую субботу она ездит за товаром в город Истаравшан.Двое её дочерей помогают по хозяйству,так как Нилуфар имеет большой земельный участок.Муж и старший сын Нилуфар уехали на заработки в Россию,чтобы накопить денег для постройки нового дома.Нилуфар и её дочери благодарят наших кредиторов за то,что получили дополнительный источник для расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nilufar is a 40-year-old woman, married and has three children. She has been involved in sales at the Spitamen district clothing market for over 2 years. Nilufar sells perfumes, cosmetics and different household cleaning products. Every Saturday, she travels to the city of Istaravshan for her products. Nilufar also owns a large plot of land that her two daughters help to take care of. Her husband and oldest son left to work in Russia in order to save enough money to build a new house. Nilufar and her daughters are grateful to our creditors for providing them with this additional opportunity to expand their business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of perfumes and costmetics

loans.name: Swalia C Edranigo Zaida Group

texts.en: Zaida E. is a 35-year-old married mother of six children, four boys and two girls, all attending school except for the youngest. She also has four other dependents. Zaida has been operating her hotel restaurant for over 20 years, selling food specifically for breakfast, lunch, and dinner  and is now requesting a loan to purchase items such as wheat flour, bananas, cassava flour, cooking oil, charcoal and other items for the business. She is progressing well and her standard of living is improving. Her dream is to open a big hotel, buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase hotel restaurant items such as wheat flour, bananas, cassava flour, cooking oil, charcoal and other items.

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru: Разокова Мавчуда молодая девушка , которая замужем , но детей пока не имеет. Её бизнес заключается в пошиве национальных платьев. Она проживает и работает в городе Худжанде. На рынке «Паншанбе» она арендует небольшой цех. До сегодняшнего дня она была ученицей одного мастера модельера, и теперь  она хочет отдельно купить себе машинку и шить самостоятельно платья.Она уверена что начав свои услуги у нее будет поток своих постоянных клиентов и она станет хорошим мастером по пошиву платьев. Она благодарна что микроинвест поддерживает начинающих своё дело людей.
texts.en:
Mavchuda R. is a young woman, who is married but does not yet have children. Her business is making traditional dresses. She lives and works in the city of Khujand. She leases a small factory at the Panshanbe market. Until today, she has been an apprentice of a master dress-maker and now wants to purchase her own sewing machine and make dresses herself. She is confident that, once she starts her own business, she will retain her loyal clients and become a good master dress-maker. Mavchuda is grateful that MicroInvest supports people starting their new businesses.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dress making

loans.name: Prisons B Chandiru Betty Group

texts.en: Betty C. is a 40-year-old widow with five daughters and one son, all in school, as well as three additional dependents. She has operated her business of selling millet and local brew for over 20 years and is now requesting a loan to purchase millet and millet flour, yeast, and sorghum for making local brew. Betty’s dream is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase millet and millet flour, yeast, and sorghum for making local brew.

loans.name: Baroat

texts.ru:
Бароат Мирмамадова, женщина 50 лет, которая беспрерывно кредитуется в Микроинвест с2002 года. Она вначале своей истории бизнеса продавала носки. И её оборотный капитал был очень маленький, а если сравнить с сегодняшним, то у нее он увеличился .Даже ассортимент изменился на детскую обувь. И это благодаря кредитам, как говорит сама Бароат.
Для завоза весенней  обуви Бароат решила подать заявку на займ. При мониторинге у Бароат кипела торговля , но весеннего ассортимента у неё было не достаточно, поэтому Микроинвест рад помочь Бароат в её бизнесе.
texts.en:
Baroat M., 50, has been a MicroInvest client since 2002. In the very beginning, she was in the business of selling socks. Compared to what she has today, her business capital was very small. With help of several loans she began selling children's shoes and was able to substantially increase the assortment of the inventory. This time, Baroat decided to apply for a loan so she could purchase seasonal shoes. During last MicroInvest inspection, Baroat's business was very busy and she did not have enough inventory. For this reason, MicroInvest is happy to help her with her business.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of children's shoes

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru: Сурайё -женщина 24-х лет,замужем имеет 3-х детей.Сурайё вместе со своим мужем Дилшодом занимается продажей продуктов питания на продовольственном рынке Спитаменского района.Она привозит товар из города Худжанда,где рассположен оптовый рынок продуктов питания.Её товары пользуются хорошим спросом,но для расширения ассортимента ей нужны дополнительные денежные средства,поэтому она обратилась в нашу организацию.Cамым ходовым её товаром считаются сахар-песок,конфеты и печенья производства России.
texts.en:
Surayo is a 24 year old woman, married and has three children. Surayo and her husband Dilshodom together sell food products on the food market of the Spitamen region. She brings in the merchandise from the town of Khudjand where the wholesale food market is located. Her merchandise is in high demand, but to expand the assortment she needs additional finances and this is why she has come to our organization. Her most popular items are sugar, candy and cookies made in Russia.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Искандарова Раъно, кредитор в Микроинвест с 2003 года. Она раньше занималась торговлей детской одежды, а на сегодня она  изменила свой бизнес на продажу ковровых товаров. Она торгует в отделе  магазина «Импульс» в городе Худжанде. Ей помогает её муж , который привозит товар с Коврового Кайраккумского комбината. Для закупа новых моделей шерстяных  ковров  Раъно подала заявку на займ. За шесть лет кредитования у Раъно улучшилось семейное положение, сосотояние. Она, смогла устроить, своего сына учится в Университет. Раъно благодарна KIVA  за сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Rano I. has been a loan client of MicroInvest since 2003. In the past, she has sold children's clothing, but today she has switched over to the sale of carpets. She sells out of a department in a store called Impulse in the city of Khujand. Her husband assists her by delivering the goods from the Kayrakkum carpet center. Rano has applied for a loan to purchase new woolen carpets. In the six years Rano has been a loan client, she has improved her family's circumstances and standard of living, and was able to arrange for her son to study at the university. Rano is grateful to Kiva for the collaboration.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carpet sales

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавжуда-женщина 44-х лет,замужем имеет 4-х детей. Она занимается продажей парфюмерии и галантереи на вещевом рынке Спитаменского района.Мавжуда закупает товар на оптовом рынке города Истаравшан. Она ездит за товаром 2 раза в месяц. Её муж мастер строительных работ. Он тоже зарабатывает неплохо, но по мере требования взрослых детей, ему не удаётся накапливать деньги. Мавжуда уже 3 года занимается этим бизнесом. Когда она начинала, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас она расширилась, и за свой последний кредит, она закупила партию женских заколок и резинок для волос,а также детские и мужские носки хорошего качества. Теперь у Мавжуды увеличился ассортимент.
texts.en:
Mavjuda is a 44-year-old woman, who is married and has four children. She sells perfume and accessories at the Spitamen regional clothing market. Mavjuda purchases her goods wholesale at the Istaravshan city market, where she goes twice a month. Her husband is in construction. Although he has a good salary, he has not been able to save enough to meet the needs of their grown children. Mavjuda has been in this business for three years. When she began, she had very little inventory, but now it has grown. With her latest loan she purchased a batch of women's hair accessories, as well as high-quality children's and men's socks, and now has an expanded selection of goods.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of perfume and clothing accessories

loans.name: Prisons B Saburu Jane Group

texts.en: S. Jane is forty-seven years old and single with six children, three girls and three boys, who are all in school. She has been in her business for over eleven years. She is using the loan to purchase salon items like chemicals for relaxing hair, hair braids, combs and others. Her dream is to generate more income by buying a motorcycle and starting a motorcycle-transport business.

loans.use: To buy salon items.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлюба- женщина в возрасте 30 лет. замужем имеет двоих детей.Муж на заработках в России.Сама Матлюба нигде не работает, т.к.дети пока маленькие.Поэтому три года как Матлюба занимается своим маленьким бизнесом, торговлей в маленьком магазинчике возле своего дома.Она проживает в 13 микрорайоне города Худжанда, который расположен на окраине города,и торговых точек там мало.Из-за чего и идёт торговля Матлюбы за счёт покупки соседей по дому.У неё в магазине в основном все прдовольственные товары первой необходимости для дома, а также получив кредит она хочет добавитьв свою продажу включив мороженое.Перед её магазином есть небольшая площадка , которую Матлюба хорошо отремонтировала и сделала навес.И теперь в летнее время она поставив пластмассовые столики и стулья будет обслуживать покупателей, мороженым  и напитков. Для начала она решила получить небольшую сумму кредита, а в дальнейшем будет кредитоваться согласно своим планам.
texts.en:
Matluba is a 30-year-old woman, who is married and has two children. Her husband has gone to Russia to find work. Matluba does not work outside the home as her children are still little, so for the past three years she has run a business trading out of a small shop near the house. She lives on the outskirts of the city of Khujand in micro-district 13, and retail outlets there are scarce. Matluba's customers are her neighbors, and her shop stocks staples for the home. Once she has received the loan, she would like to start selling ice cream. There's a small space in front of her shop that Matluba has remodeled and where she has installed an awning, so that in the summertime she can put out plastic tables and chairs to serve her customers ice cream and beverages. She decided to take out a small loan to get started, and in the future will obtain financing to carry out her plans.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of groceries

loans.name: Prisons B Afeku Getrude Group

texts.en: Getrude A. is twenty-five years old and married with two children, one boy and one girl. She has been selling food stuffs like tea and madasi (a flour made from dried peas) for two years. She is using the loan to broaden her business with a purchase of more sugar, tea leaves, wheat flour and peas for making madasi. Her dream is to purchase a motorcycle for a motorcycle-transport business, which will generate more income.

loans.use: To buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Jura

texts.ru:
Холиков Джура-47 лет. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Его жена работает учительницей в их сельской школе. Их дети тоже идут в эту школу. Она учитель начальных классов. Зарплата учителей совсем маленкая, но жена Джуры все равно ходит на работу, чтобы учить сельских детей. Холиков Джура, после 6-ти лет кредитования в нашей организации увеличил свой капитал  и купил себе машину.
Сейчас у него закончились наличные деньги, и он взял кредит, чтобы купить еще одну партию товара хорошего качества.
texts.en:
Jura H. is 47 years old, married and the father of three children. His wife is a teacher at the village school, which their children also attend. She teaches the youngest children. Although a teacher's salary is extremely low, Jura's wife still goes to work in order to instruct the village children. This is the sixth year Jura has been a loan client of MicroInvest and in that time he has increased his working capital and purchased himself an automobile. At present money is tight and Jura has taken out a loan to purchase a new selection of high-quality goods.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Edroze Ndeezo Grace Group

texts.en: Grace N. is a professional nurse. She is forty-four years old and has six children who are all in school. She has owned a drugstore for over eight years. She is using the loan to purchase various medicines to add to her inventory. She is happy because she is rendering a service to the people in her community. Grace's dream is to build a better house for herself and to build up her business.

loans.use: To buy various medicines to increase inventory.

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.ru: Джумаева Угуло – женщина 43 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она наша давняя клиентка. Уже больше 6-лет, как она у нас кредитуется. 8 лет назад она начинала с уличной торговли возле школы. У нее был маленький столик, на котором она продавала бутерброды и сладости для школьников. Сейчас у нее есть маленький магазинчик на продуктовом рынке Спитаменского района. Товар ей привозит фирма, которая занимается поставкой продуктов питания оптом. В будущем Угулой планирует расширять бизнес, и открыть свой продуктовый магазин в центре Спитаменского района.
texts.en:
Uguloy J. is a 43-year-old woman, who is married and the mother of three children. She is a longtime client of MicroInvest, and for the past six years has been a loan customer. Eight years ago she became a street vendor after school. She had a small table from which she sold sandwiches and sweets to the students. Now she has a small shop at the Spitamen produce market. A company that engages in the wholesale supply of food products delivers the goods to her.
