In the future, Uguloy plans to expand the business, and open her own produce shop in the center of the Spitamen region.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of food products

loans.name: Edroze  Lumago Ana Group

texts.en: Ana L. is forty years old and married with seven children, four of whom are of school age. She has been selling produce since 2005. She is using the loan to purchase sesame seeds, ground nuts and cassava. She works very hard. Her dreams include educating her children and building a house.

loans.use: To buy sesame seeds, ground nuts and cassava.

loans.name: Edroze Grace Yose Group

texts.en: Mrs. Grace Y. is age 30, married, with six kids all going to school and one dependant. She has been selling vegetables, food like chapattis and madasi, beans, tomatoes, and silver fish for over ten years. She will use the loan to purchase vegetables, beans, tomatoes, silver fish, wheat flour, and cooking oil for making chapattis and madasi. Her dream is to construct a residential house.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, silver fish and supplies for making chapattis etc.

loans.name: Origami Abiria Betty Group

texts.en: Mrs. A. Betty is married, age 24, with three kids going to school. For over ten years she has been selling Irish potatoes and bananas. She will use the loan to purchase more bags of Irish potatoes and bunches of bananas. Her dream is to educate her kids.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of Irish potatoes and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Origama Candiru Zainabu Group

texts.en: C. Zainabu, age 38, lives with her partner. She has been making tablecloths since she was 15 years of age. She will use this loan to purchase thread for making tablecloths. She supplies tablecloths to the community and also the marketplace. Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase thread for making tablecloths

loans.name: Origama Kadija Musa Group

texts.en: Mrs. Kadija M. is aged 32 years, married with 8 kids, all schooling. For over 4 years she has been selling fish. She is using the loan to purchase fish in big volume for selling. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase fish in big volume for selling

loans.name: Dadau Candiru Jennifer Group

texts.en: Mrs. C. Jennifer is aged 25 years, married with 2 kids and 5 orphans as dependents, all going to school. She has been in her business for over 3 years. She is using the loan to purchase ground nuts, cassava flour, simsim (sesame seeds), charcoal, and tomatoes for selling to her community and at her marketplace. Her dream is to see her kids through school.

loans.use: To purchase ground nuts, cassava flour, simsim, charcoal, and tomatoes

loans.name: Dadau Okia Grace Group

texts.en: Mrs. O. Grace is aged 25 years, married with 2 kids and 6 dependents, all schooling. She has been selling charcoal for over 2 years. She is using the loan to purchase bags of charcoal and cassava flour for selling. She is able to feed the family and her dream is to construct a permanent residential house.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal and cassava flour for selling

loans.name: Dadau Orodriyo Beatice Group

texts.en: O. Beatrice is aged 37 years, widowed with 3 kids, all schooling, and 7 dependents. She has been selling used clothes for over 4 years. She is using the loan to purchase more used clothes for re-sale. She is managing to pay school fees for the kids and her dream is to buy a plot of land and construct a rental house and her residential house.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Dadau Driciru Grace Group

texts.en: Mrs. D. Grace is 35 years old, married with 3 kids, all going to school, with 3 dependents. She has been selling produce for over 5 years. She is using the loan to purchase produce such as beans, simsim (sesame seeds), cassava flour, and tomatoes. She is a hard-working woman and her dream is to construct a residential house.

loans.use: To purchase produce such as beans, simsim, cassava flour, and tomatoes for re-sale

loans.name: Swalia C Siam Habibu Group

texts.en: Mrs. S. Habibu Leila is 28-years of age, married with 3 kids (all of them girls and all in school) and she takes care of eight dependants. She has been in her business for over six years but, at times, cassava can be out of stock. She will use the loan to purchase bags of cassava flour to sell. Her dream is to construct a residential house and rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Lucy has been a firewood seller in the Nzove neighborhood of Mbeya. She currently makes a very minimal monthly profit. She works at her business for 12 hours every day.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Lucy is 46 years old, married, and has five children: ages 31, 28, 25, 21 and 17. She also cares for four additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Kisa, who has her own small business selling clothes in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for resale.

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Sarah has been a soap seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $225. She works at her business for 12 hours a day.
She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more soap for resale. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.
Sarah is married, and has five children: ages 35, 30, 27, 25 and 16. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Nyambilila, who has her own small business selling fish in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more soap for resale

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Amida owns a small shop in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. She works at her business for 12 hours every day.
She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to add to her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.
Amida is 30-years old, married, and has three children: ages 12, 10 and 4. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Nancy, who has her own small business selling fish in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items to add her current stock

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda has been a clothes seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She is 38-years old, married, and has six children: ages 16, 13, 10, 8, 4 and 1. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. She works at her business for 12 hours every day.
She belongs to the Ndanyelai group loan (Group code 2019). This is her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, which she will use to buy more clothes for resale. She is hoping that her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Juliana owns a small grocery store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. She currently earns very little monthly profit.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more grocery items to add to her current stock. She hopes that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Juliana is 45 years old, married, and has four children: ages 27, 22, 18 and 14. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member,  Eliza. Who has her own small business selling charcoal in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to add her current stock.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Frola is a soft drink seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. She currently earns very little monthly profit.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more soft drinks to add her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Frola  is 34 years old, married, and has three children, ages 12, 8 and 1.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member Elizabeth who has her own small business selling fruits in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to add her current stock.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
K. Florence is a hardworking 31-year-old lady with three children. She has run a retail shop for over three years, located in Kibuli Kampala. This loan will be used to purchase more shop items such as bags of sugar, maize flour, salt, and soap, so that she can increase her profits.

Her future goals are to build rental houses and to educate her children at good schools.

loans.use: To purchase more items for sale in her shop, such as bags of sugar, maize flour, salt, and soap.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
N. Safina, 41, is a businesswoman with one school-going child. Since 2007, she has run a hardware shop located in Kibuli Kampala. She is using the loan to purchase more hardware to expand her business.

Her future goal is to renovate her houses so she can rent them out at higher rental prices.

loans.use: To purchase more hardware to expand her business.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent K. is a famous technician in Ndeba Kampala. He has a workshop which he started 15 years ago where he makes metallic doors, windows, water tanks and where he also repairs vehicles. He will use his loan to purchase more metal for his workshop. 

Vincent is 40 years old and a father of 4 children. His wife rears poultry at home. His dream is to educate his children up to university level.

loans.use: To purchase more metal to make doors, windows, water tanks and other items.

loans.name: Afusa

texts.en:
K. Afusa is a businesswoman, aged 38. She has a retail shop located in Buwega Kampala, which she has run for over seven years.

She is using the loan to purchase more items for the shop, such as soap, paraffin, sugar, salt, sweets, cakes, and sodas.

K. Afusa is a widow with three children in school. Her future plan is to build rental houses to generate extra income.

loans.use: To purchase more items for the shop such as soap, paraffin, sugar, salt, sweets, cakes, and sodas.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: N. Annet is an energetic lady, age 34, with two kids. She has operated a boutique since 2003. Her business has been running well, and she has been thinking of expansion. She is using the loan to purchase more clothes for her boutique as well as expanding it. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale and to expand her business.

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Mr. Luke C. owns a drug shop which has developed into a clinic. He will use this loan to purchase clinic equipment like an examination couch, hospital supplies, microscope, ultrasound machine and drugs (since he now has rights from the National Drug Authority). He is very proud of bringing clinical services nearer to his community. His dream is to have a 24 hour clinic, since his wife is a registered midwife, and also to have a decent house, car and good health.

Mr. C. is 38-years old and married with two kids in primary school: a girl, age 10, and a boy, age 9 years. He also cares for eight dependants. He is so hardworking, active and hopeful!

loans.use: To purchase clinic equipment and drugs

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Mr. O. James is 28 years old and is married with a four-year-old kid. He lives with six dependents and he has been in his business, a Mutembe pride enterprise, for over six years. He will use the loan to purchase items for his shop, such as clothes, bags, buckets, belts, flow carpets, plastic chairs, flasks, lamps, and television sets.

He is a hardworking man, open-minded and encouraging. His dream is to complete his commercial house.

loans.use: To purchase items for his shop such as clothes, bags, buckets, and belts.

loans.name: Nowel

texts.en:
K. Nowel is a businesswoman of 41 years. She is married with four kids, three of whom are going to school. She started her shop business three years ago with the help of her husband, but now she is self-reliant.

She is using the loan to purchase items in the shop. Her future plan is to build more houses for rent.

loans.use: To purchase items for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Mr. M. Vincent has an unusual business: he deals in sand, bringing it from other areas and selling it in a conveniently located area. He has two separate places from which he sells sand. He has been successfully engaging in this business for three years. He is using the loan to purchase more truckloads of sand.

He is the proud father of four kids. His plan is to renovate rental houses for more tenants.

loans.use: To purchase sand for sale so as to invest in construction.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Miiro Christopher is a hardworking businessman, age 28. He deals in suitcases, briefcases, leather bags, canvas bags, and so on. He started this business 10 years ago when he was a boy of 18. Now he owns a plot of land where he has built some rental houses.

He is using the loan to purchase more bags in order to expand his business.

He has two kids and hopes to be able to educate them up to the university level.

loans.use: To purchase more bags in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.en:
S. Muzafar is a traditional doctor, age 30. His father was also a traditional doctor. He deals in herbal medicine. He makes his medicines in his own factory and he has been doing this for over eight years. He is married with two kids.

He is using the loan to expand his business by employing more workers.

His hope is to complete his rental house for the use of tenants.

loans.use: To expand his business by employing more workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de Los Ángeles M. es una señora que ha salido adelante a pesar de ser madre soltera, ella  mantuvo a sus hijos y ahora cada quien tiene su familia solo le queda uno el cual también aporta con los gastos familiares. La señora desea remodelar su baño e instalar al puerta por dentro de su vivienda como  también  quiere arreglar el techo por que es de lamina y en tiempo de frió es muy helado al momento de  salir teme a tomar alguna enfermedad ya que su mama también vive con ella y ya es grande de edad y necesita mas cuidados.
texts.en:
Maria De Los Angeles is a woman who has moved forward in spite of being a single mother. She raised her children and now each has their own family. Only one remains who helps her with family expenses. Maria wants to remodel her bathroom and install a door in her house and fix the roof because. Unfortunately, in cold weather, the door freezes open and she is afraid that the cold will cause sickness. Her mother, who is of old age, lives with her and she needs to be careful because of her.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Arreglar baño

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela Márquez muy emprendedora en el cual esta pensando poner un negocio en su casa para obtener más ingresos, ella quiere ser una buena inversión como comprar mercancía y mobiliario para su nuevo negocio. Ella es madre de dos niños pequeños y no quiere ver que pasen necesidades aparte en una buena oportunidad para estar al pendiente de su casa. 
La señora Gabriela trabaja como ayudante de cocinera en una empresa que es organiza eventos para fiestas, reuniones, conferencias, etcétera. El esposo trabaja en un lugar donde acuden muchos grupos musicales como guardia de seguridad.
texts.en:
Gabriela Márquez is very enterprising and is thinking of starting a business in her home to obtain more income. She wants a good investment to buy merchandise and furniture for her new business. She is a mother of 2 small children and she doesn't want to see them have necessities other than a good opportunity to be independant of the house. Gabriela works helping a cook in a business that organizes celebration events, parties, reunions, conferences, etc. Her husband works as a body guard at a music venue.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start a business

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Isidro López G. es un joven soltero que  obtuvo una casa de interés social pero el no se había cambiado por que el todavía vive con sus papas y para que la casa no se quedara sola  la presto a un primo para que la habitara al momento de quedar la casa sola no la dejo en muy buenas condiciones. Ahora Isidro quiere independizarse hacer su propio hogar pero para esto quiere arreglar los daños que se ocasionaron como  las paredes que se encuentran aboyadas y darle un pintadita para que el se siente que tiene una casa presentable.
texts.en:
Isidro López G. is a single young man who obtained a house of social interest, but he has not moved because he still lives with his parents and because the house wasn't left alone. He lent it to a cousin because when the house was left alone it wasn't left in good condition. Now Isidro wants to be independent to make his own home, but he needs to fix the damage, such as the walls that need painted. He will then feel like it is a prestable house.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Arreglar daños en su vivienda

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe Juárez Guzmán  y su esposa desean poner losa en la planta alta, ellos con el transcurso del tiempo con ahorros fueron construyendo las paredes. Su esposo con compañía de un primo fueron poniendo block por block hasta llegar  a la altura necesaria para una recamara. El proyecto de esta familia es hacer un cuarto más ya que su hijo mayor que esta en la pubertad tiene 15 años quiere su propia privacidad su casa no es muy grande solo son dos recamaras y son mas hijos. Ahora esta familia ya se le terminó sus ahorros y necesitan comprar más material para terminar su proyecto. Entre el es empleado de maquiladora y su esposa enfermera y entre los dos aportan ala casa.
texts.en:
Felipe Juárez Guzmán and his wife want to put flagstones on the upper floor. With the passing of time and with savings, they have constructed the walls. Her husband, with the assistance of a cousin, have been building block by block to get the height needed for a bedroom. This family project is to make another room, as their eldest son, who is in puberty and is 15 years old, wants his own privacy. His house isn’t very large, there are only two bedrooms and there are more children. Now this family has used their savings and they need to buy more materials to finish their project. He is the employee of a factory and his wife is a nurse. Between the two of them they contribute to the household.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Emiliano C. el es locutor de una estación de radio muy conocida en la ciudad el ya tiene varios años con este oficio el cual lo hace muy bien. A pesar de todo el ha sobresalido por su físico y no por eso le ha impedido salir adelante el tiene poco de casado pero aun así quiere darle lo mejor a su pareja y buena comodidad.
El quiere poner vitropiso en su casa ya que el que tiene es piso firme, también quiere poner protecciones para que este protegidas cuando el su esposa salgan trabajar. Su esposa le ayuda con los gastos familiares trabaja en una empresa que se dedica hacer paquetes para viajar a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
Emiliano C. is the announcer for a very well known radio station in the city. He has spent several years with this job and it is going very well. Due to everything, he has stood out due to his stature, but this has not kept him from advancing himself. He has not been married long, but so he wants to give better to his spouse, and good convenience. He wants to put tile in his house so that he has a firm floor, also he wants to install window protection so that his wife is protected when he leaves to work. His wife helps with the household expenses by working in an enterprise where she makes packets for traveling to other cities.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto tiene una casa de interés social y su esposa esta embarazada y desean construir un cuarto en la parte de atrás para que su futuro hijo tenga su propia recamara. El señor siempre ve por el bienestar de su familia lo cual  quiere que vivan cómodamente y dejar un buen patrimonio a su familia. Para empezar su proyecto el necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra e ir iniciando para que este antes del nacimiento de su bebe.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto has a house through public housing, and his wife is pregnant. They wish to construct a room in the back part so that their future child would have his own room. Carlos always looks to the well-being of his family, and he wants them to live comfortably and to provide a good patrimony to his family. To begin his protection he needs to buy material and to pay workmen to begin before the birth of his baby.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: Iván N. es un joven soltero que es maestro en una escuela que se dedica que estudiante aprenda un buen porcentaje de ingles. El con el tiempo que ha trabajado fue apto para poder adquirir una casa de interés social, pero la casa se queda sola cuando el sale a trabajar; por que también trabaja como DJ en un antro de la ciudad y no quiere que al momento de no estar en su vivienda le puedan robar lo que con mucho sacrificio a comprado. El desea poner protecciones en las ventanas para que ningún delincuente pueda pasar por alguna ventana y llevarse algo de valor.
texts.en:
Iván N. is a young bachelor who is a teacher in a school where he works so the students learn a good percentage of English. With the time that he has worked, he was able to acquire a house through public housing, but he leaves the house only when he goes to work; because he also works as a DJ in a dive in the city, and he doesn’t want anyone to be able to rob him of what he has bought with so much sacrifice the moment he is not in the house. He wants to put protection on the widows so that no delinquent would be able to enter through a window and take anything of value.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To protect Ivan's Home

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
Felipe de Jesús V. C. no aparece en la imagen pero su esposa la señora Maria Magdalena Vargas Rojo es a la persona que se le tomo ya que le señor trabaja y no se encontró.
 Felipe y su esposa quieren construir un cuarto en la parte de enfrente para tener mas espacio y vivir cómodamente. Sus hijos ya están creciendo pero en un futuro querrán tener su propio espacio, la casa es muy pequeña es de interés social por lo que el señor piensa en comprar el material para comenzar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Felipe de Jesús V. C. does not appear in the photo but his wife, Señora Maria Magdalena Vargas Rojo is the person that we have photographed as Señor Felipe is at work and we couldn’t meet him. Felipe and his wife want to build a room on the front part of their home, in order to have more space and to live comfortably. Their children are already raised, but in the future they want to have their own space. The case is very small as it is public housing, so Señor Felipe thought to buy the materials to begin his project.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Jose Enrique

texts.es: José Enrique C. H.  es un señor trabajador el cual es  sostén de la casa ya que su mujer se dedica al hogar y  cuidado de su pequeña  hija. Pero lo único que al el  preocupa es al momento de irse a trabajar y ellas quedarse solas puedan correr algún peligro por que su casa no tiene ninguna barda que no permita el paso de otras personas ajenas. El recurre a esta institución pudiendo que se le ayude para poner un barandal en su casa.
texts.en:
José Enrique C. H. is a working man who is the support of his home as his wife is dedicated to the home and caring for their small daughter. But the only thing that worries him at the moment is to go to work while his wife and daughter remain alone where they could run in to some danger, because his house does not have a fence that would prevent the entrance of strange people. He has returned to this institution to get help to put a barrier around the house.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a barrier

loans.name: Horacio Israel

texts.es: Horacio Israel  A. sus planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y darle un mejor bienestar. El construyo una barda en la parte trasera de su casa el cual la quiere utilizara para levantarla mas y así hacer un cuarto para extenderse y estar mas amplios tanto como el como su familia. El necesita material para la losa y pagar mano de obra. Su casa es de interés social por lo que es muy pequeña el quiere hacerla mas grande poco a poco pero primero una cosa y luego otra.
texts.en:
Horacio Israel A.’s plans for his family are to better the conditions of life for his children and to give them a better situation. He built a wall in the rear part of his home which he wants to use to raise it more, and so to make a room to extend the house, and to be larger like his family. He needs materials for the flagstones and to pay labourers. His house is public housing and so it is very small and he wants to make it bigger, little by little, but first one thing and later the other.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build

loans.name: Casimiro Refugio

texts.es:
Casimiro Refugio por mas de 40 años se a dedicado al enderezado y pintura de 
automóviles pero nunca ha tenido seguro social, en este año el se encuentra enfermo 
y nenecita hacerse un estudios por lo que el no cuenta con dinero por que pagar en 
un hospital particular es muy caro. El quiere ponerse bien de salud, el en su
matrimonio solo procreo un hijo pero el ya esta casado y de ahí tienen una hija.
 El señor y la señora están muy encariñados con la nieta ya que es la niña que 
no tuvieron y quieren verla crecer aunque sea un poquito mas.
texts.en:
Casimiro Refugio has worked for more than 40 years on autobody work and painting cars, but he has never had social security. This year he found himself to be ill, and he has to have some tests done. But he doesn't have the money, because a private hospital is very expensive. He wants to put himself in good health. In his marriage, he had only one son, but that son is now married and has a daughter. Mr. Refugio and his wife are very fond of their granddaughter, who is the daughter they never had. They want to see her grow, even if only for a little while longer.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: clinical studies

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria González tiene dos hijas las cuales están estudiando una de ellas esta en primaria y la otra en la preparatoria. La señora quiere el bienestar de sus hijas y esta solicitando un préstamo para pagar la colegiatura de ellas e irse preparando para el nuevo ciclo escolar y las prisas no la tomen por sorpresa.
No quiere que ellas dejen de estudiar para que puedan ser una buenas profesionistas en un futuro.
texts.en:
Candelaria González has two daughters who are studying, one in primary school and one in high school. Ms. González is concerned about the well-being of her daughters and is asking for a loan to pay for their school fees and to be prepared so the new school year and the rush don't take her by surprise. She doesn't want them to give up studying because they could be good professionals in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a 45-year-old married mother of four children – one son and three daughters. One of her children is learning a trade while the others are in senior high or junior high school. Comfort lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the farming/commercial town of Takorase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer, and she works to support him in providing for the family.

Comfort cooks and sells rice and stew in the local government school compound. She has been in business for over 20 years. She purchases bags of rice and other ingredients from nearby supermarkets, and she is requesting a loan to buy rice in bulk. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate O. is a 35-year-old married mother of three children – two sons and one daughter. Currently, all of her children are in junior high or primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the farming/commercial town of Takorase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer and Kate works to support him in providing for the family.

Kate cooks and sells rice and stew, which she prepares in her house and sells on the street. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from nearby supermarkets. Kate has been in business for two years and wants a loan to purchase bags of rice in bulk. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is 32 years old, and is married with a son and a daughter, both of whom are in primary school. She lives with her two children and husband in a rented apartment in the farming/commercial town of Takorase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer and she works to support him financially.

Lydia is a trader in jewels of all kinds and childrenswear. She sells at her local market as well as trekking to other towns to sell on their market days. Lydia buys her materials from wholesalers in Accra. She has been in business for four years now, and is requesting a loan to purchase goods in bulk in order to expand her business. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To purchase jewels

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet B. is a trader. She runs a provisions store on one of the main streets in her community. She also sells vegetables on a small tabletop in front of her store. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns.

Janet is 35-years old and married with two daughters. Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates palm nuts. Both of her children are in primary school. Janet lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to help her husband provide for the family and especially to meet the children’s school demands.

Janet has been in business for 15 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce B. is a trader. She runs a provisions store on one of the main streets in her community. She also sells vegetables and other food items on a small tabletop in front of her store. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns.

Joyce is 31-years old. She is married and has three children: a son and two daughters. Her husband is a farmer. All of her children are in primary school. Joyce lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to help her husband provide for the family and especially to meet the children’s school demands.

Joyce has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet E. is a trader. She trades in footwear. She sells all sorts of footwear for both men and women. She hawks her goods in her community. She procures the footwear from Accra. She says she is also into a sewing business.

Juliet is 29-years old and married and with three sons, who have all completed senior high school and are currently working. Her husband is a steel bender. Juliet lives with the husband and children in a house in the farming/commercial town of Takorase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Juliet has been in business for eight years and wants to expand her business. She hopes to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy footwear to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate O. is a trader. She sells food items such as rice, etc. and vegetables on a tabletop and in a kiosk at her home. She procures bags of rice, vegetables and other ingredients from nearby wholesale shops.

Kate is 45-years old. She is married and has five children: two sons and three daughters. Her husband is a farmer. All her children are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the farming/commercial town of Takorase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kate works to help her husband provide for the family.

Kate has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hoping to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and food items

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce P. is 34 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are girls. She says all of her children are currently in junior high or primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Joyce is a trader. She trades in second-hand textiles such as clothes for both sexes and also bed sheets. She procures bales of textiles from Accra and sells in her community by hawking. She says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for nine years and desires to expand her business. Joyce hopes to improve upon her standard of living and sponsor her children to the higher levels of academia.

loans.use: To procure second-hand textiles

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy Gyawaa is thirty-five years old. She is married and has three children, two sons and one daughter. All are currently in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Mercy works to help her husband provide financially for the family. Her husband is a cocoa farmer.
She is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew. She prepares the food in the apartment and sells on the street. Mercy procures bags of rice and other ingredients from nearby supermarket shops. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice in bulk. She is hopeful of giving her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha P. is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has three sons who are still in school. Her husband is a commercial driver. Martha lives with her husband and their children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 
Martha is a trader. She trades in footwear. She sells all sorts of footwear for both males and females. She hawks to sell her goods in her community. Martha procures the footwear from Accra. She has been in business for three years and wants to expand her business. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy foot wear to sell.

loans.name: Merum Group

texts.en:
Merum is the leader of the Merum group. There are two members in this group and they want to take a loan to progress their businesses. Merum wants to take a loan for her son's car part shop. Safara wants to take a loan for her carpet weaving business.

They are requesting a group loan for 28000 Afghanis for the term of eight months. They are thankful for AFS and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her son's car part shop.

loans.name: Muhammad Qasam Group

texts.en:
Muhammad Qasam is the leader of the Muhammad Qasam group. There are two members in this group and each of them wants to take a loan to expand their businesses. Muhammad Qasam wants to take a loan for his general store. Pare Gul wants to take a loan for her husband's general store.

They want to take a loan for 28000 Afghanis for the term of eight months. They are very happy to have this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand his general store.

loans.name: Uqaota Group

texts.en:
Uqaota is the leader of the Uqaota group. There are four members in this group and each of them want to take a loan to expand their business. Uqaota wants to take a loan for her quilt making business. Qaduis wants to take a loan for a tailoring and animal husbandry business. Zhera wants to take a loan for an animal husbandry and agriculture business. Asaiu wants to take a loan for a fruit and vegetable business. 

They want to take a group loan for 42000 Afghanis for the term of ten months. They are all very happy to have this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand her quilt making business.

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Mr. S. is 56 years old and his wife, Noeun, is 53. They earn their daily income by selling traditional clothes that they buy from a wholesale supplier. The clothing is made from silk. S. and his wife use their own motorbike to transport the clothing from village to village. They sell the silk closthing to their clients’ at their homes and they earn around $7 a day. The couple lives with their five children, all of whom are employed and work in different jobs. The family owns one hectare of farmland that was inherited from their grandparents. The farming season is approaching and Mr. S. is looking for a $400 loan. This loan will be used towards growing all kinds of vegetables the farmland that they own. (Mr. S.'s wife is pictured.)

loans.use: Towards costs of growing all kinds of vegetables on their farmland.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mrs. Sor B. is a divorced mother. Her two teenage children are students. Since 2000, she has been selling beef soup out of her home. Almost all of her customers are neighbors. The rest of her customers are other villagers who come to eat the foods at her store. B.'s children often assist her in business activities when they are not studying at school. B. has requested a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner HKL to be used partially to expand her business size. The remainder of the loan will be used to invest in her nephew's business selling ferrous metal equipment that will bring B. some additional income.

loans.use: To expand her business size

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mr. Sophoin N. is 47 years old and his wife Mrs. Nhor San is 48 years old. They live on long national road number one, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1982 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family house. Two of their children assist their parents in farming and two attend school.

Sophoin has been growing rice for thirty years. His wife has been selling vegetables for twelve years. She buys the vegetables from villagers to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. Sophoin is applying for his first loan of $1,000. He will use the loan to purchase a water pumping machine, fertilizers, and pesticides to use for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: In's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of three people. They all live in Banteay Dek Commune, in Phnom Penh City. The group leader is Mrs. In S.. She is 52 years old and makes a living selling various vegetable crops, such as tomatoes, cabbages, and cucumbers. She started the business ten years ago and currently earns approximately $3 per day. She is now a widowed mother of three single children who are working in different jobs. S. will use this loan to purchase different kinds of vegetables to sell.

The other two borrowers are E. and R.. E. is 42 years old and sells fresh fish in the market. She will use the loan to support a rice farming business. R. sells bananas in the market and she is applying for a loan to buy additional bananas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn A., 34, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Chea, 57, were married in 1995 and have four sons. Three of them attend school and another one is still young. The family lives on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chanthorn has been selling porridge in her village for one year; she used to be a silk weaver as well. Her husband has been driving a motor taxi since 1995. He transferred his old motorcycle to his wife to use; so, Chanthorn is requesting her first loan of $700 to purchase one more motorbike for her husband to drive as a motor taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband’s motor taxi business.

loans.name: Sokim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokim K., 37, and her husband, Mr. Sokha Aum, 39, live in a small village in the suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married for 19 years and have four children; three of them are in school and one stays at home. 

Sokim has been selling dried fish and smoked fish for five years. She buys them at the local market for resale in her village. Mr. Sokha Aum has been a security guard for three months. He works at Porsat province which is far away from his home.

Sokim wants to expand her business to become bigger so she is asking for her first loan of $400 to purchase more dried fish and smoked fish for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish and smoked fish.

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Mr. Hin K., 40, and his wife, Mrs. Aun Doem, 46, who live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1983 and have eight children: three sons and five daughters. One of their children is disabled, two are garment factory workers, one son works in a brick kiln and two other children are in school.

Hin and his wife have been growing rice for four years. And after harvest season, they also grow cucumbers to supplement their business. Hin is applying for his first loan of $200 to use for growing rice.

loans.use: To use for growing rice

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en: Natsagdorj T. is 40, married and the father of two sons. Both his sons go to an elementary school. His family lives on rented land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2004, he started running a business at the "Harhorin" outdoor market selling men's and women's apparel. Natsagdorj's spouse, Enhtsetseg, helps her husband's business by going to Beijing, China once every two months to buy cheap clothing. With his profit Natsagdorj has opened a savings account in the name of his eldest son to prepare for his future. He also paid for his youngest son's tuition to study in an English language course in Ulaanbaatar. Natsagdorj is an open-minded and cheerful person. He requests a loan to buy more clothing to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Sam-Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-ol S., 30, and her husband, Mr. Ne Nao, 27, were married in 2004 and have two children: one son and one daughter. One of them attends school and the other one is still young. The family lives in a small village off of National Road number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sam-ol has been a garment factory worker for eleven years. Her husband has been driving a motor remoque for two years; remoque is a motorbike with a trailer at the back which can carry more goods and people. She is asking for her second loan of US$500 to build a concrete room under her wooden house for storage and to repair her kitchen.

loans.use: To build a concrete storage room and repair her kitchen.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Tungalag B. lives with her husband and one of her two sons in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. One of Tungalag's sons is married and does construction work in South Korea. It is common in Mongolia to go to South Korea and work in the construction sector. This kind of work does not usually require any language or advanced skills and pays more than other alternatives in Mongolia. Tungalag has a small retail business selling women's and men's apparel. She travels to Ereen, a Chinese border town where many products are imported, to buy cheap high quality women's and men's clothing. She sells clothes at the stall that she rents in the Narantuul market, the largest open market in Ulaanbaatar. For the last three years, she has been running her business successfully. When she is away at Ereen, her husband sits at the stall to sell the clothes. In the future, she hopes to afford to purchase a microbus, which her husband can use to contribute to the family's income. She requests a loan to purchase more clothing from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Avirmed

texts.en: Avirmed B. lives with her husband and daughter in Ovorhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Avirmed has a small business selling clothing at the local market. She started the business in 2000 by selling clothes such as jeans, shirts and belts. Recently, she has been specializing only in women's and men's jeans due to their popularity and profitability. She purchases jeans from Ereen, a Chinese border town where many products are imported, and sells them for a profit in a stall that she rents at the local retail market. In the future, she hopes to have her own shop where she will be able to sell a greater variety of products. She requests a loan to purchase more women's and men's jeans from Ereen.

loans.use: To purchase women's and men's jeans

loans.name: Lorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorng S.(was in the right with her daughter), 64, is a widow with three daughters. Two of her daughters are married; one of them lives at home. She alS. has two grandchilden who attend school and live with her. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, about thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Lorng has been selling mangoes for 15 years; it’s a skill she learned from her friend. She buys them in her village for resale at the market in Phnom Penh. She hopes to expand her business; it could give her a better standard of living. Lorng is requesting her first loan of US$800 to purchase mangoes on contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes on contract for resale.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en: Bayarmaa P. lives with her husband and two teenage daughters in Ovorhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her two daughters are both high school students. Bayarmaa has a small business selling women's fashion accessories, such as creams and hair brushes. She occupies a small space outside the local market where she started her business in 2004. Small retailers who cannot afford to rent a stall inside the market place occupy small spaces outside the market door and try to sell their products. She purchases the items she sells from the wholesale market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia and brings them to Ovorhanghay. In the future, she would like to expand her business and be financially able to rent a stall inside the market. She requests a loan to purchase small items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Koun

texts.en:
Mr. Koun K., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Channa Touk, 28, who live in a small village in the suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, were married in 1999 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of them attend school and another one is still young. 

Koun has been a fisherman for fifteen years and his wife has been growing vegetables for fifteen years. Besides fishing, Koun wants to run a new business raising ducks, which could allow him to earn more income to support his family. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan of $500 to purchase ducks to raise.

loans.use: To purchase ducks to raise.

loans.name: Hao

texts.en:
Mr. Hao K., 67, is a widower with six children: four sons and two daughters. Two of his children are married and live outside the family home, one son is a teacher, another son assists his father in farming, one daughter is a tailor and the other one is in school. The family lives along national road number one, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Hao has been a farmer for 39 years; he grows tomatoes on his farm near his village. He and his family members live in an old house. He is requesting his first loan of $500 to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mr. Thy S. (not shown in the picture), 52, and his wife, Mrs. Kan Chea (shown in the picture with her son), 52, have been married for 20 years. They have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home and another one is a garment factory worker. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Thy and his wife have been raising ducks for 20 years. They hope to expand their business and that is why Thy is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase 150 more ducks

loans.use: To purchase more ducks

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur J. has been selling meat for the last eight years, purchasing animals including sheep, cattle, and camels from local herders in the country and then slaughtering them in the city at the butcher shop. Gantumur rents a butcher stall at the local market where she sells well-cut meat in small pieces and hopes to one day own her own shop instead of paying high rent. She has also been working hard to buy her own plot of land to live on with her big family. Gantumur will use this loan to purchase more animals, specifically sheep and cattle.

Gantumur lives with her husband and four teenage children in rental housing in Ovorhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. All her children are high school students, while her husband Battogtoh works as a watchman for a private company.

loans.use: To purchase more animals, specifically sheep and cattle.

loans.name: Sithvanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Sithvanny R., 42, and her husband, Mr. Chinda Duch, 44, were married in 1993 and have one daughter who is in the local school. Besides her daughter, she also has one niece who is a silk weaver and one elderly mother who live with her. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sithvanny has been a silk weaver for 22 years. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for 16 years. He works in Phnom Penh.  She is requesting her first loan of US$500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to buy construction materials to build a stone pillar for her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for business and to buy construction materials to build a stone pillar for her house.

loans.name: Chhoy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoy K., 64, and her husband, Mr. Sroing Sang, 67, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1964 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Their three sons are married and live outside the family home. One daughter weaves at home and the other two are garment factory workers.

Chhoy and her husband are farmers. They grow bananas and cucumbers. The couple is in the process of building a new house, but they lack some money to finish it.

Chhoy is requesting a loan of US$800 to finish the house and to purchase silk materials for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.use: To finish her house and to purchase silk materials for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Oyuntsetseg S. is a widow living with her mother and son in Ovorhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her son is a student in a local technical college where he is learning carpentry. Oyuntsetseg runs a small barber shop located in a local shopping mall. She has been running her business since 2003 and plans to expand her business soon. Since her barber shop is the only source of income for her family, she works hard and does her best to earn money. In the future, she hopes to run her own full-service salon.  She requests a loan to purchase hair products and equipment such as hair dye and dryers.

loans.use: To purchase hair products and equipment such as hair dye and dryers.

loans.name: Basbaatar

texts.en: Basbaatar N. lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Basbaatar, with his wife, moved to the capital a few years ago. Since the move, he has been running a small retail business in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. With his wife, Basbaatar sells women's and men’s clothing at the stall that he rents in the Narantuul market. Basbaatar frequently travels to Beijing, China where he purchases cheap yet high quality clothing for his business. When he travels to Beijing, his wife Odgerel sits at the stall and sells the clothing. It has only been a couple of years since Basbaatar married his wife and they do not have any children yet. They would like to build a small house on the plot of land they own. Basbaatar hopes to have the house built before his first child is born. He requests a loan to purchase more clothing from Beijing, China. In the picture, Basbaatar's wife, Odgerel, is at their stall at the market.

loans.use: To purchase men's and women's apparel

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Mrs. Saren C., 29, and her husband, Mr. Chen Sot, 26, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2005 and have two daughters. Besides her daughters she also has her father living with her.

Saren has been a silk weaver for 15 years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in a market in Phnom Penh. Mr. Chen Sot has been driving a motor taxi for two years. Saren is applying for her first loan of $350 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Ratana

texts.en:
Mr. Ratana C., 45, and his wife, Mrs. Mom Un, 42, were married in 1989 and have five children: two daughters who are still young and three sons. Two of their sons have full-time employment, another one is in college. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Ratana and his wife are farmers and they were hired by the villagers to spin thread to earn extra income to support their family. The walls of their house are made from coconut leaf. It is difficult for them to live when the rainy season comes, so Ratana is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase zinc to make new walls for his house.

loans.use: To repair the walls of his house.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Batbayar S. lives with his wife and three children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Batbayar's wife is a trained hairdresser but recently started staying home due to illness. Batbayar's three children are all high school students. A mini-truck that Batbayar owns is the only source of income for his family. He uses his mini-truck to transport various things. During the summer he uses his mini-truck to carry construction materials when building activity is at its peak. During the winter he carries coal and firewood to individual family's homes. His family now lives in a ger (a round, mobile, felt yurt) on his neighbor's plot of land. He dreams of one day building a house on the plot of land that he hopes to own. Batbayar requests a loan to buy new tires and necessary accessories to fix his mini-truck.

loans.use: To buy new tires and necessary accessories to fix his mini-truck.

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Mrs. Soem D., 48, and her husband, Mr. Ly Vorn, 46, were married in 1988 and have seven children: three sons and four daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home. The other five attend school. The family lives along national road number one, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Soem and her husband have been selling vegetables for five years; they buy them from their village for resale at the market in Phnom Penh. Soem’s husband wants to start another new business,  therefore she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive as a motor remoque taxi. (remoque is a motorbike with a trailer at the back which can carry more goods and people).

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive as a motor remoque taxi.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Mrs. SokH. H. is 30 years old and her husband, Mr. Phearum Chea, is 30 years old. They were married in 2003 and have two young sons. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mr. Phearum Chea has been a fisherman since he was young. He fishes from the river and lake nearby his house and sells them in his village. Besides fishing, he is a farmer as well. SokH. stays at home to take care of her children and assists her husband in the farming business.

Phearum doesn’t have enough fishing materials so SokH. is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Vanne

texts.en:
Mr. Vanne M. is 36 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sinat Khut, is 29 years old. They were married in 1999 and have three sons. Two of their children are in school and another one stays at home. The family lives on long national road number one, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Vanne has been a mason for five years. He works in his village and another nearby village. His wife has been selling chickens and ducks for two years. She buys them from Svay Reang province and sells them in Koki market. Vanne is asking for his first loan of $300 to buy more chickens and ducks for his wife to sell.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and ducks for his wife to sell.

loans.name: Buyanhishig

texts.en:
Buyanhishig E. lives with her husband and daughter in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter is five years old and goes to a local kindergarten. Buyanhishig's family moved to the capital city from Arhanghay province in 2007.

Since the move, Buyanhishig has run a small retail business selling children's clothing, especially jeans pants. She rents a stall in a local market and sells mostly jeans for young people. She frequently travels to Ereen, a Chinese border town where clothing is imported, to purchase cheap yet hip clothing for her business. Most of the jeans that she currently has in inventory are for women. She sees a growing demand for men's jeans and will use the Kiva loan to purchase jeans for men. Buyanhishig hopes to build a small family house on the plot of land her family owns.

loans.use: To purchase men's jeans to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy P., twenty-one, and his wife, Mrs. Sreythy Sorn, twenty-three, live along National Road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2008 and have one young daughter. Vuthy also has his parents and one brother living with him. His parents are very old.

Vuthy has been a construction worker in his village for two years; it’s a skill he learned from his brother. His wife stays at home to take care of their daughter and his parents. Vuthy doesn’t have his own motorcycle to drive to work so he is applying for his first loan of $600 to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to drive to work

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: The two persons shown in the picture are Hong S. and her husband. She is fifty-seven years old and married with nine children. Six of them are single and the others are married and live independently. To help provide the family's basic needs, three of her sons are employed. One drives a motor taxi and the other two are construction workers. She currently cultivates rice crop and her husband works as a local construction foreman. She has decided to apply for a loan through Kiva to buy a motorcycle that her husband can use to run a taxi for additional income.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng P., age fifty, and his wife, Mrs. Seng Veng, age fifty-one, were married in 1979 and have six children, one son and five daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, three are garment factory workers and one is still in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Heng has been a fisherman for thirty years. His wife sells the fish in Takhmao market.  Because his fishing materials are old and broken, Heng is asking for a loan to purchase seine and bamboo to make traps for his fishing business. He will also buy materials to build a structure at the side of his house where he can raise cows.

loans.use: To buy materials to make traps for his fishing business and for building a structure by his house.

loans.name: Livsandorj

texts.en: Luvsandorj R. is a thirty-eight-year-old single man who lives with his parents in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His parents are both retired and stay at home. Since 2000, Luvsandorj has been driving a mini bus along various city routes. He currently has two mini buses that serve different routes. He drives one mini bus himself and has hired a temporary driver for the other mini bus. He hopes to get married this year and settle down with his own family. He requests a loan to repair one of his mini buses.

loans.use: To fix his mini bus.

loans.name: Kimry

texts.en:
Kimry V., age forty-five, and her husband, Kheun Chorn, age forty-six, were married in 1987 and have three daughters. Two of them weave silk at home and another daughter is in school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Kimry has been a silk weaver for six years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman who takes them to sell in the market in Phnom Penh.  Her husband has been a construction worker for two years. He works in his village and in another district which a distance away from their house. The couple hopes to support their children’s continuing education. 

Kimry is requesting a loan to purchase silk materials for herself and her daughters' weaving business.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Vorng

texts.en:
Mr. Vorng S., 42, is not shown in the picture, but replaced by a picture of his wife, Mrs. Vin Dong. They were married in 1990 and have three children: one daughter, who works in a plywood factory, and two sons, one of whom is a chef and another one is in school. The family lives along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Vorng has been a blacksmith for five years. He works for another person who runs a blacksmithing business. His wife stays at home. Vorng doesn’t have his own motorbike to drive to work so he is applying for his first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work

loans.name: Naidan

texts.en:
Naidan T. is a widow and lives next to her youngest daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her youngest daughter is a high school teacher and a big supporter of her mother's business. Naidan has four other children, who are all married and live with their own families.

Naidan has a small retail business selling women's and men's clothing. She started her business in 2007, right after her retirement. She frequently travels to Ereen, a Chinese border town where products are imported, and buys cheap clothing from wholesalers. She rents a stall in the Norjin Shopping Center, one of the city's large shopping centers, and sells her products. She requests a loan to purchase more imported clothing from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To purchase more imported clothing from Ereen, China.

loans.name: Otgonchimeg

texts.en:
Otgonchimeg N. lives with her teenage daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is a divorced woman, who is working hard to provide a better life for her two children.

She has a small retail business selling second-hand clothing. She launched her business in 2006 and since then, she has been doing well and gaining abundant experience in retail. She rents a stall in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, and sells the second-hand clothes that she purchases from the wholesale market.

Her ultimate hope is to afford her two children's college tuition when they graduate from high school. She wants her two children to be well-educated and to pursue their dreams in their chosen fields. She requests a Kiva loan to buy more second-hand clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes for her business.

loans.name: Selenge

texts.en:
Selenge T. is 21 years old and lives with her mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Selenge is a senior majoring in German Studies in one of the large universities in Ulaanbaatar. In order to pay her tuition and living expenses, she runs a small food retail store, in cooperation with her mother. Her mother works at the cashier in Selenge's food store.

Selenge and her mother started their business in 2006 by using one of their bedrooms in her apartment. Since the beginning, they have done well and expanded their business. Selenge hopes to successfully graduate from her university and focus on her business expansion. She requests a loan to purchase more food products to sell at her store.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Otgonjargal S. lives with his wife and two children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son is an 8 year old first grader and his new-born daughter is only a year old.

Otgonjargal has a small retail business selling second-hand clothing. He started his business in 2003 by purchasing second-hand clothing from the wholesale market in Ulaanbaatar and reselling the clothes individually for profit at his stall in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. His wife normally helps run his business and is currently staying home to take care of her new born baby. Otgonjargal requests a Kiva loan to purchase more second-hand clothing to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothing to increase his business inventory.

loans.name: Shinebayar

texts.en:
Shinebayar V. lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two children both go to a local primary school.

Shinebayar has a small retail business selling clothing. She rents a small stall in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, and sells clothing for women and men. Her husband also helps her business. Shinebayar travels to Ereen, a Chinese border town where many products are imported, and purchases cheap yet fashionable clothing for women and men. When she is away traveling to China to buy inventory, her husband stays at the stall and sells the clothing.

Since the start in 2002, her business has stabilized and she hopes to expand her business soon. She requests a loan to purchase clothing as the summer season approaches.

loans.use: To purchase clothing as the summer season approaches.

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Ouk C. (pictured here with her husband) is 39. She is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She sells fruit in the market to earn a living, and she is able to make around US$6 in profit per day. Her husband has been a taxi driver since 2005, and normally he makes US$16 in revenue every day. This couple has five children: three are students, one is employed, and one is too young.

Ouk C. would like to take out a loan to reinvest in her fruit stand.

loans.use: To purchase fruit.

loans.name: Huk

texts.en:
Huk S., 46, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband. She sells fruit and grocery items and is able to make US$15 in revenue every day. Her husband is a farmer and earns US$3 per day. This couple has five children: two are construction workers and three are students.

Huk S. is asking for a loan to expand her grocery’s inventory to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Kahramonchon

texts.ru:
Кахрамончон Марипов уже около 8 лет занимается откормом скота. Дома у него есть 7 голов крупнорогатого скота. Животноводство приносит в его семью основной доход, за счет которого он содержит жену и детей. Жена Кахрамочона Манзура Муротова помогает ему в выращивании сельхозкультур, которые приносят в его семью дополнительный доход. Кроме животноводства и сельского хозяйства Кахрамончон работает в дехканском хозяйстве "Эхсан".
 Клиент запрашивает займ 1000 сомони, на 6 месяцев, хочет увеличить количество своего скота.
texts.en:
Kahramonchon M. has raised cattle for eight years, and he has seven head of large-horned cattle at home. Raising livestock is his family's main source of income, the means by which he supports his wife and children. Kahramonchon's wife, Manzura Murotova, helps him cultivate the crops that bring additional income into the family. In addition to raising livestock and farming, Kahramonchon works on the Ehsan farm. The client is requesting a six-month loan of 1000 somoni, as he wants to increase the size of his herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mr. San M. is 33 years old, and he makes a living selling firewood to generate income. He is married to Mrs. Kheng, 23, who distills white wine to sell. To be thrifty, M.'s wife uses the leftovers from distilling wine to fatten the pigs that the family raises. The couple has two minor children who are enrolled in the local public school. 

The family faces a problem: the roof of their house is often cracking. To solve the problem, Mr. M. is applying for a loan in order to repair his old house. (Mr. San M. was not available for photographing and the pictured shows his wife.)

loans.use: To repair his old house

loans.name: Kamolchon

texts.ru:
Камолчон Гозиев 1980 года рождения,женат, проживает в Шахристанском районе. Основное его занятие это животноводство. Откоромом и перепродажей скота он занимается около 10 лет.
 Хочет получить займ в размере 1000 сомпони сроком на 6 месяцев, для того чтобы закупить корм для своего скота.
  Дополнительно в его семью приносит доход выращивание сельхозкультур и переработка молока. В этом ему помгает его жена Фарида Гозиева.
texts.en:
Kamolchon G. was born in 1980. He is married and lives in the Shahristan region. His main employment is raising livestock. He has raised and resold cattle for nearly ten years. He wants to take out a six-month loan to the tune of 1000 somoni in order to purchase feed for his cattle. Raising crops and selling dairy products brings extra income into his family, and his wife, Farida Gozieva, assists him in these endeavors.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Sodiqdjon

texts.ru: Мирзоев Содикджон житель города Куляб. Живет в одном из кишлаков города. Работает на  одном из рынков города. Выпекает лепешки.Пекарня собственная. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы закупить муку , которая даст возможность безперебойно работать. Содикджон женат и имеет троих детей. Возраст 38 лет. Занимается выпечкой лепешек уже 10  лет. Его продукция очень качественная , поэтому у него очень много клиентов, которых он не всегда может обеспечить своей продукцией.
texts.en:
Sodiqdjon M. lives in the town of Kulob in one of the kishlaks (villages) of the town. He works in one of the markets and makes flat breads in his own bakery. He is asking for a loan to buy flour which will allow him to work without interruptions. Sodiqdjon is married and has three children. He is 38 years old. He has been baking breads for ten years now. His product is of very good quality and this is why he has many customers whom he can always supply with his product.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Abubakr

texts.ru: Худойкулов Абубакр житель города Яван. Имеет собственный участок земли , который использует для того под посев пшеницы и других злаковых культур. Кроме того он сажает овощи. В днный момент земля засеена пшеницей. Поэтому он обратлся к нам за кредитом , для того, чтобы купить удобрения и обработать пшеницу. Своевременная обработка даст возможность получить хороший урожай. Урожай он сможет быстро реализовать и получить доход.Абубакр жнат и имеет троих детей.
texts.en:
Abubakr K. lives in the town of Yavan. He has his own plot of land which he uses for sowing of wheat and other cereals. He also plants vegetables. At this time the land is sown with wheat. He has come to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for wheat. Timely fertilization will help him collect a good harvest. And then he can quickly sell the harvest and make a profit. Abubakr is married and has three children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a fertilizer for wheat

loans.name: Kosimhudja

texts.ru: Наджадуллоев Косимхуджа житель города Яван. Уже около семи лет занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин на  центральном рынке города. Торгует продуктами питания. Решил получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара. Таким образом он привлечет новых клиентов и даст дополнительные доходы. Косимхуджа женат и имеет пятерых детей.
texts.en:
Kosimhudja N. lives in the town of Yavan. He has been in retail for about seven years. He has a store on the central town market where he sells food. He decided to apply for a loan to increase the variety of the merchandise. This way he can attract new customers and it will bring him additional profit. Kosimhudja is married and has five children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the variety of merchandise

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.ru:
Фахриддин Рачабов по национальности киргиз, родился в 1965 году,получил среднее образование. Женат на Мастуре Раджабовой, имеет 8-х детей. Вместе с семьей проживает в  Шахристанском районе 
 Дома имеет 7 голов крупнорогатого скота, откормом которых он занимается уже 15 лет.
 Фахриддин нуждается в  займе 1600 сомони, сроком на 6 месяцев, для откорма скота с последующей его продажей.
 Дополнительный семейный доход он получает от сельского хозяйства и переработки молока.
texts.en:
Fahriddin R. is an ethnic Kyrgyz, who was born in 1965 and graduated from high school. He is married to Mastura Rajabova and has eight children. He and his family live together in the Shahristan region. At home Fahriddin has seven head of large-horned cattle, and he has been raising cattle for 15 years. Fahriddin needs a six-month loan of 1600 somoni for cattle feed, after which he will sell them. He earns additional family income from farming and selling dairy products.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Djurabek

texts.ru: Бобоев Джурабек житель города Душанбе. Возраст 43 года. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет средне техническое образование. Но уже четыре года работает частным таксистом. Кроме него в семье никто не работает. Поэтому он очень много работает для того, чтобы обеспечивать свою семью самым необходимым. В данный момент клиент решил сделать небольшой ремонт в доме , поэтому обратился к нам за кредитом. На полученные деньги планирует купить деревянные двери.
texts.en:
Djurabek B. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 43 year old. He is married and has four children. He has secondary technical education and works as a taxi driver for four years already. No one in the family works besides him and this is why he works a lot to provide for the family with everything they need. At this time he decided to do small repairs at home and has asked for a loan. He will use the money to buy wooden doors.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy doors for home repair

loans.name: Asat

texts.ru:
Асат Ризокулов  родился в 1967 году, образование среднее, по национальности узбек. Асат проживает в Шахристанском районе, вместе с женой Салимой и 4 детьми.
  Дома имеет крупнорогатый скот, и получает прибыль от откорма и ее перепродажи.
  Животноводством он занимается 12 лет, и в данный момент нуждается в сумме 1600 сомони, для того чтобы откормить свой скот, и после продать на рынке. В будущем, после успешного погашения и полученной прибыли от животноводства, хочет взять займ для увеличения количества своего скота.
  Дополнительный семейный доход Асату приносит его работа в дехканском хозяйстве «Ризокулбобо».
texts.en:
Asat R. was born in 1967. He graduated from high school, and is an Uzbek ethnically. Asat lives in the Shahristan region, together with his wife Salima and their four children. He keeps large-horned cattle at home, and earns a profit raising and reselling them. He has been in the livestock business for 12 years, and at present needs 1600 somoni to fatten his cattle, then resell them in the marketplace. In the future, after successfully repaying his loan and receiving the profit from the livestock, Asat wants to take out a loan to increase the size of his herd. By way of additional family income, Asat works at the Rizokulbobo farm.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen S., 50, lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. They work together as wedding chefs. On average, they make around UD$11 per day combined. This couple has three children: one is a student and two are singers. 

Pen S. is asking for a loan to purchase wedding materials. Her husband is pictured at home.

loans.use: To buy wedding materials

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
