She cooks some of the yams in stew, but her current challenge is finding enough funds to upgrade her inventory. Janet requests the loan to enable her to buy more yams and other vegetables to sell.  This will allow her business to grow and progress. She hopes to increase her savings to support her son's education and provide hope for his future. Janet belongs to the village bank called ‘Nkwa Nsuo,’ which means "living waters." She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of yam tubers

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora D. is forty two years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter. She says her daughter is a seamstress and her son currently attends university. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town named Takorase, which is near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. 

Debora works to financially support her husband in providing for the family. Her husband is a palm nut farmer and she is a trader. She trades foodstuffs. Debora buys foodstuffs such as maize, cassava, yams, plantains, etc. all the way from Afram Plains. She sells to food vendors and retailers in her community. Debora has been in this business for twenty two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure foodstuffs

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A. is a 40 year old woman. She is married and the mother of four children, who are currently in school. She lives in her husband’s house in Akim Wenchi, which is in the eastern region of Ghana. Regina works very hard to support her husband in providing for her childrens' basic needs. 

She is a food vendor who sells rice and stew by the community school where she lives. She started her business about twelve years ago to take care of her entire family. Her food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to support her business.

She wants to use the loan to buy more meat, vegetables, and bags of rice to produce food in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support and provide for her family, as well as finance her childrens' education. 

Regina belongs to a village bank named ‘Nkwa Nsuo,’ which literary means living waters. She is grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat, and firewood.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. is forty eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, one son and three daughters. She says that all of her children are currently out of basic school.  She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town named Takorase, which is near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana.

Abena is a trader. She trades second hand textiles – clothes for both men and women and also bed sheets. She procures bales of textiles from Accra and sells them in her community by hawking. She says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Abena has been in this business for eight years and desires to expand her business. This will allow her to sponsor her children to attend higher levels of schooling.

loans.use: To procure second hand textiles

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi B. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters.  Her children are all out of school and currently learning trades. Her husband is a cocoa farmer. Esi lives with her husband and the children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town named Takorase, which is near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana.
 
Esi is a trader. She trades smoked fish. She procures the fish from nearby towns and sells on a table top in the market square. Esi also sells palm nuts to food vendors. She has been in this business for five years and desires to expand her business. She is hopeful to improve her standard of living and give her children the support they need.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish in bulk.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is a 42 year old mother of four children, who are aged 9 to 21 years. She is married to a machinist and sells food in the Nyamasaria slum to augment his income. She sells cereals like beans and rice and would like to expand to start selling Irish potatoes as well. She says she will use the profits to pay back her loan and purchase more food stock for her business. 

Joyce recently joined the K-MET Volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW volunteer, she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Cereals

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia O. is divorced and has two kids. She lives with her family at Akim Wenchi in the eastern region of Ghana. She is 31 years old.

For the past six years, Afia has run a clothing shop where she sells jeans, blouses, skirts, women's slippers, other clothes, and dressing bags. She takes her stock of goods from importers at Accra. Afia works very hard to provide a quality education for her children. Afia is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs a loan to inject more working capital into her business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to have the resources to purchase good quality goods in large quantities to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance. She belongs to a village bank called Nkwa Nsuo, which literary means living waters.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua N. is thirty–five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, three sons and one daughter, who are all still in primary school. Her husband is a cocoa farmer. Akua lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana.

Akua is a trader. She trades in smoked fish. She procures the smoked fish from nearby towns and sells it from a tabletop in the market square. Akua also sells all kinds of vegetables. She has been in business for two years and desires to expand her business. She is hopeful that she can improve her standard of living and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize, rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa B. is 45 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters. She says one of her children has completed school and is currently learning a trade. The rest are in the senior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 
Adwoa is a trader. She trades in earthenware and all kinds of household items such as coal pots, brooms, etc. She procures the wares and the other items from wholesalers in Oda. Adwoa sells in a kiosk in the community market. She has been in business for eight years and desires to expand her business. She wants a loan to procure more goods to increase her stock. Adwoa hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy charcoal and bags of maize in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more raw materials like maize, rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina B. is 42 years old and married with five children. Two children are in the senior high school and the rest are in the junior and elementary level. To support her husband and children, she has been selling rice, tin tomatoes, vegetable oil, and other assorted cooking spices on top of a table in the local market.  She has been selling to her loyal clients for six years now. Though she is married, her husband is not earning enough to support the entire home. Therefore part of the family responsibility rests on her shoulders. She requests a loan to expand her inventory so she can earn good income for the family’s needs. She would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the group called “Wonderful Jesus.”

loans.use: To increase her stock of tin tomatoes, vegetable oil, spices, etc.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna A. N. is the 40-year-old mother of eight children. The oldest is 22 while the youngest is eight. Right now, she cannot afford to send all of them to school. She is married to a fisherman and they live in Dunga, a small fishing village just outside of Kisumu. For added income, Lorna sells fruits and vegetables in Kibuye market, which is Kisumu's largest open-air market. She purchases the fruit from Busia and Tanzania. She will use the loan to buy fruits like mangos, pears, oranges, lemons and plums. The profit will go towards paying back the loan and paying school-fees for her children.
Lorna recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (which is a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is a 40-year-old trader. She is divorced and a mother of three children. The eldest one is at the polytechnic while the rest are in senior high school. She trades in onions, tubers of yam, tomatoes, pepper, and other foods.  She works from a tabletop in the local market of Akim Wenchi where she lives. She says that through this business she has endeavored to support all her children, at least through their secondary education. For some time now she has been facing challenges in her business due to inadequate funds. She requests the loan to enable her to buy increased stock of tomatoes, tubers of yam, onions, and pepper to grow her business. She hopes to increase her savings to support the education of her children and therefore to give them better futures and hope. Mary is convinced that when the loan is given to her she will be better equipped to expand her business. Mary belongs to a village bank called Nkwagyedom which literary means “Savior of the multitude or many.”

loans.use: To buy stock of yam, onions, tomatoes, pepper and other spices

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: El señor José Francisco S., tiene la edad de 62 años , habita en el barrio San Francisco , junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas y las actividades del hogar , ellos tienen cinco hijos , ya todos casados , ellos le apoyan con los gastos del hogar , los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar los cultivos y poder comprar un terreno , para darle a cada uno de sus hijos partes iguales ; don José desde hace 50 años se dedica a la actividad agrícola , el inicio con sus propios esfuerzos para poder darle alimentos a sus cinco hijos .Con el financiamiento  va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo y poder tener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Mr. José Francisco S. is 62 years old and lives in the San Franciso district with his wife, who helps him with farm work and running the household. They have five children, all married, who help him with household expenses. His plan for his family is to be able to improve his crops and to be able to buy some land, in order to give each of his children an equal part. José has been farming for 50 years. He began on his own in order to feed his five children. With financing, he is going to buy fertilizers and supplies to improve his crops and to be able to get a good yield.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers to get a good yield.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia G., 32 years old, is married with five children who are currently in school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil for three years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts, while palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernel. She produces these and supplies them to food vendors for use in food preparation. She normally alternates her production between the two products - in other words, by producing palm oil, she automatically obtains the raw materials with which to produce palm kernel oil.

She wants to use her loan to buy more bags of palm nuts, as well as an electric milling machine to increase efficiency so that she can produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to allow her to raise more income, making it possible for her to help her husband provide support for her family and finance their children’s education.

Sophia belongs to a village bank called ‘Nkwa Nsuo,’ which translates literally as "living waters."

loans.use: To buy bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
Abdou D. est un jeune frigoriste, il travaille à l'atelier de Abou SADJI. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des moteurs et faire face aux nombreuses sollicitations des clients en cette période de grande chaleur.
Grâce à son activité ce jeune apporte un soutien non négligeable à sa famille.
texts.en:
Abdou D. is a young man specialized in cooling systems. He works in the Abou Sadji workshop. He is requesting this loan to buy motors so that he can keep up with the numerous requests from customers during this period of very hot weather.

Thanks to this work, the young man is able to make a significant contribution to his family's needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying cooling motors to use for repairs

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda A. is 30 years old, single, and committed to God and her business. For the past year she has been a trader, trading in jeans, blouses, skirts, women's underwear, and bags. She has lots of experience in marketing, but does not have adequate funds for her business. She sells through hawking in the community as well as in other surrounding villages during their market days.

Demand for Linda's products is on the higher side, but she is not able to purchase high-quality products. She believes this loan will help her to access more resources in order to purchase higher-quality items in larger quantities so that she can scale up her sales. She particularly wants to use the loan to purchase denim clothing, ladies' wear, and slippers to increase her inventory.

Linda belongs to a village bank called ‘Nkwagyedom,’ which translates as "savior of the multitude or many."

loans.use: To purchase denim clothes, ladies' wear, and slippers for sale.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina A., 40 years old, is married and the mother of six children. She is a food vendor who prepares and sells tea (or coffee) served with bread and fried eggs. All her children are currently in school in the community where they live. Their education is possible through the government's free compulsory education system.

Christina is dedicated to providing a better future for the children. She has sold tea and bread in her neighborhood for many years now. Her service is patronized by many people in the community. Her only problem is that she needs more funds to buy loaves of bread from the bakers as well as other foodstuffs. It is her desire to expand her food operations, so she has requested a loan to support the purchase of items like bread, margarine, and sugar.

She belongs to a village bank called ‘Nkwa Nsuo,’ which translates as "living waters."

loans.use: To buy items like bread, Milo, sugar, margarine, and pure water for her food vending business.

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Bouba B. vend des produits forestiers tels que les rôniers, les crintins qui servent de clôture et toiture dans les sites touristiques.
Grâce à cette activité, ce pére de famille de 7 enfants, arrive à subvenir à ses besoins
Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer ses activités.
texts.en:
Boubacar B. sells woodland products such as palm fronds and bamboo which serve to build fences and roofing in touristic sites. Thanks to this business, this father of a family of 7 children, manages to make a living. He is requesting this loan to reinforce his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of woodland products

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace S., 37 years old, is married and the mother of three children. One is presently in the senior high school and the younger two are in the junior high school. She is a multi-skilled businesswoman who trades in different business areas. Her husband is a farmer specializing in cocoa and crop farming.

Grace owns and operates a grocery shop, where she sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, and skimmed powdered milk, as well as such things as body lotion and shampoo. She deems it a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. With her 18 years of trading experience, she wants to increase her inventory by using her loan to buy more items for sale in her shop. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for the children's education.

Grace belongs to the village bank called ‘Yohane,’ which translates to "John."

loans.use: To buy items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, and skimmed powdered milk, as well as such things as body lotion and shampoo, to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther B. is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Her children are currently in school. Her husband is a farmer, and they live at Akim Wenchi in the eastern region of Ghana. Esther sells clothing items such as jeans, blouses, brassieres, and ladies' slippers, as well as other items, particularly cosmetics.

To support her household, she has been hawking her cosmetics and other items to her loyal clients in the neighborhood. She says she has found that selling cosmetics is very lucrative, and she therefore wants to expand her cosmetics inventory. This will enable her to make good income to serve the family’s needs. With this loan, she hopes to make a personal trip Accra to purchase her goods in bulk.

Esther belongs to the village bank called ‘Nokwarefo,’ which translates to "Trust."

loans.use: To buy more cartons of cosmetics, as well as to purchase jeans, ladies' dresses, and other clothing items for sale.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn J. O. is a 30-year-old mother of four children. Her husband died four years ago, and she is now raising the children on her own. She lives in a Nylanda slum where she sells tomatoes and small fish called Omena. Rosalyn's goals are to continue to raise her children, send them to school, and feed them properly. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to increase her stock.  

Rosalyn recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW, she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To increase stock of her fish selling business

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana E. is 40 years old. She is widowed with four children who are currently in school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil for eleven years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts, and the fruits from the palm nuts are also processed through various stages to obtain the oil which is used to prepare many local dishes. Nana produces and supplies it to food vendors to prepare their meals. She normally treks them in gallons to the big cities in Ghana like Accra and Kumasi. In addition to that, she also sells items like onions, peppers, and spices on top of a table in the market.

Nana wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency to produce oil in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business, enabling her to raise more income to support her children’s education. Nana belongs to the village bank called ‘Yohane’ which literary means John.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata A. is a 40-year-old mother of five children between the ages of 17 and 32. She has no grandchildren and is married to a farmer. She lives in Nyamasaria and would like a loan to purchase more seeds to plant and additional vegetables to sell. She is asking for 10,000 KSH.

Consolata recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To buy seeds and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret A. is a 55-year old fish seller. She lives in the Nylanda slum in Kisumu where she sells fish that she purchases from nearby Dunga Beach. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to increase her ability to buy more fish. 

Margret recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa T. is 30 years old. She is a married woman with three children. At the moment, all her children are in school. She lives with her family at Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. For the past ten years, Yaa has devoted herself to baking bread and pastries in her home. She bakes and fries pastries like donuts, flour chips, and others things. Demand for the pastries has increased as a result of constant supply and 'just in time' delivery. Her customers book their orders in advance, and before they come, it's already ready. She sells what is left by herself through hawking in the market.

She says the price of the commodities is increasing which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market. Yaa needs the loan to restock her inventory and buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk, and firewood etc. She said your assistance would be much welcome and helpful to her. Yaa belongs to the village bank called ‘Ahotefo’ which literary means Saints.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood etc.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia N. is 45 years old and she is divorced and a mother of one child who is currently working. She got divorced nine years ago after her husband got someone else pregnant. Meanwhile, she was doing everything to satisfy the husband. She lives in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a trader who deals with assorted products, such as cooking utensils, clothing materials, ladies slippers, etc. She mostly sells through hawking (house to house selling) and has been in this trade for six years. With her humorous behavior, she has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her. 

She treks to Accra to purchase her stock of goods and recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more supplies of the products like cooking utensils, clothing materials and ladies slippers which are frequently demanded by her customers. With the loan she would have more resources to make lots of profits to build a store and reduce the frequent walking on the street to sell. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Ahotefo’ which literally means Saints. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To increase her stock of inventory like cooking utensils, clothing materials, slippers etc.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort O. is 48 years old and is a married mother with five children. Two are currently in school and the rest are working. Her husband is a farmer in the community where they live. She lives at Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a trader who deals with assorted products like cooking utensils, clothing materials, ladies slippers etc. and mostly sells through hawking (house to house selling). On a few occasions Comfort sells on the market days at one spot.

She has been in this trade for six years. Her humorous behavior has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her. She treks to Accra to purchase her stock of goods. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. 

She requests a loan to buy more supply of the products like cooking utensils, clothing materials and ladies slippers which are frequently demanded by her customers. With the loan she would have more resources to make lots of profits to build a store to reduce the frequent walking on the street to sell. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Ahotefo’ which literally means Saints. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To increase her stock of inventory like cooking utensils, clothing materials, slippers etc.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua B. is 49 years old. She is married with four children. Through her hard effort, all her children are in school. Her husband is a professional carpenter. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. Apart from that she also sells onions, spices and pepper on top of a table.

She deems this a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc., to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her save more for the children’s education. Akosua belongs to the village bank called "Nokwarefo" which means Trust.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. started her fish sales four years ago at Oda, where she lives. Elizabeth serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She is now 36 years old and married with three children, who are currently in school.

Elizabeth belongs to the village bank called ‘Nokwarefo’ which literally means 'trust'. She wants to use this loan to buy increased stock of assorted fishes to make increased sales and income to support her children's education and business growth. She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fishes.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La señora Maria Teresa R., tiene la edad de 49 años, habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, ella es madre soltera,  tiene un hijo de 26 años el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar y una hija de 23 años la cual es enferma, doña Maria  desde hace veinte años tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación y los fines de semana vende nacatamales y comida, para obtener otros ingreso,  los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Ella inicio su negocio con sus propios esfuerzos y ahora con préstamo que Afodenic ha otorgado este es su cuarto ciclo que va invertir para comprar granos básicos, productos de consumo diario, para ofertar a sus clientes, da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios que ha dado a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Teresa R. is 49 years old and lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla housing development in the town of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother. She has a 26-year old son who works and helps her with household expenses, and a 23-year old daughter who is ill. Maria has run a general store out of her home for 20 years, and on weekends she sells nacatamales (stuffed corn cakes) and food in order to get more income. Her plan for her family is to improve her living conditions. She began her business on her own, and now with this loan that Afodenic has granted, this is her fourth, she will invest in buying basic grains and goods for daily consumption to offer her customers. She gives thanks to the organization for the benefits it has given her family.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains and goods for daily consumption.

loans.name: Crecencia

texts.es:
La Señora Crecencia  tiene 47 años de edad, madre soltera de cinco hijos, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua, una mujer emprendedora creando un ingreso económico por medio de la comercialización de comidas caseras y la iniciación de una pulpería.
Sus planes es que con mayores ingresos realizar mejoras en su vivienda y estabilidad económica. Con el préstamo en Afodenic lograr comprar variedad de productos básicos como: arroz, frijoles, maíz, aceite, verduras y otros productos de los cuales abastecerá la pulpería y la comideria, ofreciendo a sus clientes una variedad de alimentos, con esto espera captar clientes nuevos y obtener mejor ganancia,
texts.en:
Crecencia, 47, is a single mother of five children. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of the city of Managua. Crecencia, an enterprising woman, is creating income by selling home made meals and starting a mini market. When her income increase she plans to improve her home and have economic stability. With a loan from Afodenic she will buy a variety of basic products like rice, beans, corn, oil, vegetables and others to stock her mini market and eatery. She will offer a variety of foods, and she hopes to gain new customers and a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains and products to make her delicious food

loans.name: Donia

texts.es: Donia cuenta con 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, con la que tiene tres hijos. En su piel curtida se refleja su trabajo en el campo, el que realiza muy contenta en compañía de su esposo; mientras él recoge las papas de la tierra, ella las selecciona de acuerdo al tamaño. Por ello, le pagan a diario 12 soles, por una jornada de 8.00am a 5.00pm, y a su pareja 15 soles. Estos trabajos los realizan generalmente durante las fechas de cosecha; pero pasada esta temporada se dedican a trabajar sus propios cultivos donde siembran papa y alverjas en las chacras de sus suegros y otro tanto, en terrenos alquilados, con la finalidad de hacer que sus siembras se conviertan en rentables y puedan adquirir sus propios terrenos de cultivos. Donia es la tesorera de su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucho aprecio por los préstamos consecutivos que le facilitó MFP, este es su 9no crédito y en todo este tiempo demostró ser muy responsable en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, para la siembra de papas; así como productos que combatan las diversas enfermedades de la papa.
texts.en:
Donia, 29, lives with her partner with whom she has three children. Her well-tanned skin is a reflection of the work she does on the farm, work that she does happily, side-by-side with her husband. While he picks the potatoes in the field, she sorts them according to size. She's paid 12 soles a day for her work, a day that stretches from 8:00am to 5:00pm, and her partner, 15 soles. They generally do this work during the harvest season. This year, though, they're cultivating their own crop, planting potatoes and peas in a field owned by in-laws, as well as land that they've rented, with a goal of turning the crop into an income and buying their own land in the future. Donia is the treasurer of her community bank. She greatly appreciates the loans that she's received from MFP in the past and this is her 9th loan. She's shown herself to be responsible in repaying the loans. The money that she's borrowing will be used to buy fertilizers for the potato crop, along with other products for fighting various potato plant diseases.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for farming business.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Jesús L. ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente. 
Ahora está solicitando nueva mente un préstamo ya que no cuneta con el dinero necesario para pagar la mensualidad de la escuela de su hijo, se la están requiriendo para que puede terminar el ciclo escolar de esté años.
texts.en:
Sr. Jesus Lopez has borrowed from FVP three times before and has repaid each of the loans on time. He's now applying for a new loan because he doesn't have enough money to pay his son's school fees for the coming term, an expense that he has to pay so that his son can finish the school year.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay school fees for coming term.

loans.name: Jencen

texts.es: Jencen tiene 21 años, vive con su pareja, con la que tiene un hijo, por el momento viven en la casa de sus padres. Desde niño conoce a la perfección los trabajos agrícolas, por ser de padres agricultores. Orgulloso y contento remueve la superficie de sus terrenos para que posteriormente la abone y logre una buena producción en tiempos de cosecha, la que después comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad, aunque posteriormente piensa vender en la misma chacra para evitarse el transporte. Jecen se siente muy orgulloso de ser chacarero, esta es su única fuente de trabajo, y la mayoría de las veces le ha sido rentable. Además, cuenta con el apoyo de sus suegros, que le brindan sus tierras a sin ningún costo, por ello que sus metas a corto plazo son de comprar sus propias chacras de cultivo y un terreno donde pueda construir su casa. Para alcanzar este objetivo está trabajando como peón; aunque le es muy dificultoso por el momento no es imposible, comenta. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para abonar la chacra de papas que hace 3 días ha sembrado.
texts.en:
Jencen, 21, lives with his partner with whom he has a son. For now, they're living with her parents. He's had a thorough understanding of farm life from the time he was a boy because his parents are farmers. Proudly, happily, he turns over the top layer of soil in his fields so that he can later fertilize them and ensure a good crop when the harvest rolls around. Afterwards, he'll sell the crop in the markets in the city or, perhaps, he's thinking, sell right from the field to avoid the transportation costs. Jecen is proud to be a farmer. It's his only work and, for the most part, it's been a profitable business. He counts on support from his in-laws who provide land to him at no cost. Jencen's short-term goal is to buy his own farm and land where he can build a house. To reach his goal, he's starting at the bottom. He says that the goal is difficult but not impossible. The money that he's applying to borrow is for chemical fertilizers to fertilize the potato fields that he seeded 3 days ago.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Yudith

texts.es: Yudith tiene 20 años, vive con su pareja, con la que tiene un hijo, por el momento están viviendo en la casa de sus padres. Su mayor anhelo es contar con sus propios terrenos cultivables, ahora viene sembrando en chacras alquiladas, el trato es compartir el 50% de las ganancias con el dueño, pero muchas veces esta persona se aprovecha y no cumple lo convenido. Pero por el momento no puede cambiar su situación, solo le queda que seguir trabajando para cosechar buenos frutos, por lo que se siente muy complacida, a pesar de la injusticia en el reconocimiento de su trabajo. Por ello es que su mayor anhelo es contar con sus propios terrenos, en aras de mejorar su situación económica y la de su familia. Yudith viene trabajando tres préstamos consecutivos con MFP, donde todo este tiempo fue muy responsable en cada uno de sus pagos, y algunas veces apoya en las funciones como vocal de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, ya que con la venta de estas cosechas podrá preparar otras chacras para sembrar papa.
texts.en:
Yudith, 20, lives her her partner with whom she has a son. For now, they're living with her parents. Her greatest hope is to have her own farm. For now, though, she's cultivating a crop on rented land. The arrangement is that 50% of the earnings go to the owner of the land but this person often takes advantage of the situation and disregards the agreement. Yudith can't change the situation for now, so all she can do is continue growing lovely fruit, something that gives her great pleasure despite the unfairness of what she's paid for her work. You can see, though, why she hopes to have her own farm, to improve her economic situation and that of her family. Yudith has received three consecutive loans from MPF and has been responsible in repaying them. She's active at her community bank, [sometimes acting as a spokesperson for it?]. She will use the money that she's borrowing to buy chemical fertilizers. The sale of this crop will allow her to plant other fields with potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 26 años, vive en su casa propia, al lado de su hermana y su pequeña sobrina. Tras mucho esfuerzo y gracias a sus ahorros pudo poner en marcha su pequeña bodega, en la cual trabaja todos los días para que le arroje buenos resultados. Siempre apoya a su hermana y a su sobrina, la cual es su adoración, y quiere brindarle lo mejor, ya que a pesar que aún no tiene hijos, ve en su pequeña sobrina a una hija. Adela trabaja desde tempranas horas en la mañana y prolonga su trabajo hasta las 9 de la noche, esta labor es muy cansada, ya que tiene que permanecer durante casi todo el día atendiéndolo pero, tener que cuidar a su sobrina en el transcurso del día hace que sea más llevadero, además ha hecho muy buenas amigas en sus clientas que siempre visitan su bodega por el gran carisma que tiene. Adela nota que su clientela sigue creciendo haciendo más rentable su trabajo y es por eso que en el futuro quiere expandirlo comprando todos los productos que necesita para su bodega. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, prometiendo ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Adela is 26 years old and lives in her own home which she shares with her sister and small niece. After much effort and savings she was able to start her small grocery store where she works every day in hopes of maximizing her profits. She supports her sister and her niece who is her adoration and wants to provide them with the best for, even though she has no children of her own, she considers her niece a daughter. Adela works from early morning until 9pm. This is exhausting work since she must spend most of the day at work. However, since she also babysits her niece, this pleasurable activity makes her work day more tolerable. Additionally, many of her customers have become good friends and they visit her at the store because of her great charisma. Adela has noticed that ther customer base continues to grow making her business even more profitable and this is the reason she want to increase her inventory thereby offering all the products her customers want. This is her first loan from PRISMA Microfinancing and she vows to be punctual with her repayments. With the requested funds she will buy merchandise to increase her available inventory in order to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Lisset

texts.es: Lisset tiene 22 años, es soltera vive en su casa propia con su hermana, con quien se apoya mutuamente para salir adelante. Desde muy joven tuvo que dedicarse a diferentes labores para poder cubrir sus gastos, ya que al no poder tener una educación superior tuvo que ingeniárselas para lograr mantenerse, felizmente todo su arduo esfuerzo tuvo resultados, con sus ahorros logró montar una pequeña bodega en su casa lo cual le facilita las cosas porque es un trabajo que puede realizar en la comodidad de su hogar. Pero no todo es tan fácil como parece, ya que ella atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta aproximadamente las 9 o 10 de la noche, si se queda hasta más tarde implicaría algunos riesgos, por los malandrines que salen a esas horas, es por eso que hasta ahora todo le ha ido muy bien. Lisset espera seguir progresando en su negocio al cual le pone todas las ganas, pues sabe que sólo trabajando mucho logrará todas sus metas. Lisset quiere que en el futuro su bodega se convierta en un gran bazar donde pueda ofertar diferentes cantidades de mercadería, y así hacer que sus ingresos económicos mejoren, para que pueda conformar una familia a la cual brindarle lo mejor. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y6 promete ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero comprará gran cantidad de mercadería como gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, etc. para abastecer mejor su pequeño negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Lisset is 22 years old, shares her own home with her sister, and together they strive to get ahead. From a very young age she had to dedicate herself to a variety of jobs in order to meet her basic needs because, due to the fact that she was unable to pursue higher education, she has had to use her own wits to get ahead. Happily, she has done well and she used her savings to set up a small grocery store which she operates out of her own home. But all is not as easy as it appears. She works from 6am until 9 or 10pm not risking to stay open any later due to the petty criminals that come out at night. So far, however, she has been able to succeed. Lisset hopes to continue doing well in her business because she realizes that it is only through hard work that she will be able to get ahead and reach her goals. Lisset would like to have a large warehouse in the future where she can sell a great variety of goods thereby increasing her profits allowing her to form a family that she can provide for. This is her first loan request from PRISMA Microfinancing and she vows to be punctual in her repayments. With the money she will purchase merchandise such as soft drinks, rice, sugar, candy, etc. to better stock her small store thereby bettering her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Mr. Ven P. is 43 years old and is married.  His four teen-aged children are students at the local secondary school. Mr. P. currently makes his daily income by climbing palm trees to tap palm juice and turn it into palm sugar or palm wine to sell at the market. Beside this, he is a domestic trader who orders products in bulk from farmers and sells them to gain additional income. His wife (pictured) is a local rice farmer. Mr. P. has requested a loan from Kiva to be used as capital to buy products from local farmers to re-sell.

loans.use: To order products from local farmers to re-sell

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Saroeurn L. lives in Ta Preak village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Ya Sorn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice. Although this couple works hard they still earn too little income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Saroeurn L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She is a 49-year-old mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. She and her husband are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha S. is a villager in Chey Chrab village in Takeo province. She is a dessert seller. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Sok, is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker. Mrs. Chantha S. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding and will use the rest of money to purchase a battery for her family. She is 44 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. She and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding and to purchase a battery for her family.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en: Mr. Lam P., age 34, has had a job as a requirement worker. He lives with three other family members in a wooden house located in Kompong Tom Province. His wife's name is Khoeun.  She is 31 and earns a living by raising pigs for sale. The couple has two children. Two of them are still minors: one is a student and other one is still not enrolled in school. The family's living conditions are not comfortable since their house is collapsing. That is why Mr. P. is applying for a loan in order to repair his old house. (The picture shows Mr. P.'s wife because P. was not available for photographing.)

loans.use: To repair the family's house

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Mr. Khorn N. is 32 years old and lives in Moeun Tom Rang village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Sout Mao, owns a poultry business. Since her ducks are bigger and bigger, she does not have enough duck food for breeding them. Thus, Mr. Khorn N. decided to ask for a loan to buy duck food for his wife’s business. He has six children: two are duck breeders, three are enrolled in the local school and the youngest  is too young to work or study. Hie and his wife are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy duck food for his wife’s business.

loans.name: Yik

texts.en: Mrs. Yik U. lives in Trapaing Snaur village in Takeo province. She is a grocer and owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Pen Pang, is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice. Mrs. Yik U. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She is 48 years old and the mother of two children;one is employed in a garment factory and the other is attending the local school. She and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Mrs. Norn S. lives in Rolus village in Takeo province. She owns a small business in the local market and is a Pro Hok (fermented fish paste) seller. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more Pro Hok to resell. Her husband, Mr. Yi Thoeun, is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice. Mrs. Norn S. is 29 years old and has a 3 year old child. She and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: Purchasing more Pro Hok to resell to earn more income.

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Sou S. was born in 1966 and is the mother of five children; all of whom are still single and work in different jobs. She currently sells a few soft drinks and cooked ingredients in the village. Mostly her clients are neighbors who live near her house. Her husband helps feed the family by working as an requirement worker. Recently, S. sold all her inventory so she is looking for a loan as capital to increase the quantity of inventory items to sell.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of inventory items to sell

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey C. lives in Rolus village in Takeo province. She is a Pro Hok (fermented fish paste) seller in the local market. She is also a pig breeder. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food for her pig breeding business. She hopes to increase income and improve her family living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Kean Moeun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he uses the rice to make wine. Mrs. Srey C. is 37 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: Purchasing more piglets and pig food for her pig breeding business.

loans.name: Rann

texts.en: Mrs. Rann L. is 40 years old and she lives in Rolus village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder. Since her poultry business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more ducklings to breed. She hopes to increase income and improve her family's living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Ven Saroeun, is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice.She and her husband are shown in the photo.

loans.use: Purchasing more ducklings for breeding

loans.name: Uok

texts.en: Mrs. Uok L. lives in Rolus village in Takeo province. She is a Pro Hok (fermented fish sauce) seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she needs a motorbike to transport the Pro Hok to resell in the village and local market. Her husband, Mr. Chet Mao, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice. Mrs. Uok L. is 58 years old and the mother of five children; three are employed in a garment factory and two are Pro Hok sellers. She and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: Needs a motorbike to transport Pro Hok to resell in the village and local market.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Mrs. Run K. is 37 years old and married to Mr. Chlang, 39. They currently make a living fishing in and around the public lake in Kompong Tom Province. The couple are good parents who are very responsible to their three teenage children, including their food, clothing and medical care.

The family now can't catch much fish due to a lack of fishing tools. Therefore, K. would like a loan from Kiva in order to buy a boat to support her fishing business.

loans.use: To buy a boat

loans.name: Sangin

texts.ru:
Сангин Розиков мужчина 59 лет, женат, имеет 4 детей. Проживает в Ганчинском районе. Животноводство для Сангина основной источник доходов в его семье. Он имеет большой стаж в этой сфере и опыт, так как занимается откормом скота и его  продажей около 19 лет. Дома у Сангина 7 голов крупнорогатого скота, он хочет получить займ, в размере 300 сомони, сроком на 6 месяцев, для закупа корма для домашнего скота.
 Кроме животноводства Сангин работает в сфере сельского хозяйства.Он дехканин.
texts.en:
Sangin R. is a 59-year-old man, who is married and has four children. He lives in the Ganchin district, where raising livestock is his main source of family income. Sangin has been in this line of work for many years and has a great deal of experience, since he has raised and sold cattle for nearly 19 years. Sangin has seven head of large-horned cattle at home, and he wants a six-month loan in the amount of 300 somoni to purchase cattle feed. In addition to raising livestock, Sangin works in agriculture. He is a farmer.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Lul Mohammad

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is Lul M., the son of K. M.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 40 years old and married with four children. He likes to work hard and to earn money for a better life for his children. One of his biggest desires is to have educated children.

He is a farmer. Every day, he wakes up early in the morning and goes on his land to start his work. He would like to expand his business and buy the essential tools and seeds for his land. He also wants to increase his income, so he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months.

He is glad that such effective processes exist in Afghanistan for the support of poor entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and needed tools

loans.name: Fiazullah

texts.en: This is Fiazullah, the son of M. J. M.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 49 and married with five children. He has a shop in which he sells shampoo, soap and other sanitary products. He is a very hard working and confident man. He wants to increase his business, but he doesn’t have so much money for it. So he wants to take an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to buy materials for his shop and to complete the requirements. He is thankful to all lenders for establishing these kinds of programs around the world.

loans.use: To buy materials for his shop

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru:
Мухарам Саримсокова трудолюбивая женщина, занимается животноводством 6 лет. Живет в Зафарабадском районе, поселке Зафарабад с мужем Гайратом и 3 детьми. 
  Мухарам  откармливает домашний скот и перерабатывает молоко. 
  Она очень любит готовить и  кроме животноводства, она изготавливает самсу- это национальные пирожки с мясом, травой или тыквой, и продает их на рынке.
  Она обратилась в "Микроинвест", для того чтобы получить кредит 1600 сомони, для  откорма скота.
texts.en:
Muharam S. is a hardworking woman, who has bred cattle for six years. She lives with her husband Gayrat and three children in the town of Zafarabad, in Zafarabad district. Muharam raises domesticate cattle and processes the milk. She really loves to cook and, in addition to breading cattle, makes samsa, a traditional pastry containing meat, herbs or pumpkin, and sells them in the marketplace. Muharam came to MicroInvest to take out a loan in the amount of 1600 somoni for fattening cattle.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle and selling dairy products

loans.name: Gulam Rasool

texts.en: Gulam Rasool is the son of A. Q.. He lives in Bagrami Kabul Afghanistan. He is 39 and married with three children. He lives in a family of seven including his father and mother. He has lots of responsibilities for his family and he has to pay for all the expenses of the house, so he needs to work hard and earn more money to fulfill their needs. That is why, as a farmer, he works on his farm a lot and tries to have a cultivated land. He would like to purchase different kinds of seeds and some tools for farming, so he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months. He is happy with this effective process.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and tools

loans.name: Khir Mohammad

texts.en: Khir Mohammad is the son of M. G.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 50 years old. He is married with six children. All the children are students except one who helps his father in his business. Khir Mohammad has a general store in which he sells different kinds of things. He would like to expand his business and purchase the things which are in demand in his market. He wants to take an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for the term of 10 months. He is thankful to all lenders around the world.

loans.use: To buy more items for his store

loans.name: Uzmee

texts.en: Uzmee T. is a widow and lives with her 9-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son goes to a local high school. In 1997, she decided to move to Ulaanbaatar from Gobi-Altai, one of the least populated provinces in Mongolia. As soon as she came to the capital city, she started a small retail business selling handbags and suitcases. She rented a small stall in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, and started selling handbags and suitcases. She frequently travels to Ereen, a Chinese border town where many products are imported from, and purchases products to sell at her stall. Her dream is to afford to send her only son to a good university. She would like to make sure that her son receives a better education than she was able to have. She requests a loan to purchase more summer season handbags for women as the season approaches.

loans.use: To purchase summer season handbags for women.

loans.name: Norovsambuu

texts.en: Y. Norovsambuu lives with her husband and son in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son goes a local kindergarten. Y. has a small retail business selling clothing at the "Bombogor" shopping mall, one of the more popular shopping malls in the city. Y. started her clothing business in 2007 when she learned that there was a high demand for cheap, quality clothing from Beijing, China. She often travels to Beijing, China to purchase non-brand, quality clothing for women and men at bargain prices. She is very fashionable and knows well what kind of trendy clothing Ulaanbaatar's young men and women would like to wear. With her extra profit, she hopes to open a saving account for her only son.  She requests a Kiva loan to purchase more clothing from Beijing to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase clothing from Beijing, China

loans.name: Bathuyag

texts.en: Bathuyag B. lives with his wife and two sons in the Arhanghay province of Mongolia. His 6-year-old son is a first grader at a local primary school and his 4-year-old son goes to a local kindergarten. Bathuyag has a small business running a photo service booth. He has been running his photo service booth for the last 11 years and has gained an abundant amount of experience in professional photography. His business capital has increased from 50,000 MNT to 1,000,000 MNT. His wife also supports his business in her free time. In the future, he would like to expand his booth into a professional photo booth that offers the highest quality photo services in town. Bathuyag requests a loan to purchase more film, batteries, and other equipment for his business.

loans.use: To purchase film, batteries, and other equipment

loans.name: Fazala Group

texts.en:
Fazala is the group leader of Fazala group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for her business.

Fazala wants to take a loan for her embroidery business. Leeda wants to take a loan for her quilt making business. Lateafa wants to take a loan for her husband, who is a taxi driver. Nulofer wants to take a loan for her fruit and vegetable shop. They are all very thankful to Kiva lenders, who can support all worlds.

loans.use: for purchasing necessary things for their businesses

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg T. is a 50-year-old widowed mother of one. Her only daughter is married and lives on her own. Erdenechimeg lives in Arhanghay, one of the Mongolian central provinces, on the plot of land she owns. She has been running a retail sales business for the last 19 years. As a result of her hard work, she was able to afford a nice wedding for her daughter, a home for her daughter and electronic items for her personal use. In 2007, she started running a dairy products stall at the local market. Her sister and daughter help her with the business when they have free time. Erdenechimeg is a hard-working, open and loyal person who is well respected in the business community. She requested a loan to buy more dairy products to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy dairy products

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en: Ganhuyag T. is 22 and the married father of one. His family lives on the plot of land he owns in Arhanghay, one of the Mongolian central provinces. Together with his brother, he runs a fabric business at the local market. He goes to Ereen, a Chinese border city to buy fabric at wholesale prices. Many Mongolians buy goods in Ereen for resale. While he goes to Ereen, his brother works at the stall as a salesman. Ganhuyag's wife Narantsetseg stays at home to take care of her infant. Ganhuyag says, "I'm saving money to have my own vehicle". Thanks to his humble and hard working personality, his business has done very well. He requests a loan to purchase more fabric to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric

loans.name: Mohammad Yaqob

texts.en:
Mohammad Yaqob is the son of O. J.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 55 and the father of 9 children. He has a workshop in which he works, and all the family members benefit from the income he generates.

He wanted to repair his house, but he couldn’t because the money he earns in his shop is not enough for both household expenses and house repairing, so he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for the term of 10 months to buy the required construction materials for his house. He is thankful to all Kiva lenders for their great support.

loans.use: Buying constructive materials

loans.name: Maendeleo 'a' Group

texts.en:
Esteria has been a clothes seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 12 years.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250. Every day she works at her business for 7 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Esteria is 42 years old, married, and has three children: ages 11, 17 and 14. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Grene, who has her own small business selling eggs in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Bayarsayhan

texts.en: Bayarsayhan B. and his wife were recently married. They live in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Bayarsayhan's wife stays home but is a big supporter of her husband's business. Bayarsayhan sells firewood. Bayarsayhan started his business in 2004 and since then has gained significant experience in the market and acquired many trusted clients. He travels to the countryside where firewood is cut and sold cheaply. Once he brings the wood back to the town center, he sells it to families who need firewood to stay warm and cook their dinners. In the near future, he hopes to buy a truck which would help expand his business. Bayarsayhan requests a loan to purchase more firewood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase firewood

loans.name: Delgermaa

texts.en: Delgermaa O. lives with her husband and four children between the ages of 11 and 17 in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her four children are all high school students. Delgermaa has a small business selling dairy products. Her husband helps in her business. Since 2000, she has been visiting herder families and purchasing their dairy products such as milk, cheese, cream and curds. She brings them to the local food market and resells them at a profit. Her husband drives his car from family to family to purchase dairy products whenever more is needed. Since 2000, her business capital has increased from 450,000 MNT to 3,000,000 MNT. In the future, she hopes to create a wholesale market for dairy products in her town. She requests a loan to purchase more dairy products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Gafforchon

texts.ru:
Гаффорчон Сидиков торгует на Бадахшанском рынке Зафарабадского района. Продает одежду для детей и для взрослых. Начал он заниматься этим бизнесом год назад. На прибыль полученную от торговли он содержит свою семью. Гаффорчону 31 год, женат на Шахнозе Сидиковой.
  Планирует расширить и разнообразить ассортимент своего товара, с этой целью обратился к нам за помощью.
  Ему нужна сумма в размере 2000 сомони, сроком на 8 месяцев. Он считает что данная сумма, вполне сможет помочь ему, для достижения вышеуказанной цели, а достаток в семье завести ребенка.
texts.en:
Gafforchon Sadikov runs a business at the Badahshan market in Zafarabad district. He sells clothing for both children and adults, and opened the business a year ago. He supports his family on the profits from this trade. Gafforchon is 31 years old, and he is married to Shahnoza Sidikova. He plans to expand and diversify his selection of goods, and with that goal in mind turned to MicroInvest for assistance. He needs an eight-month loan in the amount of 2000 somoni. He thinks that amount will help him to fully achieve both the above-mentioned goal, and that of having a child.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en: Enhtuya B. is 26 years old and lives with her mother and five siblings in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. She, her mother and one of her brothers are the only income earners in the family. As the oldest sibling in the family, she runs a small business in order to pay the everyday expenses of her big family. Since 2000, she has been selling women's and men's clothing at the local clothing apparel market. She frequently travels to Ereen, a Chinese border town where many products are imported, and purchases cheap yet trendy clothes for young women and men. Being 26 years old, she is good at picking desirable clothes for the younger people in the town. She hopes to make sure that all her siblings will be able receive a good education and pursue their dreams. She requests a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen, China for her business.

loans.use: To purchase men's and women's clothes for her business

loans.name: Maendeleo 'a' Group

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old, married, and has six children: ages 15, 12, 9, 6, and 2. Jane has been a fish seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for many years. She currently earns very little monthly profit. Every day she works at her business for twelve hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more fish for resale in order to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Jane will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member Nandiwe. Nandiwe has her own small business selling milk in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Ghulam Rabani

texts.en:
Ghulam Rabani is the son of S. J.. He lives in district 8 in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 40, married, and has 4 children. He is a hard working farmer. He has more than 25 years of farming experience, and has been interested in farming since he was a child.

Now he is a good farmer and he desires to make his business vast. He would like to take an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to purchase the needed tools and the seeds for his land.

He would like to mention that Kiva is a useful process that can support all the entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: for expanding his business

loans.name: Jobir

texts.en:
Since he was very young, Jobir M. has been in touch with the countryside. His family has dedicated themselves to cultivating fruits and vegetables. Jobir always imagined he’d be in the business of selling produce. Fortunately, he realized this dream. At the age of 28, he began to sell vegetables in small markets. Little by little, he saved money so he could set up his own shop. Thanks to his efforts and the love he has for this business, Jobir’s business has been growing gradually.

Jobir believes it is time to inject more capital into the business so that he can buy at wholesale and obtain better prices. As a result, he is soliciting a loan of $550, which he will repay in twelve months. With your help, Jobir will be able to move his business forward and offer his wife and five children a better future.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Bonotoy

texts.en:
Bonotoy A. is a very cheerful woman. Her parents previously traded cattle so she became involved in this business at a very early age. These days trading sheep is one of her family’s indispensable sources of income. Bonotoy also grows rice and different vegetables in her plot of land as another business activity. Together with her husband, who is also farmer, she is providing her dear four children with education and necessary foods thanks to her business ventures.

Bonotoy would like to have capital to invest in her sheep trade business and make enough profits to install basic services in her home. Bonotoy waits for your kind answer.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase sheep for sale.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru:
Фарогат Сатторова  1968 года рождения, вдова, имеет 2 детей. Проживает в Истаравшане и занимается посевом сельхозкультур. Имеет семилетний стаж работы в области сельского хозяйства.
 Хочет получить кредит, чтобы использовать его  для посева кукурузы. Запрашиваемая ею сумма 500 сомони.
 В свободное время Фарогат шьет чапаны (национальный мужской халат) и продает их. Это дополнительный источник ее дохода.
texts.en:
Farogat S. was born in 1968. She is a widow with two children. She lives in Istaravshan and plants crops. She has seven years of experience in farming and wants to take out a loan to use for planting corn. She has asked for 500 somoni. In her spare time, Farogat sews chapans, traditional men's robes, and sells them. This is her additional source of income.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting corn

loans.name: Frola

texts.en:
Frola is widowed woman. She has sold cosmetics in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for many years. She works daily at her business for twelve hours but currently earns very little monthly profit.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to increase her stock of cosmetics. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and her business will grow. She belongs to Nzovwe group loan (group code 2018).

loans.use: To increase her stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Maendeleo 'a' Group

texts.en:
Grace is 31 years old and married with two children, ages 10 and 6. She has been selling hens and eggs in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for six years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more hens and eggs to increase her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Grace will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Eda. Eda has her own small business selling fish in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more hens and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Buvoisho

texts.en:
Buvoisho O., a married mother of four children, has for many years been involved in the cattle-raising business. This noble work that she inherited from her parents fills her with happiness and satisfaction, and thanks to the care and dedication she offers each one of her animals, they reproduce quickly. With the sale of the animals, she can better the economic situation of her family, and most importantly, offer the possibility of completing higher education to her children. Buvoisho and her husband, who also works in this business, wish to keep increasing their quantity and variety of animals to better their quality of life and secure their plans. Both are requesting a loan that will allow them to fulfill their objectives in a short time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Gafurjon

texts.en:
Gafurjon A., a 37-year-old farmer who is assisted by his wife, grows onion and corn to support his family's daily needs. Gafurjon comes from a family of farmers, and through agriculture he is able to build the future of his children. He started cultivating his small parcel of land in 2004, the harvest being used primarily for family consumption with the remainder sold in the market. Currently Gafurjon is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to purchase high quality seeds and fertilizer for his crop. He and his family sincerely thank Kiva and its lenders.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.
