In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Toshbuvi

texts.ru:
Тошбуви Тухлиева родилась в 1975 году, по национальности узбечка, замужем, имеет 6 детей.
Проживает в Шахристанском районе вместе со своей семьей и занимается животноводством. Имеет большой 14 летний опыт работы в этой сфере.
 Хочет получить займ в размере 1000 сомони на 6 месяцев, для откорма крупнорогатого скота и переработки молока.
 Тошбуви дополнительно к животноводству, работает в дехканском хозяйстве "Истиклол".
texts.en:
Toshbuvi T. was born in 1975. Ethnically she is an Uzbek, and is married and has six children. She lives in the Shahristan district together with her family. Toshbuvi raises livestock, and has 14 years of experience in this line of work. She wants to take out a six-month loan in the amount of 1000 somoni to fatten large-horned cattle and process dairy products. In addition to raising livestock, Toshbuvi works on a farm called Istiklol.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Abdukahhor

texts.en:
Abdukahhor B. is 32 years old, married, and has two children that he lives with. He has been a farmer for 10 years, an activity he undertook after having his first child. However, Abdukahhor has always taken pleasure in working the land and now particularly enjoys cultivating tomatoes and millet. Although his crops are annual, they are very profitable, and during the season they are very much in demand in large quantities. For this reason, Abdukahhor diligently cares for his crops so he can benefit from a good harvest. He also mentions that it is difficult sowing the plants and protecting them from insect infestation. This is his first loan application with IMON International. Abdukahhor will invest the funds he requests to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his farmland.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan request for three women living in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, led by Mrs. A., 30, who, along with her husband, owns a shop next to their house where they sell ferrous metal tools to earn a living. They have four single children, all students. To increase the business's capital in order to meet customer demand, Mrs. A. is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner HKL, the money to be used to purchase more ferrous metal to store and later re-sell.

The other two borrowers are: Mrs. Chhob R., a domestic building worker seeking a loan to buy a motorbike for family's riding needs; Mrs. Un R., who sells dried sausage in the market and is requesting a loan to buy additional sausage to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more ferrous metal.

loans.name: Zohirjon

texts.en:
F. Zohirjon is 30 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children. He has been a farmer for 10 years, since the time of his marriage. This work enables him to support his family and it is for this reason that he works so hard and with such determination.

Zohirjon enjoys planting tomato and onion on his land and he likes harvesting even more because this is when he can see and appreciate the high quality of his products. In general, the production of tomato and onion in his area is good and there is great demand for them. The most difficult part of the business is planting season, especially with the cost of fertilizers that are necessary for good yield. This is Zohirjon’s first loan through IMON International. He plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crop.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en:
I. Muyassar is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two children; having a stable family life makes her very happy. She dedicates her time to growing tomato and onion, hard work that she performs with her husband on their small farm located away from their home. They have been farming for 20 years. Farming takes up most of her day, for this reason she organizes her time so as not to neglect her children.

Muyassar is worried about the price increase of the fertilizers and other products that help to get good yield from her soil. Muyassar’s goal is for her children to become professionals, this is the reason for her earnest work. The proceeds from the loan that she is currently requesting will go toward for the purchase of good quality seeds and fertilizer which will increase her production and make it more profitable.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao N., a 36-year-old mother of three children attending the local school, lives in Rolus village in Takeo Province, where she breeds ducks. Since her poultry business is doing well, she is requesting a loan to expand it by purchasing more ducks to breed, hoping to thereby increase income and improve her family’s living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Tom Sovan, is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which he cultivates rice. Mao and her husband are presented in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks to breed.

loans.name: Gwantina

texts.en:
Gwantina is a fruit seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to the Nzovwe '1' group loan and currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day, she works 12 hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fruits for sale, hoping to expand her business.

Gwantina is hopeful that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business. She is 32 years old and married, and she has three children, ages four, six, and 12.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for sale so as to expand her business.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a married woman who has been an animal feed seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for many years. She belongs to the Nzovwe '1' group loan and currently earns very little monthly profit. She sells animal feed to her customers 12 hours every day.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more animal feed to add to her current stock, hoping that this will allow her to improve her business. She hopes that she will be able to increase her profits and expand her business with the help of this loan.

loans.use: To buy more animal feed to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en:
The business of agriculture and livestock is a job that requires great sacrifice. The work is demanding because the laborer spends his days in the field, exposed to the sun for many hours, and moving animals over long distances.

K. Maruf is able to meet these challenges. He has been devoted to his agricultural business for more than six years. Maruf is a humble family man with a wife and two children, for whom he provides food as well as support for the children's studies.

He is requesting a loan in order to invest in his agriculture business through the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer for his farming business.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: Mrs. Nan S. lives in Rolus village in Takeo province. She sells prahok (fermented fish paste, condiment) in the local market. Since she has a lot of consumers who have many demands, she wants to expand her business. She has decided to request a loan to buy more prahok to add to her business and to support her customers. Her husband, Mr. Oeng Chen, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Mrs. Nan S. is 25 years old and is the mother of a 4 month old child. She and her husband are presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more product to add her business and to support her customers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose O. is a 32-year-old mother of five children. Her eldest child is 17 and the youngest is 3. She sells small fish in Kisumu that she purchases in Mombasa and Mbita. She is married to an electrician. Her main challenges are the costs associated with transporting her supplies and lack of adequate finance. She is asking for 20,000 KSH ($275 US) to increase her inventory.

Rose recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients. She will also provide reproductive health education, refer patients to local clinics and hospitals, and provide basic health care.

loans.use: To transport fish for her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 28-year-old mother of five children. Her eldest child is 13 while the youngest is just 9 months old. She is married to a mechanic in Kisumu. Rose sells second-hand clothes in the Kiubye market, where she also purchases her second-hand clothes in bulk. She is asking for 20,000 KSH ($275 US) to increase her inventory. 

Rose recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To increase clothing inventory.

loans.name: Mahkamjon

texts.en:
O. Mahkamjon is 23 years old, married, and has two children. He has spent many years plowing wheat and vegetables as a business that was given to him by his father. He works hard, together with his wife, in the field so that he can send his children to school in future when they grow. Mahkamjon says, "Life in the field is never easy. I plow using the traditional method all day not minding the heat of the sun because I have an ultimate goal for my kids and that is to give them a better future". Mahkamjon started farming 7 years ago and now he has acquired his own land and is requesting for a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Rose Achieng

texts.en:
Rose Achieng M. is a 30-year-old mother of three children. She is married to a road construction worker. All of her children are in school and she uses the profits from her fish-selling business to pay for school fees. She purchases her fish from a fishing village in Kisumu called Dunga and sells them in Nylanda slum here in Kisumu. She is asking for 10,000 KSH ($150 US) to purchase a home so she will not have to rent anymore. She hopes to send all her children all the way through university.

Rose recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase a house.

loans.name: Mrs. Kheim Sout Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people living in Romon village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purpose.

Mrs. Kheim S. is the 37-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. She also breeds chickens in the house. Her husband, Mr. Duong Vanna, is a motor taxi driver. Although they try to work hard they still earn insufficient income to support their family living. Thus, Mrs. Kheim S. decided to ask for a loan to bU. more chickens and she would use the rest of the loan to bU. piglets for breeding. She has two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

Five members in this group are applying for end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those receiving EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a 21-year-old motorbike repairman. In Kisumu, motorbikes are a common mode of transport and are generally referred to as piki-piki. Tom is not married and has no children. He says he enjoys his work and hopes to become a successful businessman one day.

Tom is asking for 20,000 KSH to purchase more spare parts so he can expand his business. He says right now his biggest costs are the high cost of transporting the spare parts (he does not own a piki-piki of his own) and not always having enough parts for his customers.

loans.use: Spare Parts

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth O. is the 23-year-old mother of two children ages 6 and 3. She is married to a plumber and runs a small food kiosk in Nyamasaria slum. She is asking for 20,000 KSH to purchase more stock so she can meet her customers' needs. She buys her supplies from Kibuye Market, Kisumu's largest open air market and also from her neighbors. She says her main challenges are the high inflation rate and lack of adequate finance.

Ruth recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To buy more food stocks

loans.name: Ziyadkhan

texts.en: Ziyadkhan was born in 1953. Seven years ago this man started taxi business. With this business, he supports his family. He is married and has 5 children. He lives in Khachmaz town. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN ($2500 US) to buy the spare parts to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to improve taxi business.

loans.name: Mrs. Sieb Meas Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank, which consists of fourteen members, is located in Romon village in Takeo province, Cambodia. They plan to use the loan, which they obtained, for different purposes. Mrs. Sieb M. is the village bank president. She was selected by the group members. She is a farmer and she owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Em Phalla, is a motor taxi driver. Aside from this work, he is a palm juice collector. Mrs. Sieb M. is requesting a loan to buy a cow, for breeding, to earn more income for her family. She is 34 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. 

Eight members in this group have loans that are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn more income for her family.

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is the 29 year-old mother of two children, although she also had two other children pass away. She is married to a photographer who works in Kisumu. She is asking for 10,000 KSH ($150 US) to purchase more cosmetic supplies as they are popular with her customers. The cosmetics are expensive and she does not have the money to purchase them. She sells her items and lives in Nyamasaria slum in Kisumu.

Evalyne recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Mr. Channa K. is villager in Krang Thnang village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he faces a problem because he does not have enough money to hire laborer with two oxen to plow the field. He has decided to ask for a loan to buy a buffalo to use with his old buffalo to plow on the field and to reduce his expenses. His wife, Mrs. Saem Sokhun, owns a poultry business. Mr. Channa K. is 25 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. He and his wife are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to use with his old buffalo to plow the field and to reduce his expenses.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene A. O. is the 35-year-old mother of eight children, aged 3 to 19 years. Most of her children are not in school right now. She is married to a businessman who sells ropes and bags to fishermen in Dunga, where Irene purchases fish for her business. She transports the fish into Kisumu (about 5 km) where she sells them on the street. She is asking for 10,000 KSH ($150 US) to expand her business and to pay for school fees for one of her children. Irene tells us that her husband is sick and often can't work, so she must support her family. Her family home has also been flooded by recent rains and they have been staying with other family members.  

Irene recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. O. is a 40-year-old mother of seven children, ages 13-27. She is selling cloth used for clothing and bags that she purchases in Nairobi. If she can't afford to get them in Nairobi, she will purchase them from wholesalers at Kibuye, Kisumu's largest open air market. She says on average, she can make about 20,000 KSH a month, depending on how many customers come. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to buy more materials for her business and to pay school fees for the children.

Joyce recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: buying cloth for re-sale

loans.name: Trea

texts.en:
Mr. Trea K. lives in Kdey Thnaut village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. In his plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer and gasoline to pump water to support the field during the dry season. Additionally, he wants to use the rest of the loan money to hire laborers to work on the field.

His wife, Mrs. Un Mut, is a dessert seller. Mr. Trea K. is 53 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is employed in a casino. He and his wife are both in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline to pump water and pay laborers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old, married, and has four children: ages 18, 15, 13 and 8. She is a chicken seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Nzovwe '1' group loan (Group code 2018). She currently earns very little monthly profit. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more chickens for re-sale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for re-sale

loans.name: Carren

texts.en:
Carren W. is the 36-year-old mother of two children, ages 14 and 12. She is married to a coordinator in Migori. She runs a small business selling bags, second-hand bags, and shoes in Kibuye market, Kisumu's largest open-air market. She lives on the outskirts of Nylanda Slum close to Dunga Beach. She wants to increase her stock and is asking for 10,000 KSH. She says she averages around between 6,000-10,000 KSH in profit a month (about $125 USD) and says she likes running her own business because she never goes without money.

Carren recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Bags, Shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mrs. Channa S. is a farmer in Sophy village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Nget Thy, is a construction worker. Aside from this work, he is a palm juice collector. Although they try to work hard, they still earn too little income to support their family.

In order to improve their living standard, Mrs. Channa S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy two cows for breeding and to reduce her expense for plowing the field. She is 36 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. She and her husband are both in the picture.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: This young man is single. Samir was born in 1983 and lives in Khachmaz region, in the Murshud Oba village. Three years ago he started his farming business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy pesticides, fertilizer and seedlings for improving his farming business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 51-year-old woman who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Samira has been working as a seamstress for ten years. She requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase thread for her work. This is the first time that Samira has requested a loan.

Samira is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients, and she is also good at her work. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had difficulty building her startup capital. Samira decided on doing her business because of her experience, as well as the fact that she always liked sewing. In the future, she plans on expanding her store.

loans.use: Samira will use the loan to purchase thread for her work.

loans.name: Abdo

texts.en:
Abdo is a 31-year-old engaged man who lives in Bint Jbeil, in southern Lebanon. Abdo has been working as a sanitary worker for ten years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. Abdo is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the experience, so building a network wasn’t easy for him. Also, he had to learn new techniques in order to face the competition. Abdo decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Abdo will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 26-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, in southern Lebanon. Hanan has owned a bakery for three years.

She makes “saj” and “mankoucheh.” The “saj” is a metA. oven where she makes saj bread. It is a traditionA. Lebanese cooking dome that is also used to make Markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections, or Mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, and the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it any time of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.

Hanan requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase merchandise and raw materials for her bakery. This is the first time that Hanan has requested a loan.

Hanan is speciA. in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and she is known for the good taste of her mankoucheh. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and tourists. When she first started, she didn’t have startup capitA.. Hanan decided on doing her business because she wanted to be independent and prove to herself that she was able to handle her work. She was also self-confident. In the future, she plans on expanding her business by purchasing a new machine to do French baguettes.

loans.use: Hanan will use the loan to purchase merchandise and raw materials for her bakery.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Now's Group

texts.en:
There are five people requesting this small loan, all residents of the province of Siem Reap. Mrs. A. has been selected to be the leader by the members. Mrs. A. owns a few rooms and rents them out for daily income. To help with the family's daily expenses, her husband drives a trailer-motor (tuk tuk) taxi. The couple has two teenage children who both go to the local public school. A.'s husband currently can't earn as much income as before because his trailer is often broken. Because of this, A. has decided to seek a loan to buy a new one.

The other four borrower are: S., who is a tuk-tuk driver seeking a loan to replace his old tuk tuk; P., a local chef looking for capital to buy a motor for her husband to begin driving a taxi; S., who owns rooms to rent out to customers and needs a loan to purchase a motor for the family; and S., a local chef requesting a loan to replace her old motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a trailer-motor

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru:
Абдулло Умаров занимается животноводческой деятельностью около 8 лет. Проживает он Шахристанском районе с женой Дилором и детьми.Родился Абдулло в 1979 году.
  Ему нужен займ в размере 1600 сомони для откорма скота, с последствием его продажи.
  Дополнительный семейный доход Абдулло приносит переработка молока и его деятельность в сельском хозяйстве.
texts.en:
Abdullo U. has raised livestock for nearly eight years. He lives in the Shahristan district with his wife Dilor and their children. Abdullo was born in 1979. He needs a loan in the amount of 1600 somoni for fattening cattle, which he will then sell. To bring in additional family income, Abdullo processes dairy products and works in agriculture.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 45-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their nine children. Mohammad has been working as a car painter since 2001. He requested a loan of 3000 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase tools, paint, painting products and a new machine for his work. This is his fourth cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work. Mohammad is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital, and his location was also poor. Mohammad decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by acquiring a painting oven.

loans.use: Mohammad will use the loan to purchase tools, paint, painting products and a new machine for his work.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is an 18-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil. Hussein has been working as a blacksmith for two years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Hussein has requested a loan.

Hussein is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Hussein decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business into a new region.

loans.use: Hussein will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Fatmeh has been working as a seamstress for 15 years. She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase thread and new tools for her sewing machine. This is the first time that Fatmeh has requested a loan.

Fatmeh is speciA. in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her family members and friends. When she first started, she had financiA. issues. Fatmeh decided on doing her business because of her experience. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Fatmeh will use the loan to purchase thread and new tools for her sewing machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
El Sam Ol is 65 years old and resides with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He rents rooms to workers in the garment factory, which typically earns him about $3 every day. His wife, Sem S., 53, has run a grocery store in the market for years to earn a living and is able to make $4 per day. This couple has five children -- three are still young and two are tailors.

Every month, this family spends $60 for food, $10 for utilities and $60 for their children’s expenses. To make more money, Sem S. would like to take out a loan of $600 to expand her grocery’s inventory. Doing this, she will be able to satisfy her customers and make more money than before. (Sem S. is pictured with her customer.)

loans.use: Buy grocery items

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: MR D. EST UN TAILLEUR DE PROFESSION .IL EST EN 1960 A DAKAR ET EST MARIE ET PERE DE TROIS ENFANTS .IL EST MEMBRE DE LA MUTUELLE DEPUIS QUELQUES MOIS ,AVEC CE PRET IL VEUT ACHETER DES TISSUS AFIN DE LES COUDRE POUR ENSUITE LES VENDRE SUR LE MARCHE CENTRAL DE THIES.
texts.en:
Mr. D. is a tailor. He was born in 1960 in Dakar and is married and the father of 3 children. He has been a member of the Mutual group for several months. With this loan he wants to buy cloth to sew so that he can sell the clothing he makes at the central market of Thies.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fabric to sew up for sale

loans.name: Kwamina

texts.en: Kwamina A.. married with two children, received an education through Primary School. Since 2006, he has worked as a driver and trader selling second hand shoes at Elmina market, using his income to pay for his children’s school fees and his family’s bills. His wife also works as a trader.  Kwamina is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes to sell, and with the new profits from his expanded business he plans to save for and further his children's education.

loans.use: Kwamina will use the loan to purchase more shoes for selling.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru:
Баходур  Якубов  мужчина 59 лет, проживает в городе Истаравшане. Женат на Гулбахор, имеет 2 детей. Основной его деятельностью является животноводство.Откармливает скот, перерабатывает молоко, и перепродает крупнорогатый скот на рынке Истаравшана.Место деятельности, его собственный дом.
 Баходур талантливый человек, дополнительный доход он получает от исскуства, которым он занимается на протяжении практически всей своей жизни.
texts.en:
Bahodur Y. is a 59-year-old man, who lives in the town of Istaravshan. He is married to Gulbahor and has two children. His main line of work is raising livestock. He fattens the cattle, processes the milk, and resells large-horned cattle at the Istaravshan market. He does all this at his house. Bahodur is a talented man, who earns extra income from the artwork in which he has engaged practically his entire life.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid lives in the Muskur village in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. This young man is single. He was born in 1983. Two years ago he started a cattle breeding business. He now needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy four calves in order to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy four calves.

loans.name: Buore

texts.en:
Buore is a 29 year old mother of two children, ages 7 and 4 and a half. She sells mandazi (a donut-like pastry), vegetables, and tomatoes in the Manyatta slum in Kisumu. She buys from the Jubilee market in Kisumu and sometimes from Kibuye, Kisumu's largest open-air market. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to add more stock to her growing business.

Buore recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutri Flour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To buy more mandazi ingredients, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 21 year old mother of two children, ages 6 years and 5 months. She sells vegetables that she purchases from the matatu stage (bus stop) in town. She lives near the Manyata slum and sells her goods in the Kibuye market, Kisumu's largest open-air market. She's married to a telephone repair man. She is asking for 15,000 KSH to expand her business. She says that her main challenges are a lack of purchasing power, inadequate finance, and lack of transportation means.

Beatrice recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutri Flour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To buy stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Truphosa

texts.en:
Truphosa is a 36 year old mother of six children, between the ages of 18 and 7. She sells chapati (a tortilla-like bread) and green peas in the Kibuye market. She purchases the supplies to make her chapati within the Kibuye market. She is married to a hawker who sells small items on the streets of Kisumu. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to add more stock to her kiosk as she believes it will attract more customers. She says her main challenges are a lack of storage facilities for un-purchased items that go bad, a lack of purchasing power, low capital, and the inability to feed her children.

Truphosa recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutri Flour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To puchase more chapati ingredients.

loans.name: Esther Agutu

texts.en:
Esther is a 59 year old mother of two children. One of her children recently passed away, as did her husband. She lives in Nyamasaria slum and sells pineapples and mangoes in Kibuye, Kisumu's largest open-air market. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to increase her stock. She says her main challenges are a lack of adequate supplies, inadequate finances, the high price of commodities, and her transportation costs.

Esther recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutri Flour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To buy stock of pineapples and mangoes.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria N. M. works as a merchant selling an assortment of goods such as eggs and Pampers at Elmina which she has done since 1997.  Gloria N. has received Vocational School education.  She is a widow and has 4 children.  She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees and also her family’s bills. Her loan will be used to purchase eggs in crates and other goods to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and build a house.

loans.use: purchase eggs in crates and other goods to sell

loans.name: Rahmatboy

texts.ru:
Рахматбой Тураев  уже около 11 лет занимается животноводством.
 Место его деятельности, его дом. Помогают ему в откорме скота и переработке молока его дети и жена. Рахматбой хочет получить займ 1200 сомони на 6 месяцев, для того чтобы использовать его в животноводстве.
 Он проживает в Ганчинском районе вместе со своей семьей.
texts.en:
Rahmatboy T. has raised livestock for nearly 11 years, and works out of his home. His wife and children help him to feed the cattle and process the milk. Rahmatboy wants to take out a six-month loan in the amount of 1200 somoni to use for livestock. He lives together with his family in the Ganchin district.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle and selling dairy products

loans.name: Anyango

texts.en:
Anyango is the 25-year-old mother of two children, ages 4 and 2. She is married to a carpenter and sells mandazi (sort of like plain donuts) in Kasawino Estate. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to expand her business and pay her children's school fees. Her challenges are low profit margins, the high price of commodities, low purchasing power and inadequate capital.

Anyango recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: School Fees, ingredients for cooked food

loans.name: Asli

texts.en: Asli is a widow with 2 children. She lives in Khachmaz region, in Garagurtlu village. She is 50 years old. She has been baking bread for 5 years. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary things for baking bread.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for baking bread

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica A. is married and has 4 children. She has received schooling through Senior High School. Monica sells Milo (cocoa powder), sugar, soap, etc. in Elmina, which she has done since 1997. Her husband is a private driver. Monica uses her income to assist her husband in paying fees and bills. Monica will use the loan to purchase more provisions for re-sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Monica plans to save and reinvest.

loans.use: purchase more provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en: Mr. Chanthorn P. is a villager in Rolus village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Eng Mom, is a pig breeder. Aside from that business, she sells Pro Hok in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Chanthorn P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more Pro Hok (a condiment nicknamed "Cambodian Cheese" made of salted fermented fish) for his wife to re-sell. He hopes to increase their income and improve his family's living conditions. He is 26 years old and the father of a child who is just 2 years old. He and his wife are both in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more Pro Hok for his wife to re-sell

loans.name: Mobateli Plus Group

texts.fr: Kalobwe N. a passé presque toute sa vie dans le commerce. Depuis l’école primaire, secondaire, niveau supérieur jusqu’à présent, il a acquit une expérience solide sur les activités génératrices des revenus.  Le premier commerce de Kalobwe était la vente du pétrole à lampe qu’il avait commencé en 1978 avec un capital initial de $1 quand il était encore en 2e année primaire. De 1978 – 1988, Kalobwe a durement travaillé avec une bonne gestion qui lui a permis d’accumuler des bénéfices qu’il se servi pour diversifier son activité en y ajoutant de la braise et des poissons salés. En 1988, son affaire totalisait un capital de $ 200. Après avoir obtenu le diplôme d’Etat à l’école secondaire en 1988, Kalobwe s’est rendu à Kinshasa pour poursuivre les études supérieures. De 1989  jusqu’à ce jour, il s’est lancé dans un autre type d’affaire, la vente des chenilles qui sont beaucoup achetées à Kinshasa.  Son capital de relance d’affaire en 1989 était de $ 150. Au fil des années et à l’aide des bénéfices accumulés, il est parvenu à associer d’autres produits tels que des arachides et l’eau purifiée. Actuellement, Kalobwe a un capital avoisinant $1000 et son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $300 par mois. En entrant chez Hope en juillet 2008, Kalobwe veut réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour une petite usine de fabrication d’eau purifiée. Son affaire se situe dans un quartier au nord ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Il a 43 ans, marié et père de huit enfants dont leurs âges varient de 1 à 20 ans. Six d’entre eux vont à l’école. Kalobwe ainsi que sa famille aiment leurs activités car elles leur procurent la possibilité financière de résoudre les problèmes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
Kalobwe N. has spent almost his entire life in business. Through primary and secondary school and up through advanced studies to the present, he has acquired a solid experience in earning a living. Kalobwe's first business was selling lamp kerosene, a business he began in 1978 with a starting capital of US$ 1 when he was still in second grade. From 1978 to 1988, Kalobwe worked hard and practiced good management which allowed him to accumulate profit that he used to diversify his business, adding the sale of charcoal and smoked fish.

In 1988 he had a total capital of US$ 200. After having received his official high school diploma in 1988, Kalobwe went to Kinshasa to register for higher studies. From 1989 up to the present, he got into another type of business selling larval caterpillars (as food), which are much in demand in Kinshasa. His beginning capital for the new business in 1989 was US$ 150.

Over the years and using the profit he accumulated, he managed to begin selling other products as well, for example peanuts and purified water. Presently, Kalobwe has a capital of about US$ 1000 and his business is generating a profit of US$ 300 per month.

Working with HOPE since July 2008, Kalobwe wants to make his dream come true: opening a little factory making purified water. His business is situated in the north-west district of the city of Kinshasa. He is 43, married and the father of 8 children from 1 year old to 20 years of age. Six of his children are enrolled in school. Kalobwe and his family love their businesses because they provide them with the financial means to solve household problems.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bags to pack purified water in for sale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en: Cathrine A. is a divorced mother of 3 children who has received an education through Senior High School.  Cathrine has worked as a trader in Elmina selling a variety of food items such as groundnuts and beans since 1999.  She uses her income to pay for school fees and bills. Cathrine would like a loan to purchase maize, groundnuts, and beans in a larger quantity which she will then prepare and sell.  With the additional profits from her expanded business, Cathrine plans to save and further her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of maize, groundnuts, and beans to help grow her business.

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru:
Хабибулло Карчиев по национальности таджик, родился в 1956 году, проживает в Истаравшане со своей семьей. У Хабибулло 3 детей. Жена работает продавщицей в магазине. Старший сын работает перевозчиком на рынке.
 Хабибулло занимается купле продажей овощей и фруктов(помидоры,огурцы, капуста, бананы и т.д.)
 За товаром ездит в город Худжанд и Б.Гафуровский район. 
 Он хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы оптом закупить товар, после чего Хабибулло раздаст привезенный товар продавцам на рынке.
 Ежемесячно, он получает пенсию в размере 25 сомони.
texts.en:
Habibullo K. is an ethnic Tajik who was born in 1956. He lives with his family in Istaravshan. Habibullo has three children, and his wife works as a saleswoman in a store. Their eldest son makes deliveries in the marketplace. Habibullo buys and sells fruit and vegetables: tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, bananas, et cetera. He travels to the city of Khujand and the Gafurov region on buying trips. He would like to take out a loan to purchase goods in bulk, and in turn sell them to vendors in the marketplace. Every month, he receives a pension of 25 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods in bulk

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina D. is a divorced mother of 3 children who has received no formal education.  She has worked as a fish monger selling smoked fish in Elmina since 2004.  Dina uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees and also her family’s lighting bills. She plans to use the loan to buy and sell larger quantities of fish. With the additional profits from her expanded business, Dina will save and further her children's education.

loans.use: To buy and sell larger quantities fish and grow her business.

loans.name: Galbinur

texts.en: Galbinur is a 30-year-old single man living in Khachmaz town.  He owns an Internet cafe and has been in this business for one year.  He would like to improve his Internet cafe and have a lot of customers.  He will use the loan of 2000 AZN to buy computers and the necessary things for improving and growing his business.

loans.use: To buy computers for his Internet cafe.

loans.name: Mawusi

texts.fr: Monsieur A. mawusi est un monsieur qui réside dans le quartier d’amadhomé, il est marié et père de 04 enfants. Il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la fabrication de savons qu’il revend à ses clients dont la plupart sont des femmes. Cette activité marche bien pour lui car il a bien étudié le marché avant de se lancer, en plus il n’a pas de concurrents dan sa zone d’activité. Actuellement les produits nécessaires à la fabrication de savons sont épuisés raison pour laquelle il s’adresse à WAGES pour demander un prêt afin de s’acheter les produits nécessaires à la fabrication de savons.
texts.en:
Mr. A. Mawusi lives in the Amadhomé district; he is married and the father of 4 children. To earn a living, he makes bars of soap that he sells to his clientele, mostly women. This business is going well, since he studied the market before beginning and moreover, he has no competition where he is located. Presently, his stock of the necessary ingredients for making soap is all used up, and that is the reason why he has come to WAGES to ask for a loan to replenish his stock of these products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of the necessary materials for making soap

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de pagnes et de produits cosmétiques. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, le commerce qu’elle exerce lui permet d’aider son mari dans les charges du foyer. Actuellement son stock de marchandises est épuisé, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter  25 pièces de pagnes et des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
This lady earns her living by selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) and cosmetics. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Her business allows her to help her husband support the family. Presently, her stock of merchandise is sold out and she would like to replenish her stock. She is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 25 lengths of "pagne" and some cosmetics.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" and cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en: Rafik is 37 years old. He lives in Guba region, Zardabi village. This man has run a dairy business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 2 cows to improve his dairy business.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru:
Шоира Мавлонова, женщина,32 года,получила среднее образование, имеет 2 детей,разведена.
 Проживает в Зафаробадском районе.
 Шоира 3 года назад, напротив рынка своего района открыла столовую, которая и приносит доход в ее семью.
 Обратилась она за кредитом, для того чтобы обновить мебель, столовые приборы и все необходимое для столовой.
 Запрашиваемая ею сумма 1800 сомони на 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shoira M. is a 32-year-old woman with a secondary school education. She has two children and is divorced. She lives in the Zafarobad district. Three years ago, opposite the regional marketplace, Shoira opened a cafeteria that brings in income for her family. She has come to MicroInvest for a loan to upgrade the furniture, the tableware and whatever is needed for the cafeteria. She has asked for an eight-month loan in the amount of 1800 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Upgrading furniture and tableware

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is the 26-year-old mother of two children, ages five and two. She is married to a poultry-salesman who works in Kisumu. Evalyne sells ready-made clothes that she buys from wholesalers that come in from Nairobi and Tanzania in the Kibuye market, Kisumu's largest open-air market. She says her main challenges have been the slow-down in customers since the post-election violence, lack of finances, and the high cost of transporting her goods.

Evalyne recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Clothing Stock

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en: Firuz was born in 1986. He lives in the Guba region. 2 years ago he started a dairy business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 2 cows to expand his dairy business.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is a trader selling earrings and necklaces in Elmina, which she has done since 2006.  She is divorced with 2 children and has received an education through Primary School.  She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees and also her family’s bills. Her loan will be used to purchase more jewelry for re-sale, and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and build a house.

loans.use: purchase more jewellery for re-sale

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un chauffeur mais le revenu de cette activité ne lui permet pas de subvenir convenablement aux charges de sa famille, il s’est alors lancé dans l’exploitation d’un moulin en 2000, actuellement il est le seul dans son quartier ce qui lui permet de réaliser tous les jours d’importantes recettes. Le dynamo du moulin est gâté, ce qui paralyse énormément son activité, il veut acheter un autre dynamo et reprendre le plus tôt son activité, il sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit afin de s’acheter un dynamo, certaines pièces du moulin et assurer les frais d’implantation.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a driver, but the income from this work did not allow him to cover all the expenses of his family appropriately. For that reason he began working with a mill in 2000 and presently he is the only miller in his district which allows him to earn a considerable amount. The current generator for the mill is broken, which paralyzes his business. He wants to buy another dynamo and get back to work as soon as possible. He is asking WAGES for his first loan to buy this motor and certain other parts for the mill, as well as covering their installation.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a dynamo and various parts for a mill

loans.name: Djavid

texts.en: Djavid was born in 1977. He lives in Khachmaz town. 4 years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy foodstuffs to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Гулбахор Муминова торгует на вещевом рынке города Истаравшана. В ассортимент ее товара входят различная женская и детская обувь. Стаж ее деятельности 3 года. Хочет получить займ в размере 4500 сомони, и планирует потратить его для реализации и оборота своего товара.
   Гулбахор замужем, у нее 3 детей. Торговля обувью приносит достаточную прибыль, для того чтобы удовлетворить свои нужды и потребности ее семьи.
texts.en:
Gulbahor M. trades at the clothing market in the city of Istaravshan. Her range of products includes women's and children's shoes. She has three years of experience in this line of work, and wants to take out a loan in the amount of 4500 somoni, which she plans to spend on the purchase of goods and to increase turnover. Gulbahor is married, and she has three children. Selling shoes brings in enough profit to meet her needs and those of her family.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing inventory and increasing turnover

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Mrs Eva C. is 31 years old and married. She sells fish and deals in ready-to-wear goods in order to help her husband generate enough family income to feed their two children and support their education. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, PMPC, as additional capital for her business. She hopes that one day she will have a permanent stall in the market.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en: Nataliya is married with two children. She has been running a family business with her husband for nine years, selling used clothing and shoes. They rent a store in a good location and this helps to bring in many customers. Nataliya does not charge high prices for the clothes so her customers get good clothing for reasonable prices – something that is really relevant in the current climate. Nataliya is requesting a loan of 4000 UAH to purchase stock. She hopes to make more profit so that she can help her son, a college student.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing stock

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Mrs Jocelyn T. is 39 years old, married with three children, and currently living in Dicayas, Dipolog City. Her husband has no regular job, but works as a farmer or makes 'tuba', the native coconut wine, in order to alleviate their way of living. Many root crops and bananas grow in their backyard and these are an additional source of income. Jocelyn applied immediately for membership of Kiva partner, PMPC, in order to have additional capital for her existing business. Now she is requesting 5000 PHP in order to buy additional kilos of meat and ingredients for her barbecue-selling business. Her hope is that all her children can finish college.

loans.use: To purchase meat and other ingredients

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: CHEIKH GUEYE EST UN JEUNE TRANSPORTEUR QUI HABITE AU QUARTIER MEDINA FALL DE THIES AVEC SA FEMME .DEPUIS 2005 il dispose d'un véhicule de transport en commun qui est sa principale source de revenu;avec ce pret il veut réparer son véhicule qui est en panne.
texts.en:
Cheikh Gueye S. is a young professional driver who lives in the Medina Fall district of Thies with his wife. Since 2005, he has had a public transport vehicle which is his principal source of revenue. With this loan, he wants to repair that vehicle which is currently out of order.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repairing his public transport vehicle

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Souleymane S. est un homme marié de 30 ans et père de 2 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, très vite il commença les activités économiques notamment les travaux journaliers auprès des maçons, les travaux champêtres et le berger. Aucune de ces activités ne lui ont réussie. C’est ainsi qu’il décida de mener l’activité  d’achat et de vente d’articles  divers  de  boutique. Il fît ses premiers pas  auprès de son grand frère, commerçant  spécialisé dans le commerce général. Avec une expérience de 5 ans, Monsieur Souleymane S. maîtrise bien les tenants et aboutissants du commerce d’articles divers dans lequel il est très sollicité au niveau de la ville de Bougouni.
Monsieur Souleymane S., dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique avec une clientèle composée de toutes les catégories sociales.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Souleymane S. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 32 500 FCFA qui servira à rembourser les intérêts du prêt et agrandir sa boutique .
texts.en:
Mr. Souleymane S. is a 30 year old married man and the father of two children. He and his wife are monogamous and live with their children in the Torakabougou quarter in the city of Bougouni (in the 3rd administrative region in the Republic of Mali). Not having gone through the education system, he quickly began trying to make a living, namely daily work with masons, shepherding and other jobs in the countryside. None of these activities succeeded for him. Thus, he decided to take up the purchase and sale of various shop items. He took his first steps into the business with his older brother, a specialized merchant in general commerce. With five years’ experience, Mr. Souleymane S. has well mastered the holding of, and resulting business from these various products, which are very sought after in Bougouni. Mr. Souleymane S., concerned with satisfying the needs of his clientele, decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with whom it will be his first individual loan. He operates in Bamako (the capital of Mali) alongside wholesalers and makes sales in his store to a clientele composed of every social class. With his loan, Mr. Souleymane S. counts on coming to earn a monthly income of 32 500 FCFA which will serve to pay back the interest payments of the loan and to expand his store.

Translated from French by Laura Buhler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of various items for his shop.

loans.name: Jenny Juana

texts.es: La señora  YENNY JUANA FERNADEZ y su esposo Antonio Mamaní García, tienen dos pequeños hijos a quienes educan con su trabajo, mucha dedicación y cariño. Ellos viven en su domicilio en la zona Huayna Potosí. La señora  Jenny  tiene la actividad de venta de polleras y mantas que realiza en la calle 12 de octubre, en la ciudad de El Alto.Su esposo se dedica a la actividad de taxista asalariado,   no tiene vehiculo propio,la señora Jenny vende polleras y mantas que son prendas autoctonas del occidente de Bolivia. El mayor deseo de ellos es poder darles a sus hijos una buena educación para que en un futuro sean personas  de bien y responsables.
texts.en:
Yenny Juana F. and her husband Antonio Mamani Garcia, have two small children to whom they are devoted. They live the Huyana Potosi district. Jenny sells skirts and blankets from a site located on 12th of October street, in the city of El Alto. Her husband is a salaried taxi driver; he does not own his own vehicle. Jenny sells skirts and blankets which are items of native dress of the west of Bolivia. Their greatest hope is to be able to provide their children with a good education so that they may be good and responsible persons in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase women's clothing.

loans.name: Heledina

texts.en: Heledina D. V. is a 39-year-old housewife. She is married with one child and resides in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  Her husband works in Manila. Heledina sells fish balls (balls of pulverized fish that are then fried) in the market. Her loyal customers are the vendors in the market some friends and relatives. With the loan from Pagalum, she plans to expand and put up another fish ball stall in town. She dreams of sending her child to school and to live comfortably in the future.

loans.use: To expand and put up another fish ball stall

loans.name: Balla

texts.fr: BALLA D. EST UN MENUISIER METALLIQUE DE PROFESSION QUI EST MARIE ET PERE DE TROIS ENFANTS .IL HABITE AU QUARTIER KAOSSARA DE THIES .IL EST MEMBRE DE LA MUTUELLE DEPUIS DEUX ANS ET CONTRACTE DES PRETS POUR RENFORCER SON ACTIVITE .AVEC CETTE SOMME IL VA RENFORCER SON STOCK DE MATIERES PREMIERES POUR SATISFAIRE SA CLIENTELE.
texts.en:
Balla D. is a trained metal worker, making metal objects. He is married and the father of 3 children. He lives in the Kaossara neighborhood in Thies. He has been a member of the Association for two years and takes out loans to bolster his business. With this sum he is going to add to his stock of raw materials in order to satisfy his clientele's needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: replenish his stock of raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sale of cosmetics

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Greetings from R. Jean Claude!  He is 26 years old and he currently lives in the Gasabo district in Kigali.

Jean Claude is married to one woman and has two children.  One is seven while the other is three months old. His wife doesn’t produce any income.  This entrepreneur has owned a hardware shop since 2004, where he employs two workers.  His business is open from 7:00am to 8:00pm, and he earns a monthly profit of approximately $150 US.  Jean Claude is seeking a loan from Vision Finance Company in Rwanda totaling 600,000 Rwandan francs (or about $1075 US).  With the loan Jean Claude hopes to expand his business, and with the increased profit he hopes to reinvest in his store, provide more food for his family, and save more money. This is his second loan from Vision Finance Company.

loans.use: Expand his hardware shop

loans.name: Alice Atieno

texts.en:
Alice Atieno O. is a 34-year-old mother of four children, aged between 12 and 2.5 years; the older ones are in school. Alice is a cereal entrepreneur in addition to other businesses. In addition to her work as a tailor she sells cell-phone airtime minutes for Zain and Safaricom. From a kiosk near her home in Nyamasaria slum, she also sells cereals like maize and rice. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to increase her stock. She says her main challenge is taking care of the 6 orphans left to her by her sister and brother-in-law. She is married to an engineer and heard about K-MET through a friend.

Alice recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: increase her stock of cereals

loans.name: Falix Achieng

texts.en:
Falix Achieng O. is a 28-year-old motorcycle driver. He is married, but does not yet have children as he wants to have more money first. He lives in Nylanda slum and rents a motorcyle (called a piki-piki in Kenya) that he uses to transport passengers. He would like to one day own his own, but needs at least 65,000 KSH to do so. He tells me that for a ride from Dunga Beach to Nylanda (a distance of about 3 km) he charges around 70 KSH (just under 1 USD). His wife also runs a small business and his hope is to one day be a big businessman.

Falix recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW he will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of his community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. His work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: spare parts and maybe a motorcycle

loans.name: Florence Atieno

texts.en:
Florence Atieno O. is a 31-year-old mother of four children who also takes care of three orphans, left to her by her brother. She is married to a "casual worker" -- something similar to a day-laborer in the US. She runs a small hotel (restaurant) where she serves chapati, beans, rice, ugali (sort of like a thick cream of wheat, served with meat or fish), fish, meat and vegetables. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to expand her food stock.

Florence recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: buying ingredients to use in preparing cooked food

loans.name: Isiah

texts.en:
Isiah O. is a 27-year-old father of two children, ages 3 and 1 and a half. He is a free-lance photographer who is often hired for funerals, weddings, and other large functions. He lives in Nylanda slum and is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 KSH to purchase a digital camera and a printer, which he believes will increase his profit margin. He says that being a photographer is a good business when you have the materials to make photographs, and that he believes K-MET and Kiva are helping develop his community and the country as a whole.

Isiah recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW he will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of his community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. His work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: buying a digital camera

loans.name: Oumar Diaka

texts.fr: OUMAR DIAKA D. EST NE EN 1962 A FONGOLEMY .IL est commerçant de profession et est basé au quartier DIAKHAO de THIES avec sa famille;il est à son sixième pret avec l'institution.Avec la somme qu'il demande il veut renforcer son stock de marchandises.
texts.en:
Oumar Diaka D. was born in 1962 in Fongolemy. He has been a merchant for a long time and is based in the Diakhao district in Thies with his family. He is on his sixth loan with this institution. With the amount requested, he is planning to bolster his stock of merchandise.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expanding his stock of merchandise

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena, tiene un taller de costura donde elabora edredones, cojines y sabanas.
Tiene una hija y esta separada de su esposo, su actividad económica le ayuda para tener ingresos y poder solventar los gastos de alimentación, estudios y otros gastos.
Vive en la zona de Bello Horizonte de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa en anticrético.
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión ( compra de una maquina industrial) que mejorará su producción y la calidad de los edredones.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro.
texts.en:
Lorena has a workshop where she makes bedspreads, cushions and bed linens. She has a daughter and is separated from her husband. Her work allows her to earn funds for basic family needs such as food, education and other expenses. She lives in the Bello Horizonte neighborhood of La Paz. She plans to use the loan funds to purchase an industrial sewing machine so that her producion and the quality of her bedspreads will improve. This is the first time she has requested a loan from Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an industrial sewing machine to improve the quality of the bedspreads she manufactures.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en: Abibatu N. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two sons and a daughter. One of her children is in junior high school while the rest are in primary school. Abibatu lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband trades in livestock while she trades in foodstuffs. Abibatu buys food stuffs such as maize, yams, and other cereals all the way from the Northern part of the country. She sells her stock to food vendors and retailers in her community. Abibatu has run this business for fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz T. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Vino Tinto, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hijo.
La señora Beatriz es profesora de educación primaria en una unidad educativa de La Paz y su esposo es oficial militar y se encuentra destinado en la actualidad en el extranjero.
El crédito solicitado es para la demolición de una habitación que por su antigüedad se encuentra en peligro de derrumbe, así mismo se construirá una cocina en el mismo lugar ya que su vivienda no cuenta con este ambiente.
Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Beatriz T. lives with her son, in her own home, located in the Vino Tinto neighborhood, in the outskirts of La Paz. She is an elementary school teacher at a school in La Paz and her husband is a military officer currently posted outside the country. The loan she is requesting is to be used to pay for demolition of a room in her house which, due to its age, is in danger of collapse. At the same time, a kitchen will be built on the site of the demolished room since her home currently lacks a kitchen. This is the first time they have requested a loan and the socioeconomic study which was done indicates that they qualify for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Demolition of a room and construction of a needed kitchen for her home.

loans.name: Makhtar

texts.fr: MR MATAR M. est un jeune commerçant qui vit chez ses parents à KAOSSARA ,un quartier périphérique de THIES.IL est célibataire et est membre de la mutuelle depuis deux ans .IL veut avec ce pret acheter du fer pour le renforcement de son activité .
texts.en:
Mr. MATAR M. is a young merchant who lives in the home of his parents in KAOSSARA, an outlying district of THIES. He is unmarried and has been a member of the mutuelle for two years. He wants to use this loan to buy some iron for strengthening his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy iron

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria Y. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus dos hijos, ya que es madre soltera.
La señora Gregoria es cocinera, vendiendo almuerzos en la parada de transporte publico de su zona. Ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
Con el crédito anterior realizo la construcción de dos habitaciones en obra gruesa.
El crédito solicitado es para la conclusión de la construcción de las habitaciones que proporcionarán a su familia de ambientes adecuados para su diario vivir.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Gregoria Y. is a single mother who lives in her own house with her two children, in the Pasankeri neighborhood on the west side of the city of La Paz. She is a cook and she sells lunches at the transit stop in her neighborhood. With her earnings, she is able to support her family. She used her previous loan for the rough construction of two bedrooms. This loan request is to finish the construction of these rooms and to furnish them with the basic necessities for her family's everyday life. This is the second time that they have sought a loan. The socio-economic analysis provided reflects favorably on them and they will be approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of two bedrooms in her house in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Alto Llojeta, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Gregorio Vargas.
La señora Elena es costurera, realiza fundas y almohadas que vende en un puesto de venta ambulante y su esposo es chofer asalariado en una empresa de transporte público.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una habitación que funcionará como su taller de costura, ya que al no tener espacio realiza su trabajo en su dormitorio que le resulta pequeño.
Esta es la séptima vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Elena lives in her own house in the Alto Llojeta zone, in the outskirts of the city of La Paz, with her husband, Gregorio Vargas. Elena is a seamstress. She makes pillowcases and pillows that she sells as a street vendor and her husband is a salaried driver for a public transportation business. The requested loan is for the construction of a room that will function as her sewing workshop; since she doesn’t have a space she works in her bedroom, which is small. This is the seventh time they have requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis of them that has been done favorably qualifies them so they can take out a loan.
