Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the construction of a room that will be her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo V.  vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, y sus dos  hijas.
El señor Ricardo es carpintero metálico, realizando trabajos de puertas y ventanas para construcciones particulares en esta ciudad. 
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una losa de hormigón armado en la segunda planta de su vivienda, para la construcción de dos habitaciones que le dará a la familia el espacio adecuado para desarrollar sus actividades.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.
texts.en:
Ricardo V. lives in his own house, in the Llojeta zone, on the western slope of the city of La Paz, with his wife and his two daughters. Ricardo is a metal worker. He makes doors and windows for houses in La Paz. The loan he is requesting is for pouring a cement floor on the second floor of his house and for the construction of two rooms that will provide enough space for his family. This is the fourth time that they have requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis of them that has been done favorably qualifies them and they can take out a loan. He has been a client of ours since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pour a reinforced cement floor in the second floor of his house and the construction of two rooms.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol A.  vive en casa de alquiler, en la zona  de 8 de diciembre, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus cuatro hijos y su madre.
La señora Marisol es empleada en una compañía de seguros, ingresos con los que sustenta a su familia.
Su esposo se fue hace dos años por lo que ella mantiene sola a su familia y encontrar una vivienda en anticretico le dará la posibilidad de ahorrar en función a una futura vivienda propia.
El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de un anticretico de dos habitaciones con baño incluido. Anticrético es una forma legal única por la que el dueño del inmueble permite vivir a otra persona por un tiempo determinado a cambio de un monto global de dinero, el cual será devuelto al finalizar el contrato.
Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Marisol A. lives in a rented house in zona de 8 de diciembre, on the west side of the city of La Paz, with her four sons and her mother. Señora Marisol works in an insurance company, and with her work income she supports her family. Her husband left 2 years ago, leaving her to take care of the family by herself. To find an "anticretico" rental apartment for her family to live in will give her the possibility to save money, so that in the future she and her family can own their own home. The requested loan is for the acquisition of an anticretico of 2 rooms, with a bathroom included. Anticretico is a unique, legal method of housing in which the owner of the building allows a person to live for a determined amount of time in exchange for a set amount of money, which will be returned at the end of the living period. This is the first time that Marisol has requested a loan. Her socioeconomic analysis has favorably classified her, and she has been deemed able to responsibly receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costo de un anticrético de dos habitaciones y baño privado.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Greetings from U. Esperance.  She is 33 years old and lives in Gasabo district in Kigali city. 

Esperance is a widow and has a 3 year old child. This entrepreneur owns a shop that sells containers in Kimironko sector and she is seeking her first loan from Vision Finance Company in Rwanda worth 500,000Rwf.  She runs the business herself with no employees. This entrepreneur has been working in the same business since 2005. She opens her business every day from 8:00am to 7:00pm. Esperance has a monthly profit of USD160. She is hoping to use the loan to expand her business and with the increased profit she hopes to buy a house and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Pablo López, tiene la edad de 51 años, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa le tiene cuatros hijos, el se desempeña en su pequeño negocio de frutas y legumbres, el sector que el comercializa su producto en por las calles de managua ya que es vendedor ambulante y proveedor de unas de las empresa de abastecimiento en el país de productos variados. El inicio como empleado y después emprendió su propio negocio de ventas de verduras y frutas, desde hace siete años tiene su negocio. Este es su octavo ciclo en Afodenic el cual da las gracias por los beneficios que ha logrado en lo personal como para su familia. Con este crédito  en Afodenic va a comprar mayores cantidades de frutas y verduras variadas para ofrecer a sus clientes y poder vender más para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo López, is 51 years old. He lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of the city of Managua. He and his wife have four children. He does very well in his small fruit and vegetable business. The sector where he sells his products is in the streets of Managua as he is a street vendor and provider of several of the supply businesses in the country of varied products. He began as an employee and later launched his own business selling vegetables and fruits. He has had his business for seven years. This is his eighth cycle in Afodenic. He is grateful for the benefits that he has achieved personally as well as for his family. With this loan from Afodenic he will buy larger quantities of fruits and varied vegetables to offer to his customers and be able to sell more to obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Greetings from Claudine Icyimanizanye, a 27-year-old single woman in Gasabo District in Kigali city. She has one child aged 1 year old.

Claudine owns a shop in the Kimironko sector where she sells different kinds of things; she has one full-time employee to help her in running her business. Claudine has 2 years experience in this business. She starts working anywhere from 6:00am to 7:00am and makes a monthly profit of approximately US $100. Claudine intends to extend her business through this loan and hopes to reinvest the increased profits in her business.

loans.use: Expanding the business

loans.name: Kande

texts.en:
Kande A. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. She says some of her children are in junior high school while others are in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Kande works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer and a tractor driver as well. Kande trades in foodstuffs. She buys food such as maize, yam, and other cereals all the way from the Northern part of the country. She sells to food vendors and retailers in her community. She has been in this business for fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food for resale

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La Señora. Rosa Cáceres tiene 37 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, se dedica a la venta  leche, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte,  tiene un años y medio en la venta de leche, ha logrado tener sus clientes fijos ya que se ubica en un solo lugar, a si como también los que diario compran su leche para su alimentación. Se ubica en un punto céntrico de la capital de managua. Los planes para su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida y realizar mejoras en su vivienda. Inicio su negocio con fondos de micro financieras. El préstamo que solicita en Afodenic es con el fin de comprar mayores cantidades de leche y otros productos que le genere mayores utilidades para obtener mejores beneficios. Tiene tres ciclos de trabajar con Afodenic y da las gracias por el apoyo que ha obtenido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Cáceres is 37 years old, has three children, sells milk, and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She has been selling milk for a year and a half. She has managed to have regular clients since she is located in one single place, along with those who purchase his milk daily as part of their diet. She is located in a central point of the capital Managua. Her plans for her family are to improve her standard of living and to make improvements to her home. She began her business with micro-finance funds. The loan she is requesting from Afodenic is for the purpose of purchasing larger quantities of milk and other products which will generate greater profits to obtain higher returns. She has been working with Afondenic for three cycles and is grateful for the support that she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk and derivative products

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea es una mujer de 53 años, muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa y lo que más quiere es mejorar su negocio para sobresalir en su vida. El puesto de Andrea está ubicado en el mercado Unión y Dignidad (mercado importante de la ciudad de Puno), vende carne y es una de las vendedoras más solicitadas por las personas que concurren a este mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en el mercado, tiene 15 años realizando este negocio y lo más difícil para ella es traer la carne desde Ilave (Distrito de Puno), puesto que le es muy cansado, pero aun así trabaja contenta y sin descanso con la única finalidad de mejorar su vida, espera más adelante tener una carnicería más grande donde puede atender mejor a sus clientes. Es su primer préstamo con MFP y ha decidido ser muy cuidadosa en la inversión de ese dinero, además que tiene siempre presente los consejos de las socias de su banco comunal. Con los 300 soles solicitados comprará más carne para incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Andrea is a 53 year old woman, who is very down-to-earth and hard working. She lives in her own house and what she would like the most is to improve her business in order to excel in her life. Andrea's place is located in the Unión y Dignidad market (an important market in the city of Puno). She sells meat and is one of the most sought after vendors by the people who come to this market. The thing she likes the most about her work is talking with the neighboring sales people and to find out about the things that are happening in the market. She has been conducting this business for 15 years, and the most difficult thing for her is to bring the meat from Ilave (District of Puno) since it is very tiring for her. But even so she works contentedly and without a break with the only aim of improving her life. Later she hopes to have a larger butcher's shop where she can better serve her customers. This is her first loan with MFP and she has decided to be very careful with the investment of this money, as well as having the advice of the other members of her communal bank available. With the 300 soles (Peruvian currency) she will purchase more meat to increase her sales and to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise increase

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony B. is twenty-six years old. He is married and has one child, a son. He says his son is yet to start school. He lives with his child and wife in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Anthony is a hard working young man. His wife is currently under apprenticeship. She is learning sewing. Anthony is a tailor by profession. He sews smocks and other African wears. He buys the materials from Kumasi. Tony says he supplies the smocks to stores. Tony says he has been in business for barely a year now. He wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
Greetings from Elvis R., a 27-year-old single man in Gasabo District, Kigali city.

Elvis has two dependents to care for, 11 and 9 years old. He owns a shop where he and his one employee sell many kinds of things. He is seeking his first loan of 500,000 Rwandan Francs.

Elvis has worked in the same kind of business for 3 years. He works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. and earns approximately US $145 per month. He wants to use the loan to increase his stock of merchandise. Elvis intends to reinvest the increased profit in his business.

loans.use: Increase store inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia MARIA, es natural de la zona de piñipampa en el departamento del Cusco, está situado a 40 minutos de la misma ciudad.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 34 años de edad y es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y alterna sus labores del hogar con la manufactura; Esta zona es conocida en castellano como lugar de los piñis, estos son pequeñas semillas de diferentes árboles que los secas y fabrican diversos adornos, son pequeños y casi siempre los utilizan para hacer figuras bordadas sobre las vestimentas, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la elaboración de tejas artesanales, para lo que nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para poder comprar materiales para continuar con su fabricación casera.

La socia agradece gentilmente el apoyo que le prestan mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
The member MARIA is a native of the Piñipampa area in the Cusco department. She is located 40 minutes from the same city. Our member is 34 years old and is a single mother. She has 2 children and alternates her work in the home with manufacturing. This area is known in Spanish as the area of the piñis, these are small seeds from different trees that are dried and are made into various adornments. They are small and almost always used to make embroidered figures on clothing. The member alternates her home activities with the production of handmade tiles, for this reason our member needs the loan to be able to purchase materials to continue with her home-made items. The member graciously gives thanks for the support that she is given by this means and she promises to complete the payment of her loan in the scheduled period.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to produce hand-made tiles.

loans.name: Gnima

texts.fr: Gnima D. est une veuve domiciliée à Kadior, elle vend au marché central Saint Maures des Fossés de Ziguinchor. Avec l'appui de l'IMCEC, elle a acheté un terrain et a entamé la construction pour éviter la location à vie à ses enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des zincs et déménager chez elle avant le début de la saison des pluies.
texts.en:
Gnima D. is a widow who lives in Kadior. She sells merchandise at the central market Saint Maures des Fossés of Ziguinchor. With IMCEC support, she bought a plot of land and began construction, so that she can forever save her children from paying rent. She’s requesting this loan to buy tin roofing material and to move out of her place before the seasonal rains begin.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of housing

loans.name: Jesus Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Maria B. is the owner of a business where she makes and sells a variety of textile products and also a group coordinator for the bank called "Jesus Nuestra Esperanza."  With this loan, her second through Esperanza, Maria plans on buying more supplies and items to use in her business.  Maria and her partner Pedro G. are the parents of four children, ranging in age from 5 to 12.  One of Esperanza’s goals in all of our work is to free children out of poverty, and we believe that providing loans to women with children is a way to achieve that.

Maria said that her first loan really helped her business and family which is why she decided to take out another.  She dreams for her business to grow bigger each day and also hopes for God to continue to protect her children.  When they are older, Maria would like them to be smart people.  

In the little free time she has apart from her business and kids, Maria enjoys reading the Bible.  Pictured are these five members of "Jesus Nuestra Esperanza" along with their loan officer and two other members of Jesus Nuestra Esperanza.

On behalf of Maria B., Jesus Nuestra Esperanza, and all of us here at Esperanza International, thank you for your interest and support in fighting the global issue of poverty!


Note -  As there are eight people in this picture, we wanted to specify who the additional individuals are: The gentleman on the far right is the group's loan officer. In the back row, the first and third people from the left are members of another Esperanza International sub-group, but are not borrowers of this loan.  Thank you!

loans.use: replenishing supplies for textile business

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena de 31 años, siempre luchó por salir adelante y mejorar su vida, vive en su propia casa. Los 3 años que tiene en el negocio de la ferretería, le han servido para mejorar su vida, ella compra los materiales de la ciudad de Oruro (Ciudad del país de Bolivia) y los traslada vía terrestre hasta Puno, para luego distribuirlos a las distintas ferreterías de la ciudad. Elena disfruta de viajar hasta Bolivia para traer los materiales, ya que se distrae mucho en el camino, y espera más adelante, tener su propia ferretería donde pueda vender ella misma los materiales que trae, ya que lo más difícil, actualmente, es distribuir a las ferreterías, puesto que los materiales pesan mucho y le son muy difíciles de transportar. Ya estando en su segundo préstamo, Elena que siempre paga todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ha decidido mejorar su negocio y siente que tiene el respaldo de las socias de su banco comunal. Con los 1700 soles solicitados incrementará su capital de trabajo para comprar más materiales.
texts.en:
Elena, 31 years old, has always fought to get ahead and to improve her life. She lives in her own house. The 3 years that she has been in the hardware business have served to improve her life. She purchases the materials from the city of Oruro (city in the country of Bolivia) and moves them by land to Puno, to then distribute them to the city's different hardware stores. Elena enjoys traveling to Bolivia to bring the materials, since she amuses herself on the way, and hopes later to have her own hardware store where she can sell the materials that she brings herself, since the most difficult thing nowadays is to distribute the hardware, as the materials weigh a lot and are very difficult to transport. Now on her second loan, Elena, who always pays all of her payments on time, has decided to improve her business and feels that she has the support of the members of her communal bank. With the requested 1700 soles (Peruvian currency) she will increase her work capital to purchase more materials.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise increase

loans.name: Atoumane

texts.fr:
Atoumane GUEYE est un charretier. Il offre de services pour le transport de marchandises et autres produits moyennant 500 F à 2000 F CFA la prestation.
Ce pére de famille est un grand débrouillard, il demande ce crédit pour renforcer son activité.
Son quartier général est à côté de la caisse de Ziguinchor.
texts.en:
Atoumane GUEYE is a cart driver. He offers services for transporting merchandise and other goods and average 500 to 2,000 francs CFA for each trip. This is a father of a family who is very resourceful. He’s asking for this loan to bolster his business. He is head-quartered next to the Ziguinchor bank.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cart service

loans.name: Mujeres Rompiendo Barreras Group

texts.en:
Juana S. C. is the group coordinator for the Bank of Hope group called "Mujeres Rompiendo Barreras," which means "Women Breaking Barriers".  Juana owns a nail salon in her local community, and after hearing about a friend's experience with Esperanza, decided to take out a loan to invest in her business.  With this first loan, Juana plans to buy materials and beauty products to use and sell in her salon - or as it is called here in the Dominican Republic, "Salon D. Uñas."  

Juana is the mother of two young children and hopes that they can grow up to be professionals.  Juana also dreams about growing her business with more customers.  Part of Esperanza's mission is to liberate children from poverty and we believe (and have seen) that giving mothers a loan can really improve the standards of living for the whole family, because most if not all of the profit goes directly into the household.

Juana's portion of this group loan will be about $140 and she plans to pay back about $15 every couple of weeks.  Juana would like to thank Kiva lenders for their support!

On behalf of Juana S. C., Mujeres Rompiendo Barreras, and all of us here at Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy materials and beauty products for her nail salon.

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: Don Carlos José A., tiene 53 años de edad, reside en Sabana Grande, en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene tres hermosos hijos los cuales cursan la secundaria, su esposa trabaja en un almacén para compartir los gastos y dar estudios a sus hijos, el se desempeña como cadete en la ciudad de Managua desde hace ocho años, este es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic que espera seguir trabajando para obtener los beneficios que hasta ahora ha tenido para su familia. Con este crédito lo quiere para construir parte del baño y poder gozar de mejores condiciones. Sus metas a largo plazo es poder tener su propio vehiculo que le sea rentable.
texts.en:
Don Carlos José A. is 53 years old, and lives in Sabana Grande, in the capital Managua. He and his wife have three beautiful children who are in secondary school. His wife works in a grocery store to share the expenses and to pay for their childrens' studies. He has been doing well as a cadet in the city of Managua for eight years. This is his fourth cycle in Afodenic and he hopes to continue working to obtain the benefits that he has had up until now for his family. He would like this loan to construct part of a bathroom and to be able to enjoy better conditions. His long term goal is to be able to have his own vehicle which will be profitable for him.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make a bathroom

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
El microempresario Oscar Antonio M. tiene 55 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos los cuales dos estudian y desde hace 10 años se dedica viajar a la capital a comprar productos varios por encargo. Este negocio consiste en que muchas personas en ocasiones quieren comprar algunos productos que en la capital son mas baratos y se lo encargan al señor M. quien solamente les cobra una pequeña comisión por la compra, sin embargo el señor M. es quien utiliza sus recursos para hacer dicha compra. Por este motivo es que este microempresario necesita obtener financiamiento ya que en la medida que compre más productos su comisión aumenta. 

Entre los clientes que tiene se encuentran los barberos, los ebanistas, las costureras,  los taxistas, los joyeros y personas que necesitan algún producto que no se encuentre en esta ciudad o que sea difícil de encontrar. Este tipo de actividad casi no existen personas que la realicen ya que el viaje a la capital es bastante cansado y aburrido. El señor M. ya fue beneficiado con un  crédito por parte de Kiva y ha manifestado que este préstamo le permitió aumentar sus ingresos. Cabe señalar que este cliente pago en tiempo y forma su crédito.

Necesita se le financie para comprar los siguientes productos: 300 yardas de Tela dacron la cual compra a US 1 dólar cada yarda, 2 pesas para pulpería a US 17 dólares cada pesa, 30 cables de DVD a US 1 dólar cada cable, 10 radios sharp a US 15 dólares cada radio, 4 baterías para carro a US 30 dólares cada batería, 12 calculadora grande a US 5.50 dólares cada  calculadora y 300 yardas de  mecates a US 1 dólar cada yarda.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepreneur Oscar Antonio M. is 55 years old, he is married, has 3 children, two of which are in school, and for 10 years he has been traveling to the capital to purchase various ordered products. This business consists of many people occasionally wanting to buy products that are cheaper in the capital and they ask this of Mr. M., who only charges a small commission for the purchase. Nonetheless, Mr. M. is the one who uses his resources to make said purchases. It is for this reason that the micro-entrepreneur needs to obtain financing, since in so far as he purchases more products his commission increases. Among his customers are barbers, cabinet makers, seamstresses, taxi drivers, jewelers, and people who need any product that is not found in the city, or that is difficult to find. There are very few people who do this job since the trip to the capital is rather tiring and boring. Mr. M. has already been the beneficiary of a loan on the part of Kiva and has shown that this loan allowed him to increase his income. It is important to note that this client pays on time and develops his loan. He needs to be financed to purchase the following products: 300 yards of Dacron fabric which he will purchase for 1 US dollar a yard, 2 weights for small local grocery stores at 17 US dollars a weight , 30 DVD cables at 1 US dollar a cable, 10 Sharp radios at 15 US dollars a radio, 4 car batteries at 30 US dollars a battery, 12 large calculators at 5.50 US dollars a calculator, and 300 yards of mecate at 1 US dollar a yard.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dacron fabric, grocery store weights, DVD cables, sharp radios, car batteries, large calculators and mecates.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La  socia es el Sra. Carmen Rosa, ella es natural de la provincia del Cusco del distrito de piñipampa, ubicado a 40 minutos de la misma ciudad.
La socia tiene 37 años de edad, ella es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo y alterna sus actividades del hogar, con la elaboración de tejas artesanales, ella conoce este negocio desde su niñez, debido a que su padre le enseño este arte, de fabricar tejas con las manos, ella utiliza materia prima para elaborar las tejas de arcilla, le gusta y disfruta mucho su trabajo como artesana de tejas, ella solicita el préstamo en razón de que requiere comprar mas material para elaborar un numero mayor del que normalmente produce, así incrementara sus ganancias.

La socia está muy agradecida y valora el préstamo otorgado para la realización de sus sueños y tener mayor productividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a native of the district of Pinipampa, located in the province of Cusco, 40 minutes away from the city of the same name. She is 37 years old, and is a single mother with one son. She balances her motherly duties with the creation of handmade clay tiles, a business that she's been involved in since her father taught her the trade as a child. She uses excellent materials for the tiles, and she thoroughly enjoys her work. She is asking for a loan because she would like to buy more materials, which she will use to make a greater number of tiles and in that way increase her income. Carmen is very grateful and appreciates the loan that she is seeking in order to increase her productivity and make her dreams come true. She promises to completely pay back what she owes.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for handmade tiles

loans.name: Tengasori

texts.en: Tengasori C. is a married 38-year-old mother of six children - two sons and four daughters. Her children are in primary school and junior high school. Tengasori lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.  She works to supplement her husband's income and provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer and she is a food vendor.  She cooks and sells beans.  Her beans are served hot with palm oil and gari, which is a kind of flour made from cassava dough that has been squeezed and fried in a hot metal pan. Tengasori buys her ingredients from the local market and sells her food in the community in the afternoons. She has been in business for four years and plans to use the loan to buy raw materials in bulk to expand her business. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy raw materials in bulk to expand her food selling business.

loans.name: Melchor Gaspar

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr.: MELCHOR; el es natural de la provincia del Cusco del distrito de Piñipampa, ubicado a 40 minutos de la misma ciudad.

El socio tiene 51 años de edad, el es casado y tiene 5 hijos, nuestro socio tiene entre sus actividades la agricultura en las épocas de siembra y cosecha el también alquila un camión para trasladar las tejas que durante el resto del año se dedica a su otra pasión, que es la elaboración de tejas artesanales. Para lo cual solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en la materia prima, cómo es la arcilla, arena, otros.

Nuestro socio agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Mr. Melchor is a native of the district of Pinipampa, located in the province of Cusco, 40 minutes away from the city of the same name. He is 51 years old, and is married with 5 children. During planting and harvesting seasons he works as a farmer, but during the rest of the year he devotes himself to his other passion: fabricating handmade tiles, which he then transports to market in a rented truck. He is asking for a loan so he can reinvest that money in raw materials like clay, sand, etc. Mr. Melchor greatly appreciates this opportunity, and promises to pay back the loan in full within the agreed upon time-frame.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for handmade tiles

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama S. is thirty years old. She is married and has three children, two sons and one daughter. The oldest two children have already started in the primary school. Mariama lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer and she is a trader of smoked fish. Mariama buys smoked fish from markets in nearby communities and sells them at a stand in the local market. Mariama also owns a provision store. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy larger quantities of smoked fish. She hopes to provide her children with the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of smoked fish to grow her business.

loans.name: Fuseina

texts.en: Fuseina A. is forty–nine years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, one son and four daughters. She says two of her daughters are already married. The rest of the children are in primary school. She lives with some of her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Fuseina works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer, while she is a trader. She trades in vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, okro, etc. She buys from markets in nearby communities. Fuseina sells at the local market on a table top. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure the vegetables in bulk. She is hopeful of giving her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en: Saratu O. is forty–five years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, two sons and four daughters. She says some of her children are in junior high school while others are in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Saratu works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a building contractor. She is a trader. She trades in yams. She buys from farmers in the nearby villages. Saratu supplies the yams to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also trades in ready–made textiles. She has been in business for over twenty–two years and wants a loan to procure yams in bulk. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama M. is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two sons and one daughter. She says two of her children are in primary school while the last is yet to start. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Mariama works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Mariama’s husband is a farmer, while she is a trader. She trades in all kinds of cereals, such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities. She sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es una mujer que ha luchado mucho para sobresalir en la vida, a sus 37 años vive en la casa de sus familiares y lo que más desea es tener un futuro mejor. Cuando dejó su natal Ilave (Distrito de Puno), y decidió que haría de todo para sobresalir en la vida, actualmente trae desde Oruro (ciudad de Bolivia) materiales ferreteros porque le salen más baratos y los distribuye en las ferreterías de la ciudad de Puno a un muy buen precio, lo que hace que tenga mucha demanda. Isabel disfruta de salir a distribuir los materiales de construcción, ya que le da la libertad de recorrer la ciudad libremente, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil es traer la mercadería desde tan lejos, puesto que le resulta cansado. Para el futuro anhela tener su propia tienda donde pueda vender ella misma los materiales que trae. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se siente muy feliz de haberlo obtenido, tiene muchas ganas de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy querida y respetada. Con los 1700 nuevos soles solicitados planea incrementar su capital de trabajo, para comprar más materiales.
texts.en:
Isabel is a woman who has always struggled hard to excel. At 37 years old, she lives in a house with her family and what she most wants is to have a better future. When she left her hometown, she decided that she would do all she could to improve her life, and today she buys hardware supplies at low prices in Oruro and sells them in hardware stores in the city of Puno at a very good price, which drives up demand. Isabel enjoys distributing construction materials, since it gives her the freedom to travel around the city freely. She has been doing this for 4 years, and the most difficult part is transporting her goods long distances since it is so tiring. In the future, she hopes to have her own store where she herself can sell the merchandise that she purchases. This is the second loan she has solicited from MFO, and she is very happy to have received the first one. She looks forward to making her payments on time, and in her community bank she is loved and respected. With the 1700 Sols she plans to increase her investment capital in order to buy more materials.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Munafa Group

texts.en:
This is Karimu T., Mabinty K., and Alpha Umaro B.. They named their group Munafa.  They are local entrepreneurs in Makump village, five miles from Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs have accessed several loans from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have allowed much development in the lives of these people. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 1,200,000 each in order to further strengthen their businesses.  

Karimu (middle) is the leader of the group. He is sixty-two years of age.  He was born in Makump village and he is married to four wives. He is a very prolific husband with eighteen children in total. Most of his children are already grown-ups and eight are still in school. Karimu sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), cigarettes, dried fish, salt, rice, tooth brushes, pastes, cosmetics, soft drinks and so on. He has been a businessman and a farmer for many years.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel A. is thirty years old. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. He says his son is yet to start school while the girl is currently in primary school. He lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Daniel is a hard-working young man. His wife is currently not working. He is a carpenter by profession. He makes furniture such as beds, stuffed chairs, wardrobes, etc. He has a shop in his community where he works. Daniel buys wood from the local sawmills and sometimes from the timber market. Daniel has been in business for five years now. He wants a loan to buy wood and other materials such as upholstery in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy materials for woodworking

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 43 años siempre se preocupó por darle a su familia un mejor futuro, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su única hija, Yudith de 16 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Tiene un restaurante en la ciudad de Puno, en el cual ofrece menús muy surtidos y la comida es muy deliciosa, sus clientes salen muy contentos y alabando la sazón de la cocinera. Juana espera tener un restaurante con ambientes adecuados, donde sus clientes se sientan más cómodos, y lo que más le gusta de su negocio es cocinar y ver como sus comensales disfrutan de la comida que prepara. En los 3 años que lleva en este negocio ha aprendido a trabajar presionada por sus clientes y es justamente eso lo más difícil de su negocio, puesto que siempre trata de satisfacer a todos sus comensales. Su deseo más grande es brindarle un buen futuro a su hija, a la cual quiere mucho. Este es su préstamo con MFP y sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos que tienen entre socias. Con los 800 soles solicitados planea implementar mejor su restaurante y comprar más víveres para preparar sus deliciosas comidas.
texts.en:
Juana, 43, has always tried to offer her family a better future. She lives in a rented room next to her only child, Yudith, who is 16 years old and the motivation behind all of her efforts. She has a restaurant in the city of Puno that offers an eclectic menu of delicious food which leaves her customers happy and praising the prowess of the cook. Juana hopes to have a restaurant with a better environment where her patrons can feel more comfortable. What she most likes about her business is cooking and seeing how her customers enjoy the food that she prepares. In the three years that she has spent in this business, she has learned to work under pressure, and that is exactly the most difficult part of the job, since she always tries to satisfy all of her customers. Her greatest desire is to offer a good future to her daughter, who she loves very much. This is her first loan with MFP, and she knows that she has to make her payments on time. She is very happy in her local bank and she keeps herself informed about all the agreements between members. With the 800 Sols she is asking for, she plans to improve her restaurant and buy more supplies to prepare delicious meals.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve restaurant, buy supplies

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi B. is 28 years old. He is married and has two children, both of whom are daughters. He says both of his daughters are in the primary school. He lives with his children and his wife in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Kofi works very hard to provide for the family. Kofi is a name given to a male born on Friday in the Akan tribe and other tribes in Ghana. His wife is a professional seamstress and a trader as well. Kofi is also a trader. He trades in yam. He buys tubers of yam from farmers in the nearby villages and supplies them to retailers and food vendors in his community. 
He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure tubers of yam in bulk. He aspires to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam

loans.name: Junks Centers Group

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu K. and Aminata S.. They named their group Junks Centers.  Here in Sierra Leone, second hand clothes are referred to as junks. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs have accessed from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have created significant impacts on the lives of these entrepreneurs. They use the proceeds of their businesses to look after their children by feeding them, sending them to school, and meeting their daily financial challenges. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of SLL 1,000,000 each to further strengthen their businesses.

Kadiatu (right) is the leader of this group. Kadiatu was born in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. She is age 37, and married to a businessman.  They have four children. Three of their children are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Kadiatu sells second-hand clothes for children (junks). She has been in this business for three years now. With this loan, Kadiatu will buy two bales of second hand clothes. A bale of used clothes for children is sold for Le 410,000 and she will pay a fare of Le 10,000 to Freetown where bales of junks are sold.

loans.use: Buy two bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Amoako

texts.en: Amoako I. is 33 years old. He is married and has two children, both of whom are daughters. He says both of his daughters are in the primary school. He lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Amoako works very hard to provide for the family. His wife is a trader. She runs a provision store. Amoako is also a trader. He deals in charcoal. He buys bags of charcoal from the burners in the nearby villages and supplies to retailers and food vendors in his community. He says he also treks to other towns to supply them as well. Amoako has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure bags of charcoal in bulk. He is hopeful to give his children the best of education he can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali S. is thirty–six years old. He is married and has three children, two sons and one daughter. He says all of his children are currently in primary school. He lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Ali works very hard to provide for the family. His wife is unemployed at the moment. Ali is a trader. He deals in charcoal and cereals. He buys the cereals from nearby villages and the bags of charcoal from the burners in the nearby communities. He supplies to retailers and food vendors in his community. Ali says he also treks to other towns to supply his goods. He has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure the goods in bulk. He hopes to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and cereals in bulk

loans.name: Virginia Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Virginia del Carmen E.,  tiene la edad de 26 años,  reside en el barrio Francisco Salazar en la ciudad de Managua, tiene 4 hijos de 4,5,8 y 11 años, lo dos grandes cursan la primaria, su compañero tiene un taxi que lo trabaja. Es una mujer emprendedora iniciando su propio negocio con fondos propios  de venta  comida rápida y productos de cosméticos. Con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de carnes, chorizos y cosméticos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Sus planes  es poder vender comida en el almuerzo para obtener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Virginia del Carmen E. is 26 years old, and lives in the Francisco Salazar neighborhood of Managua. She has 4 children: a 4 year old, a 5 year-old, an 8 year-old, and an 11 year-old. The two older ones are in elementary school, and her friend drives them to their classes in his taxi. She is a very enterprising woman, using her own money to start a business selling fast food and cosmetic products. With this loan she wants to invest in the purchase of meats, sausages, and cosmetics for her customers. Her plan is to be able to sell food at lunch to increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meats, sausages, and cosmetic products

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El microempresario Carlos Martínez A. tiene 61 años de edad, es soltero tiene dos hijos, los cuales estudian en secundaria y la universidad y se dedica desde hace 10 años a vender de manera media ambulante artículos varios tales como candados, fajas, cuchillos, radios, calculadoras entre otros productos. Vende de manera media ambulante ya que no tiene un lugar fijo para sus ventas sino que haciendo uso del corredor de algunos dueños de establecimientos como el caso de los billares aprovecha para poner dos mesas y exhibir sus productos en las calles comerciales de esta ciudad de Bluefields.

Con este negocio el señor Martínez ha podido tener ingresos para poder alimentarse y darle educación y alimentación a sus dos hijos, este crédito es el segundo que solicita con kiva, el primero lo pago en tiempo y forma. En este préstamo el señor Martínez esta solicitando para comprar los siguientes artículos:

12 Unidades de radios portátiles a US 15 dólares cada uno, 24 unidades de calculadoras pequeñas a US 2 dólares cada una, 12 cajas de cuchillos a US 10 dólares cada caja,  12 cajas de candado a US 20 dólares cada caja, 12 unidades de calculadoras científicas a US 3.50 dólares cada unidad, 12 unidades de calculadoras grandes a US 5 cada unidad y 20 enchufes a US 0.50 dólar cada enchufe.
texts.en:
Carlos M. A. is 61 years old, and is single with 2 children--one in high school and the other in college. For the past 10 years he has sold padlocks, tool belts, knives, radios, calculators, etc. He works as a traveling salesperson, since there isn't a fixed location for him to set up shop. Instead he makes use of the hallways of certain businesses with which he has agreements (for example, he has set up two tables at the pool hall to show his products). In addition, he has been known to sell his wares on the streets in the commercial district of the city of Bluefields. With this business Mr. M. has been able to create enough income to feed himself and provide food and education to his two children. This is the second loan that he has sought from Kiva (the first he paid on time). With this loan Mr. M. is going to buy the following items: 12 portable radios ($15 each), 24 small calculators ($2 each), 12 boxes of knives ($10 per box), 12 boxes of locks ($20 per box), 12 scientific calculators ($3.50 each), 12 large calculators ($5 each), and 20 extension cords ($.50 each).

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase radios, calculators, knives, locks, extension cords

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.en:
Yomeris S. is a group coordinator for the bank of Hope named “Mujeres Luchadoras,” which means, “Fighting Women” in English.  Yomeri is the owner of a business selling perfume in her local community near Imbert, Dominican Republic.  Yomeri has one young son named Oliver who is one year old.  This loan will be Yomeris’ second with Esperanza, the first of which helped her considerably.  

With the extra money that Yomeris earned in her business, she was able to bring home bigger profits and help provide for her son Oliver.  Helping children out of poverty is one of the goals Esperanza has as an organization. By giving women like Yomeris a micro-loan, we are able to ensure that her children will benefit because women generally spend most of their money on the family and their home.

Yomeris dreams of continual growth for her perfume business and would also like to open up an internet café in the near future.  She would like to see her son Oliver graduate from school and to grow up strong.  In her free time, Yomeris enjoys reading and also chatting with friends.  

On behalf of Yomeris S., Mujeres Luchadoras, and all of us here at Esperanza International, thank you for your support and efforts to fight the global issue of poverty!

loans.use: To purchase perfume

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Cette dame est une résidente du quartier de KLIKAME qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, elle est une veuve et a à sa charge ses 02 enfants, pour subvenir convenablement à leurs besoins, elle a entamé en 2004 le commerce d’habits pour bébés et enfants. Cette activité est très rentable pour elle , elle exerce son commerce au grand marché de Lomé et elle est très connue. Voulant agrandir son commerce et la diversifier avec la vente de chaussures pour bébé, elle sollicite de WAGES son second crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter de nouveaux vêtements pour enfants de même que des chaussures.
texts.en:
This is a lady who is a resident of KLIKAME, which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. She is a widow and has her two children to support. To provide appropriately for their needs, she started doing commerce in 2004 in clothing for babies and children. This business is very profitable for her. She operates at the grand marketplace of Lomé, and she is well-known. Wanting to expand her business and to diversify it by selling shoes for babies, she's requesting her second loan from WAGES that will enable her to buy new clothing for children, as well as shoes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes for babies

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.en:
Felicia L. is a group coordinator for the group called “Mujeres Victoriosas,” which means “Victorious Women.”  Felicia is the owner of a business selling clothing in her local community.  Felicia has four grown children and four grandchildren—three of which live with her.  Felicia’s dream for her business is that of all entrepreneurs: to grow.  She hopes to earn enough profit to provide a better life for her grandchildren and to support them in their studies.  Along with her grandchildren, Felicia lives with her partner, Luis Emilio.  In her free time, Felicia enjoys reading the Bible and biographies as well as swimming in the river that is by her house.

After hearing about Esperanza from a friend, Felicia decided to take out her first loan because of the good testimony she heard.  Felicia wants to thank Kiva lenders for this opportunity and said she wants to develop and grow through this experience. 

On behalf of Felicia L., Mujeres Victoriosas, and all of us here at Esperanza International, thanks for your support!

loans.use: To replenish her stock

loans.name: Eden 1 & 3 Group

texts.en:
This group of 10 entrepreneurs from Hato Mayor (northeastern Dominican Republic) is made up of members who are at different stages. For some of these borrowers, this will be their 7th loan with Esperanza International. For some others, just the third. They all express gratitude for having access to a loan that represents an incentive for their businesses that many microentrepreneurs in their area do not have. This helps them keep their businesses going even during these hard times when sales have decreased about 50% for most of them. 

Ana S. is one of the two group representatives. She has 2 children with a large age difference: the eldest is 12 and the youngest is just one year old. Ana sells silver jewelry, mostly at her house but sometimes she takes it with her to show to acquaintances that live in other towns. She would like to have her own jewelry store to avoid traveling with it, which can be dangerous if someone knows about the merchandise you sell. She also hopes to be able to return to school one day and have a house of her own for herself and her children. Please help us continue supporting these microentrepreneurs with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase silver jewelry

loans.name: Maritza Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Maritza R. se dedica a atender su negocio de pulpería en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino ofreciendo todo tipo de productos tales como comestibles y productos del hogar.  

Actualmente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los granos básicos ya que se le han agotado y requiere ofrecerlos. Es de importancia destacar que antes de dedicarse a este negocio ella era ama de casa pero ahora ha mejorado su condición por medio de su negocio y por esto es que espera confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado para continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maritza Rodriguez runs a small neighborhood grocery store in Sandino City, offering all kinds of products, from foods to products for the home. Today she has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan for the purchase of staple grains because she has run out and she absolutely needs to offer them. This is very important, since before starting this store she was a house wife, but now she has greatly improved her situation through this business. She hopes and trusts that this loan will be approved so that she may continue her work.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of staple grains

loans.name: René Antonio

texts.es:
El joven René S. es una persona muy trabajadora ya  que se dedica a atender su negocio de pulpería en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino donde se desempeña arduamente buscando la manera de salir adelante en su negocio y mantener a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge e hijos.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel habiendo solicitado un crédito para la compra de los productos y así ofrecerlos en su localidad para continuar con su negocio de pulpería que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
The young Rene S. is a hard-working person, and works in his shop in the city of Sandino. He is always looking for ways to get ahead in his business, and to support his family consisting of his spouse and children. These days he has gone to Ceprodel requesting a loan in order to purchase products and offer them in his town so he can continue with his shop, which requires investment.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Ana Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Ana G. se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos varios ofrecidos en su propia pulpería que posee en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua.

Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy esforzada que ha logrado salir adelante llevando el sustento a su humilde familia que tiene a su responsabilidad. Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los productos por la razón de que se le han agotado y requiere invertir en ellos. Espera muy confiadamente en Ceprodel y son sus sueños desarrollarse en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana G. works in her own shop and sells various products in the municipality of Sandino, in Managua. She has been characterized as a very focused person who has succeeded in getting ahead, and carrying her humble family, which is her responsibility. Today she has gone to Ceprodel to obtain a loan in order to purchase products, as her stock has run out, and she needs to invest in more products. She has much hope in Ceprodel, and her dream is to develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino, la señora Maribel Z. se ha desempeñado en su actividad de pulpería el cual ella posee en su localidad atendiendo todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Ella  es una dama con un gran espíritu de superación y es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los productos comestibles como granos básicos y bebidas para así comercializarlos en su negocio y salir adelante.
texts.en:
In the city of Sandino, Ms. Maribel Z. works in her own shop, and attends to customers everyday beginning early in the morning. She is a lady with a grand spirit of improvement, and for this reason she came to Ceprodel to get a loan in order to buy foodstuffs - such as basic grains and drinks - so that she can sell them and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Leonardo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo L. se dedica a su actividad de zapatería en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua. Él se ha caracterizado por ser un excelente trabajador y conocedor de este ramo de zapatería siendo visitado por sus clientes para que el señor L. le repare los zapatos.

Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de materiales de trabajo que le permitan llevar a cabo su actividad. Estos materiales son hilos, pegamento, cuero, agujas, entre otros. Espera muy confiadamente sabiendo que su crédito será otorgado y así saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Mr. Leonardo L. works as a cobbler in the municipality of Sandino in Managua city. He has been characterized as an excellent worker, and is well-known by the many clients who come to him to have their shoes fixed. He is currently looking for support from Ceprodel, in order to buy work materials that will help him improve his business. These materials include thread, glue, leather, and needles. He has a lot of faith and knows that his loan will be granted and allow him to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase work materials

loans.name: Tamaraneh Ii Group

texts.en:
This is Safie J. and Zainab K.. They named their group Tamaraneh, a Temne phrase for “let us help each other.”  They are local entrepreneurs in Makeni, the northern provincial city. This is not their first loan from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have tremendously impacted the lives and businesses of these entrepreneurs. Out of their businesses, these ladies are able to look after themselves and their children. Their businesses are their only way of making a living. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le I,200,000 each to further strengthen their business. 

Safie J. (right) is the leader of the group. She is fifty years of age. She was born in Makeni city, in north Sierra Leone. Her husband is the town crier. She has five children, three are already adults and two are in high school. Safie sells market food. She sells onions, vegetable oil, tomatoes, sugar, etc. She has been a businesswoman for over thirty years now.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar A. D. O. D. 52 años D. edad resiD. en San Luis Talpa junto a sus 3 hijos dos D. ellos estudiantes menores D. edad y el mayor el cual trabaja para pagar sus propios gastos el cual tiene 21 años D. edad. Pilar posee una tienda D. productos perecederos en su propia casa, ella desea obtener un préstamo a través del cual pueda aumentar los productos D. su tienda, ya que dicho negocio es la principal entrada económica que posee. Es por esto que ella desea surtir su tienda para obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales contribuyan a una mejor economía familiar.
texts.en:
Pilar A. D. O. is 52 years old, and lives in San Luis Talpa with her 3 children. Two of her children are young students, and her oldest child (21 years old) works in order to pay his own bills. Pilar has a perishable goods shop in her home. She desires to obtain a loan, with which she would be able to increase her store's inventory, as her shop provides her principal income. That is why she would like to improve her stock and earn more income, which would improve her family's economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new products for her shop

location.town: San Luis Talpa,  departamento de La Paz.

loans.name: Tagbaneh Traders Group

texts.en:
This is Theresa R. K., Ya Bom K. and Iyebah T.. They named their group Tagbaneh Traders. They are local entrepreneurs in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs have accessed several loans from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a lot of developments in the lives of these businesswomen. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 800,000 for each in order to further strengthen their businesses.

Theresa (right) is the leader of the group. She is 52 and was born in Makeni city. She is married with six children, four of whom are already grown-ups while two are in tertiary institutions. Theresa sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), vegetable oil and gara lappers (locally dyed clothes, sometimes with fabricated designs). She has been a businesswoman since her childhood days. With this loan, Theresa will be able to expand her business. She will be able to buy at least 20 barters (five gallons make a barter) of palm-oil and two “pieces” of “brillian” (30 yards make a piece and a brillian is the white cotton used in producing the gara lappers).

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Tawopaneh Ii Group

texts.en:
This is Beatrice C., Alice S., Fatmata K., Memuna K. and Mohamed J. L.. They named their group Tawopaneh II, a Temne phrase for "let us help each other."

These entrepreneurs have received several loans from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made many meaningful impacts on their lives. Their businesses grew, sales increased, and their standard of living also improved. Having repaid their last loan, they are now requesting a new loan of 800,000 SLL apiece, to further strengthen their individual businesses.

Beatrice (second from left), 42 years old, is the group's leader. She was born in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and they have four children, who are all still in primary and secondary schools. 

Beatrice sells a variety of items in the town's main market. She sells provisions, cooking oil, "margi" tomatoes, onions, and so on. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying more goods to add to her current stock. She buys her goods from Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone (372 miles round trip).

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Marta Milagro

texts.es: Marta Milagro B. D. L. D. 53 años D. edad, resiD. en San Pedro Masahuat junto a su esposo. Ella posee un comedor llamado “Comedor Karlita”, en el cual venD. frutas, jugos, comida entre otras cosas más. Dicho negocio lo posee desD. hace 36 años  y es muy querida por las personas del lugar, es por esto que cuenta con muchos clientes. Milagro desea obtener un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el capital necesario para comprar materia prima para los platillos que realiza, esto con el fin D. poder brindar mayor variedad a sus clientes D. manera que ella sea la única a la que prefieran en el lugar. Así también desea aumentar sus ventas, ya que este negocio es la única fuente económica que posee ya que su esposo trabaja junto a ella atendiendo el comedor y ambos sobreviven D. las ganancias D. este.
texts.en:
Marta Milagro B. L. is 53 years old, and lives in San Pedro Masahuat with her husband. She owns a diner called "Karlita Dining", which sells fruit, juices, and food among other things. Marta has had this business for 36 years, which is loved by local people, and that's why she has so many customers. Marta wants to get a loan, which would proviD. the capital necessary to buy raw materials for the dishes she makes. This would allow her to proviD. a greater variety to her customers so that they will prefer to continue eating in her restaurant. She also wants to increase her sales, because this business is her only source of income. Her husband works with her serving guests in the dining room, and both live off of the profits from the restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products for her restaurant

location.town: San Pedro Masahuat, Departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Kalump Group

texts.en:
This is Sheik Ibrahim K., Mamusu K. and Bassie T.. Sheik Ibrahim K. (pictured in the middle) is the leader of the group. He has been a businessman and farmer since childhood. Sheik Ibrahim sells a number of items, including sugar, cigarettes, biscuits, mints, toothbrushes, pastes, and so on. He is 55-years of age. His wife is a businesswoman. Sheik Ibrahim K. has 16 children, all of whom are still in primary and secondary schools. He was born in Pat fu village, five miles from Makeni. Sheik Ibrahim will use this loan to further expand on his business.

This group is named Kalump, a Temne word for truthfulness. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Makump village, about five miles from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. These previous loans have had meaningful impact on the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They've also been able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Now, they are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 leones each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

loans.use: To buy goods for retail

loans.name: Teodocio

texts.es:
Teodocio  vive, en la avenida Bolivar,  de la zona Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

Se dedica a la confección de gorras y sombreros, los cuales los envía a la localidad del desaguadero para su posterior venta.
El vivo junto a sus hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar y colaboran a nivel de ventas al por menor en la ciudad de la paz 

 El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de materia prima como ser tela y viseras 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Teodocio lives on Bolivar avenue, in the Rio Seco zone in El Alto city. He makes hats and sombreros for a living, which he ships to an outlet where they are sold. He lives with his kids, who are of school age, and help him sell his hats in La Paz city. Teodocio will use his loan to acquire raw materials such as cloth and visors. This is his first loan with Impro, whose evaluation certifies Teodocio as a qualified recipient.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Tagbaneh Group

texts.en:
This is Ejiatu J., Fatu K. and Jariatu K.. Ejiatu (in the middle) is the leader of the group. Ejiatu sells cooking oil, flour, margi and so on at the Makeni city market. She buys her goods from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city, where commodities are relatively cheap. She has been a businesswoman for many years. Ejiatu will combine this loan with her current business capital to buy ten bags of sugar and ten bags of salt. A bag of sugar is sold at 100,000 leones and a bag of salt costs 20,000 leones.

Ejiatu is 45-years of age. She is married to a farmer and they have eight children. Seven of their children are still in primary and secondary schools and the eldest is now a grown-up. She was born in Sanda, a series of small towns about 30 miles from Makeni city.  

This group is named Tagbaneh. The members are local entrepreneurs in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs have accessed several loans from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have promoted development in the lives of these businesswomen. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 leones each in order to further strengthen their businesses.

loans.use: To buy bags of sugar and salt

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco  vive, en la calle Luquisañi,  de la zona Juana Azurduy de Padilla zona periférica de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposa y sus pequeños hijos en su casita propia donde tiene instalado su pequeño taller de confección de buzos deportivos los cuales los vende en el Desaguadero frontera limítrofe con la Republica del Peru

Su esposa es ama de casa, pero, colabora en la comercialización de las prendas en las ferias  de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
 El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de materiales como ser telas de y asi incrementar su producción.
 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Francisco lives on Luquisañi street in the Juana Azurduy de Padilla area in the outskirts of El Alto. He lives with his wife and his small children. In his home, he has a small workshop for making tracksuits, which he sells in Desaguadero, a town on the border with Peru. His wife is a homemaker but also helps to sell the garments in the El Alto farmers' markets.

This loan will be used to purchase materials such as cloth so he can increase his output. This is his first loan with Impro. Impro conducted an evaluation of his business and approved his request for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Cristóbal   vive, en la avenida America,  de la zona Villa Bolívar de la ciudad de El Alto.

Es un joven trabajador dependiente en una empresa exportadora de muebles de calidad. Donde  se desempeña en el sector armado.
 

 El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de materiales  para la continuidad de la construcción de su domicilio. 
 
Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Cristóbal lives on America Avenue in the Villa Bolívar area in the city of El Alto. He is a hardworking young man employed by a company that exports high-quality furniture. Cristóbal works in the department responsible for making the furniture items.

This loan will be used to purchase materials so that he can continue to build his home. This is his fourth loan with Impro. Impro evaluated his situation and approved his request for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Rakomdin Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu K., Morlai S. and Sema S.. Isatu K. (in the middle) is the leader of this group. Isatu sells a variety of items including salt, onions, sugar, batteries, bars of soap, tomatoes, toothbrushes and pastes, and so on. She has been a businesswoman since childhood. 

Isatu is 55-years of age. She is married to a tailor and they have seven children. Three of her children are already grown-ups and four are still in school. She was born in Mafore, in Gbendenhu Nguwahu chiefdon in northern Sierra Leone.

This group is named Rakomdin, a Temne phrase meaning "One Family." This is not the first loan this group has received from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a major impact on the lives of these entrepreneurs. Having repaid their previous loans successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of 700,000 leones each. With these loans, they will be able to expand on their businesses, make more profit and thereby improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To expand on a retail business

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionicia  vive, en la Calle Viracocha,  de la zona Tahuantinsuyo de la ciudad de El Alto.

Realiza trabajos de bordados en su taller ubicado en su domicilio.

Vive junto a sus hijos los cuales ya son jóvenes y le colaboran en su trabajo  y comercialización. 

 El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de materiales de construcción y habilitar un espacio vació que posee en su casa. como parte de su taller done realizar trazados mas cómodamente. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Dionicia lives on Viracocha Street in the Tahuantinsuyo district in the city of El Alto. She makes embroidered items in a workshop in her home. She lives with her young children who help her to make and sell her creations.

This loan will be used to purchase construction materials to convert an empty section of her house into an additional workshop space. In the new workshop, she will feel more comfortable making her designs. This is her first loan with Impro. Impro conducted an evaluation of her business and approved her request for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: La señora  ELVIRA C. y su esposo Félix Churqui, tienen cuatro pequeños hijos a quienes educan con su trabajo, mucha dedicación y cariño. Ellos viven en su domicilio de la calle: Chocalla # 2674  en la zona Huayna Potosí, en la populosa ciudad de El Alto de La Paz. La señora Elvira se dedica a la venta de ropa en la feria 16 de julio no tiene  puesto fijo, es ambulante ella se acomoda al lugar que puede. La pareja actualmente viven en la casa de la madre del esposo, su mayor deseo es tener su casa propia en un futuro. La señora es nueva en la institución este es su primer crédito, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una maquina de coser para confeccionar sus propias prendas de vestir para la venta, su esposo es chofer asalariado y esta en el sindicato litoral trabaja todos los días para colaborar a su familia, ellos comparten los gastos de la familia. El mayor deseo de ellos es poder darles a su hijo una buena educación para que en un futuro sean personas de bien y responsables.
texts.en:
Elvira C. and her husband Félix Churqui have four small children whom they raise with dedication and care. They live in the Huayna Potosí zone in the populous city of El Alto de La Paz.

Elvira sells clothing at the 16 de julio market. She doesn't have a permanent stand and hawks her products wherever she finds space. The couple currently lives in her husband's mother's house. She hopes to own her own home in her future.

Elvira is new to the organization and this is her first loan. The loan will be used to purchase a sewing machine so she can both make and sell garments.

Her husband is a salaried driver and a union member. He works everyday to earn money for his family. Elvira and her husband share the household expenses. Their biggest desire is to give their children a good education so that they can become good and responsible people.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Paola Sobeidy

texts.es:
Paola, vive en la Avenida Buenos Aires de la zona Villa Yunguyo en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive  en la casa de sus padres, Ella es madre soltera tiene una pequeña hija de 2 años de edad.
 
Se dedica al comercio mediante una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que posee en el lugar donde vive. 


El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, y así mejorar sus ingresos

Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Paola lives on Buenos Aires Avenue in the Villa Yunguyo zone in the city of El Alto. She is a single mother with a 2 -year-old daughter and lives in her parents' home. Paola owns and operates a small grocery store in her neighborhood. This loan will be used to purchase additional merchandise so she can increase her income. This is her first loan with Impro. Impro conducted an evaluation of her business and approved her request for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry  vive, en el callejón 8,  de la zona Villa Esperanza de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposa en la casa de sus padres,
 
Trabaja juntamente con su esposa  en el comercio minorista, de manera ambulante,  de Discos Compactos. DVD y otros  en las diferentes ferias zonales de la ciudad.
 
 El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de mercadería y así diversificar su oferta. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Henry lives on 8th Street in the Villa Esperanza zone in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife in his parents' house. Both he and his wife hawk CDs, DVDs and other items at farmers' markets around the city. This loan will be used to purchase additional merchandise and diversify their product selection. This is his first loan with Impro. Impro conducted an evaluation of his business and approved his request for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: La señora  EMMA C. Q. y su esposo Mauro Saavedra, tienen tres pequeños hijos a quienes educan con su trabajo,  Ellos viven en su domicilio que es anticrítico de la calle: Panamá # 336  en la zona Alto Lima 2da sección, la ciudad de El Alto. La señora Emma se dedica a la venta de aceite de cocinar  es ambulante vende por las cercanias de su domicilio, ella se acomoda en el lugar que puede. La pareja actualmente viven en anticrítico ellos quieren comprar una casa para mas adelante. La señora es nueva en la institución este es su primer crédito, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de 3 túrriles para la venta al raleo (por menor) y por mayor, su esposo es chofer asalariado, esta  afiliado al sindicato San Cristóbal trabaja todos los días para colaborar a su familia, ellos comparten los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Emma C. Q. and her husband Mauro Saavedra work hard to raise their three small children. They live in the Alto Lima zone in the city of El Alto. Emma sells cooking oil in the neighboring areas. She does not have a permanent location and sells her products wherever she finds available space. Emma and her husband hope to one day purchase their own home.

Emma is new to the organization and this is her first loan. This loan will be used to purchase 3 drums of oil. They plan to sell the oil in small quantities and wholesale. Her husband is a salaried driver and is a member of the San Cristóbal Union. He works everyday to earn money for his family. Emma and her husband share the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drums of cooking oil

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
